loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a biogas system to cook with clean, green cooking fuel

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in Mweru, in Central Kenya. She started farming 7 years ago as a means of growing food and earning income for her family. The business has grown from nothing to having 2 pigs, 3 sheep, 4 dairy cows, and 5 head of poultry. Betty also grows crops for food, for feed, and for sale. With all these sources of income, one of Betty's major challenges is transportation of the produce to market. 

Betty is seeking a loan to buy a motorcycle. With your help, the motorcycle will provide a cheap, versatile, and convenient solution to the transportation problem Betty is facing. A motorcycle is ideal for transportation of passengers and goods over short distances, and on rural roads impassable by cars. The motorcycle will also enable Betty to reach further markets and widen her network of clients.
 
Returns from this investment will be used to settle debt consolidated in monthly instalments. Additional income from this investment will help Betty grow her business, and improve the lives of her family and people around her.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena, her husband and son live in Saratak village in the Shirak region. Her two daughters are married and live separately.

Yelena and her husband are farmers with many years of experience. They keep sheep, calves and hens, and they also cultivate wheat, potatoes and garlic.

As Yelena's children grew up, the family needed more and more resources to make ends meet. All of their available resources were used for family living expenses, so nothing remained to invest in a farm. Yelena asks for this loan to purchase potato seeds (1 ton) and fertilizer, and to make her farming business more profitable.

Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs creates a number of difficulties for people trying to develop their businesses in the Shirak region. Yelena's loan has been approved through the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of the Shirak region, in order to help them to gain market access and earn a living.

Yelena and her family members hope for lenders' support, so that they will be able to enlarge their potato cultivation and earn more income for living expenses.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds (1 ton) and fertilizer in order to increase potato cultivation and earn income for the family

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is a 26-year-old man from the Kobuleti district. There are 7 members in his family, and they are involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have cows and produce dairy products. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and nut trees. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with a Kiva and Credo, has enabled him to get a loan of 6,000 GEL. With the loan, Gocha will start a trading business. He will purchase some stock of laurel leaves to resell. Gocha will be able to generate his own income, and will be able to help his large family financially.

loans.use: to begin a trade selling laurel leaves

loans.name: Selman

texts.en:
Selman is a woodworker.

“I love what I do and I’ve been doing this for the past six years. My father passed on to me his talents. Watching him from the very young age make me desire this profession. I believe that if you’re passionate about something, then you are good at that thing. I make furniture, I make doors and windows and I make kitchen cabinets upon customers’ requests,” said Selman, smiling and content.

Selman is 56 and married and has two children. They live in a little town in the north and this is where he has been running his shop; he is the only woodworker in the town and villages around whose shop has survived so far, according to him.

Selman needs your financial help because he wants to replace some equipment that broke some time back and has caused him to fall behind on orders.

loans.use: to replace some broken equipment needed in his profession.

loans.name: Qorihuayrachina Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “QORIHUAYRACHINA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maritza ella es casada y tiene 28 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales y tambien la socia se dedica al negocio de agricultura, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias,la socia es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora que por medio de estos pequeños negocios la socia quiere sacar adelante a sus hijos, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes,patos y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes,patos y gallinas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the "Qorihuayrachina" communal bank live in Chinchero district, which is part of Urubamba province and Cusco department.

The member, Maritza is 28, married, and has two children. She sells raises and sells animals and also farms. She raises guinea pigs and chickens, raising them and fattening them and later selling them in various markets.

She is a hard-working and determined woman, who by means of these small businesses is helping her children get ahead in life. Her dream is to have a sales outlet where she can sell guinea pigs and chickens. The member is applying for the loan in order to buy guinea pigs, ducks and chickens, as well as feed for them.

She is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs, chickens, and feed for these animals. The other members work at businesses selling candy, selling clothes, a grocery store, and a restaurant business. The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream in this way. She promises to make her installment payments on time.

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs, ducks and chickens, as well as feed for them.

loans.name: Murmani

texts.en:
Murmani is a 56-year-old single man, from the village of Tskhunkuri. He lives with his pensioner mother and brother.

All of the family members are temporarily unemployed and live in poverty, having no source of income. In spite of his high education, Murmani is unable to find a stable job, so he decided to make income from a business and requested a loan. His prior loan requests were rejected time and again because of his lack of an income source and his family’s poor living conditions.

Murmani requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions. The program is for poor, rural people who can't access credit products because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” due to their low income.

With the credit he received, Murmani will renovate the flat, which is located in a neighborhood which is very popular with tourists. After renovating, Murmani will rent it at a good rate to generate significant income.

Through the new business initiative financed with the Kiva startup loan, Murmani will get the chance to generate his own income and the family will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To renovate the flat and rent it to tourists

loans.name: Mairamgul

texts.ru: Майрамгул, 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. У Майрамгул среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она уже 5 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Майрамгул, на сегодняшний день она выращивает люцерну. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет около 19,000 сом (KGS). Майрамгул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Майрамгул намерена расширить свой бизнес, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи и позволит построить дополнительные сараи для скота.
texts.en: Mairamgul is 45 years old and she is married with two children, one of whom is in school and one who is not yet of school age.  Mairamgul has a high school education and she grows crops and raises livestock as the main source of income for her family.  She has been doing this for five years and thanks to her hard work, focus and diligence, Mairamgul now grows lucerne and her farm has two cows and eight sheep.  Her monthly income from this business is about 19,000 som (KGS) per month.  Mairamgul has turned to Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.  She intends to expand her business so she can increase her working capital and be able to build a barn for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Claudia Marisela

texts.es:
Claudia, es propietaria de una venta de productos de primera necesidad, vive con su compañero de vida y su hija, son una familia unida y todos cooperan en atender a sus clientes, lo fundo hace 4 años por la necesidad de tener más recursos económicos para cubrir las necesidades familiares.
Necesita un financiamiento para tener un mejor inventario, comprará papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, detergentes, jabón, golosinas, bebidas, etc., le ayudara a tener un negocio más competitivo, Claudia espera que su inversión le dé resultados positivos y que pueda disminuir las demandas de sus clientes.
Su visión es tener un negocio más  rentable y que su familia tenga un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia owns a store where she sells staple products.  She lives with her life partner and her daughter.  They're a close family and everyone helps wait on her customers.  She started the business four years ago because she needed to have more income to cover the family necessities.

She needs a loan to have more inventory.  She's going to buy toilet paper, sanitary napkins, detergent, soap, snacks, beverages, and so on.

This will help her to have a more competitive business.  She hopes her investment will yield positive results and that she'll be able to satisfy her customer demand.

Claudia's dream is to have a more profitable business and for her family to have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy toilet paper, sanitary napkins, detergent, soap, snacks, beverages, and so on, to help her have a more competitive business

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a 30-year-old woman who does what she can to support her family. She lives in an upland village called Inoi, which is in the Kerugoya valley. The only activity to speak of for Inoi residents is livestock farming. Ann keeps cattle and poultry on her farm. Her primary income sources are milk, a variety of food crops, and eggs. 

Ann’s agribusiness has been profitable for five years. She is very contented with farming, not only as an economic activity, but also as a lifestyle. Today she is seeking a loan to purchase poultry in order to expand her business. With your loan, Ann will make enough income from the investment to repay the loan and better her living. The brood of hens she plans to acquire will produce more eggs for her to sell. They will also help aerate soil and break vegetation in her farm as they scratch the earth trying to find bugs. The additional income will be timely as her children’s education expenses keep increasing. The loan will also help her family to enjoy the security of having the food that they need.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 32-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is the father of one son and one daughter. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Abdallah wants to improve the family's living conditions and buy all the needed stuff. Abdallah took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the house. This will provide the family with clean water. Abdallah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the house.

loans.name: Eleminah

texts.en:
Elimina is a 47-year-old married woman who is taking care of seven children and has been operating a cereals shopping stall for a period of four years, earning herself an income of KES 8,000 at the end of every month.

Elimina is now servicing her KES 20,000 loan with VisionFund Kenya and intends to purchase more dried maize and bean cereals to sell to her customers.  

The profits earned will be used to used to expand her grocery stall business and educate her children. Elimina hopes to become a successful business woman with a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase dried maize and millets to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Meet Lilian, a diligent rural dairy farmer from Kianjogo village in Central Kenya. Lilian owns a 2.25 acre farm in Kianjogo where she farms and lives with her husband and four children. Two of her children are in boarding schools, making school fees her single biggest annual expense. She has been able to rely on farming for the last 24 years as a source of income.

Lilian is seeking a KES 100,000 loan to purchase a good quality dairy cow. She already has 2 dairy cows along with 2 goats and 7 heads of poultry. Lilian also grows tea, maize, bananas and vegetables. She transports all of her produce on a motorcycle to Kiriti local market. The motorcycle generates extra income from transportation of other farmers' produce and ferrying of passengers.

With your loan investment, the additional cow is estimated to create a 40% increase in the volume of milk production on her farm. Additional income from this investment will enable her to repay the loan and invest more in her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Sumac Quilla Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SUMAC QUILLA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dina ella es casada y tiene 28 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de arquitectura,la socia tiene una oficina donde hace trabajos en arquitectura como planos de casas y edificios,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este trabajo y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su ofina de arquitectura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de computadoras, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de internet.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Sumac Quilla”. This bank is located in the District of Cusco in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

One of the members is Sra. Dina. She is 28 years old, married, and works at her architecture business. She has an office where she draws up plans for houses and buildings. Dina works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. She has been in this occupation for several years and is doing very well. Her dream is to expand her architecture practice. She is requesting a loan in order to buy a television for her house.

The other members have businesses that involve selling computers, selling clothes, selling groceries, and providing Internet services.

Dina is grateful to those who have helped her to fulfill her dream in this manner, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 2 años, y su negocio es la venta de huevo por mayor.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, independiente, constante, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la feria ‘urkupiña’ una feria popular de la ciudad, cientos de comerciantes en todas las áreas se reúnen para ofertar sus productos, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Juana es de tez, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua nativa es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que efectúa. Su vida la realiza en compañía de su pareja que se dedica al transporte y con su hijo que esta empezando la escuela. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de huevo por mayor. Ella se encarga de comprar huevo a las empresas avícolas, para repartirlo a los diferentes comercios, como; panaderías, tiendas de barrio, restaurantes, mercados, etc., actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado durante el día. “el huevo se utiliza casi para todo, por eso tengo clientes fijos y constantes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su pareja le ayuda a realizar la venta, y la desventaja es que no cuenta con un vehículo propio para repartir el producto,  Su sueño es abrir una granja avícola, ella desea realizar la compra de huevo por mayor para distribuir a nuevos clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para la compra de huevo por mayor para distribuir a nuevos clientes y abrir una granja avícola.
texts.en:
Juana is a 35-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has a two-year-old son. Her business involves selling eggs in bulk. Juana is a good mother who is enterprising, independent, steadfast, responsible, and hardworking. She conducts her business at the Urkupiña fair, which is one the most popular in the city since hundreds of merchants from all areas gather there to offer their products. The weather in this area is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies throughout the day between 0 and 12 degree Celsius.

Juana has long black braided hair, brown eyes, a short stature, and a thin physique. She wears traditional garments (hat, shawl, and skirt). Her native language is Aymará, which she speaks with her family, but she also speaks Spanish as part of the general culture and to carry out her business. She shares her life with her partner, who works in transportation, and their son who is just starting school. They live in a brick and cement house with a metal sheet roof. Their home receives running water, electricity, and sewage service. Her business involves selling eggs in bulk. Juana buys the eggs from poultry companies and then delivers them to different businesses such as bakeries, neighborhood stores, restaurants, markets, and other establishments. She operates her business all day, Monday through Saturday. “All most everyone uses eggs, so I have established regular customers,” says Juana. Her advantage is that her partner is able to help with running the business. However, her disadvantage is that she does not have a vehicle of her own for delivering her product. Her dream is to open a poultry farm. She wants to buy eggs in bulk so that she can distribute them to new customers. This is her first loan cycle with Emprender. Juana has been operating her business for one year.

For the reasons previously mentioned, Juana is requesting a loan in order to buy eggs in bulk so that she can distribute them to her new customers. She will also open a poultry farm.

loans.use: to buy eggs in bulk that she can distribute to her new customers and to start a poultry farm.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce lives in Litein, Kenya with her family. Joyce passionately loves dairy farming. The biggest challenge she faces is satisfying the overwhelming demand for milk in her village.

She is seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. She believes that, through the loan, she will be able to improve her living conditions and be able to secure the future of her children.

Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, she is confident that the skills she acquired will help her increase her business and she will be able to pay back the loan. Joyce is confident that if you invest in her dream you will be impacting the lives of her family members and children.

Invest in this heroine who works tirelessly for the betterment of her life.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Indira

texts.ru: Индира успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, помогшим ей в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду и грамотному подходу к организации бизнеса, в хозяйстве Индиры на сегодняшний день имеется корова. Также есть арендованный земельный надел мерою 3,0 ГА и собственный - 0,50 ГА, где выращивается фасоль. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Индира вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 6 овец для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Индира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Indira successfully paid off her first loan, which she used for its intended purposes.  The is grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone who gave her financial support.  Thanks to her hard work and business savvy, Indira's farm now has a cow.  She also has a .3-hectare plot of land and her own .5-hectare plot on which she grows beans.  Her monthly income is about 20,000 som (KGS).  With the goal of developing her business further, Indira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy six sheep to increase her head of livestock.  Indira plans to use the income from this loan to further increase her head of livestock.

loans.use: to purchase six sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Medera

texts.ru: Медера, 31 год, в разводе, мать 3 детей, двое школьники, сын дошкольного возраста. У Медеры среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве Медеры есть корова, 10 овец, также в аренде земельный надел, мерою 0,5 ГА, где она сажает ячмень для реализации. Также Медера реализует молоко и молочную продукцию. Дополнительно занимается торговлей товаров повседневного спроса. Вся продукция пользуется большим спросом и приносит прибыль в размере около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Семья берется за любую работу, так как доходов не хватает на достойную жизнь, поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Медера обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение товаров в обороте. Доходы от кредита Медера планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего бизнеса, а также в будущем хочет накопить средства на ремонт магазина.
texts.en: Medera is 31 years old and she is divorced with three children, two of whom are in school and a son who is not yet of school age.  Medera has a high school education and she does farm work as the main source of income for her family.  She started this business in 2010 with 15,000 som (KGS) and her farm has one cow and ten sheep, as well as a .5-hectare rented plot of land on which she grows barley for resale.  Medera also sells milk and dairy products and she earns extra money by selling consumer goods.  All of her products are in high demand and they bring her an income of about 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  Her family will take on any job, as their income is not enough for their living expenses, which is why Medera has turned to Bai Tushum bank with the goal of developing her business further.  She is asking for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase her turnover of goods.  She plans to reinvest the income from the loan back into her business, and she also wants to save up money to make repairs on her shop in the future.

loans.use: to increase the turnover of clothes in her shop in order to attract new clients and increase her income

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en: Naziran is a 41-year-old woman. She is a housewife and looks after her family which consists of two sons and three daughters. Her husband owns a sanitary items sale shop. He has been running a sanitary items shop for the last five years. He sells a variety of sanitary items like pvc pipes, wash basins, bracket pairs for wash basins, lead (solid), looking glass, etc. in his shop. He requires some amount to enhance his business, so Naziran made contact to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC staff visited her husband's sanitary shop and issued a loan. Naziran is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's sanitary shop.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is 30 years old. He is married and lives with his wife in the Marneuli district. 

Enlur takes orders and paints houses. He has decided to start a taxi business and requested a loan to purchase a car.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,000 USD. With the loan, he will purchase a car and will serve local people as a taxi driver. This will give Elnur a chance to generate stable income.

loans.use: to purchase a car and start a taxi business

loans.name: Faith Group

texts.en:
Filesi thanks Kiva for the previous loan that they granted her.  She used the loan to purchase clothes for her shop and other new commodities. 

Filesi is requesting another loan to purchase more materials, as she intends to greatly increase her business.

Filesi used the previous profits to pay school fees for her children and to buy school materials. She plans to further expand her business and hopes to buy a second-hand vehicle for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more types of food to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish for his customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruits, baked goods, and other products.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo número 4º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores podrán mejorar cada día.
La Sra. Marta, es una de las integrantes de este grupo, ella vende prendas de todo tipo, y con ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella quiere dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones, y es por ello que se esfuerza mucho y quiere seguir capacitándose.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de jeans, remeras, camisas, pantalones, y otros, con lo cual podrá cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes e ir creciendo poco a poco con su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
The group “Kuña Guapa" is in its fourth loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another so that they can get ahead. The members have taken the poverty elimination survey, which contains 50 indicators that will help them to improve each day.

Sra. Marta is one of the members of this group. She sells clothing of all types. Her business provides the means by which she can help her family and her loved ones. She would like to provide her family a decent life without deprivation. For this reason, she does her best and wants to continue to receive training.

Marta is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of jeans, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, and other garments in order to fulfill her customers’ orders. As a result, she can grow a little bit at a time through her efforts.

loans.use: to buy jeans, T-shirts, shirts, trousers, and other garments.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia esta estudiando la carrera de administración de empresas, y por medio de su conocimiento adquirido quiere poder ayudar a las personas y poder ser un profesional exitoso para ser alguien en la vida. Comenta que su préstamo anterior de kiva lo uso en poder pagar sus clases de la universidad.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas de la carrera, y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Claudia is studying for a degree in Business Administration. With the knowledge that she will acquire, Claudia wants to help people and become a successful professional in order to make something out of her life. She says that her previous Kiva loan was used to pay for her university classes.

Today she is requesting a new loan so that she can pay her degree fees once again. As a result, she will be able to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La socia Florencia continua dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia  Florencia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes.
La socia Florencia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.

La socia Florencia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Florencia continues to raise small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has been in business for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. By working in this manner, she is able to help her family get ahead.

Florencia is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy guinea pigs. She is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay”, which is affiliated with Asociación Arariwa and located in Calca Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

Florencia is grateful and values this loan, so she promises to complete her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is a 29-year-old single lady who owns a motorcycle for transport which has raised income for her family. She also supplements her income by earning a salary.

She dreams of improving her standards of living, buying many motorcycles, and making more profits after testing the business profits.

Grace will use the credit to buy another motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a smallholder dairy farmer based in Mwihoko village, located in the Nyahururu area of Kenya. Grace got married three years ago and delivered her first baby 19 months ago. Her transition to being a family-oriented woman has not contained her determination to grow her agri-business enterprise.

Grace is seeking a loan investment from Kiva lenders to acquire a high yielding dairy cow. Currently, Grace owns two dairy cows and with your help, she will acquire the third one. The new cow will increase the quantity of milk available for sale by nearly 40%. This will have a significant boost in Grace's family income. Besides dairy farming, Grace is also into poultry farming, though it is for subsistence purposes only. 

Income from this new investment will enable Grace to take great care of her infant child and her loving husband.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kimet

texts.en:
With the previous loan, Kimet bought a little trailer for his tractor.  Some months back he sold that because he needed a bigger one and this is where your financial help will go this time. 

In the meantime, Kimet wants to thank his previous lenders and the potential lenders this time. This past year, Kimet planted not only potatoes and barley as usual, but he also added corn, wheat and onions.

loans.use: to buy a trailer and plug for his agricultural tractor, as well as pesticides for his plantations.

loans.name: Arpenik

texts.en:
Arpenik is a hard-working farmer from Karmut village in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and three children (two sons and a daughter).

On her farm, Arpenik currently keeps two cows and ten sheep, and also cultivates some vegetables (wheat, potatoes, cabbages and peppers) on the family's own land. 

Arpenik seeks this loan to invest in the farm. All resources available are used for survival, so nothing remains to invest in the farm. She plans to purchase fertilizer, seeds and fuel for the cultivation of vegetables.

Arpenik's loan has been approved through the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region, to help them to gain market access and earn a living. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are quite low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions and high costs create a number of difficulties for people to develop their businesses in the Shirak region.

Arpenik thanks her Kiva lenders in advance, and she anticipates their support.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and fuel for the cultivation of vegetables to sell, so that the family can have better living conditions

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura de aquí a dos años se ve terminando su carrera, y siendo una excelente nutricionista que pueda ayudar a las personas en su salud.
Quiere ser una profesional útil no solo a sí misma, sino también a la sociedad misma, ella sabe qué hace falta profesionales de alta calidad, es por ello que se esfuerza para serlo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Laura is two years away from finishing her degree, which will enable her to become a successful nutritionist who can help people with their health. She wants to become a professional, not only for herself, but also to serve society. Laura knows that there are a lack of high-quality professionals, so she is doing her best to become one.

She is requesting a loan in order to pay her degree fees, which will be a great help for her family.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 30 years old. He is married to Beatrice, who is also a farmer, and they are blessed with three children, aged five, four, and one year. He has had a farming business for 10 years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES. He previously borrowed 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya as his first loan. 

Nelson will be using the loan to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, animal licks, gloves, gum boots, and a sprinkler. He hopes the anticipated profit will help him buy food for his family, pay school fees for his children, cater to family medical care, and pay for transportation of his farm products to the market.     

Nelson's hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable farming business, buy more land for keeping livestock and growing crops, and to live a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, animal licks, gloves, gum boots, and a sprinkler.

loans.name: Amanecer Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Amanecer  está en el ciclo 17 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Pablina ella  es cliente de la Fundación y se desempeña como presidenta del grupo, trabaja como cocinera en un local de comidas muy conocido de la ciudad y también hace comidas sobre pedidos desde su casa,  tiene varias operaciones canceladas.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para elaborar las comidas, como ser verduras, carne, condimentos, hortalizas, y otros, y con ello poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por crecer cada día. Agradece por la oportunidad que todas reciben de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group named “Amanecer” (Dawn) is in its 17th loan cycle with the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members are working and helping one another so that they can get ahead. They have also taken the poverty elimination survey, so that each member can do her best to grow and move forward.

One of the members is Sra. Pablina, who is a client of Fundación Paraguaya and serves as the president of her group. Pablina works as a cook at a very well-known food establishment in the city. She also prepares food upon request at her home. Pablina has several engagements that have ended.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies for making her dishes such as vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, and other items. As a result, she can continue her sales. Pablina strives to grow each day. She is grateful for the opportunity that everyone in her group has received so that they can improve each day.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, condiments, greens, and other supplies.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is an enterprising 42-year-old farmer from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. She is the hardworking, energetic mother of a lovely family. For the past five years she has been a farmer, and has gained a lot of practical experience. Through her farming income, she has always assured her family of a decent meal and other basic needs. 

Esther is now applying for a 80,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo in order to move into horticultural farming. Kerugoya has good weather patterns and conditions that support farming activities. It has good roads and a good transportation network. With these favorable conditions Esther is sure that she will be able to increase her business and reap the maximum in profits. 

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Esther feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. She is very disciplined with her finances, and hopes that through her accumulated profits she will be able to improve her living conditions, and also secure the future of her children. 

Please consider lending to this heroine!

loans.use: To move into horticultural farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for repair work that needs to be done around her house so that her family can live in better conditions.

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.ru: Махабат, 40 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей школьного возраста, они с радостью помогают родителям по хозяйству. У Махабат высшее образование, работает учителем русского языка и литературы в школе. В 2001 году она стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, накопив на старт сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Махабат, на сегодняшний день у нее есть 3 коровы и 30 овец. Также на собственном земельном наделе мерою 2,59 Га она выращивает фасоль для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Махабат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы и 4 овец. Она планирует расширить свой бизнес и накопить средства на постройку дома и сарая.
texts.en: Makhabat, 40 years old, is married and has three school-age children that are happy to help parents with the housework.  Makhabat has higher education and is a teacher of Russian language and literature at school. In 2001, she became involved in livestock to start accumulating the sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Through hard work, today she has three cows and 30 sheep. Also, on her own land allotment measure 2.59 hectares, she grows beans for farm consumption and sale. In order to further develop her business, Makhabat addressed to the Bank "Bai -Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase cows and four sheep. She plans to expand her business and save money to build a house and a barn.

loans.use: to purchase one cow and four sheep for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Osvaldo

texts.es:
Osvaldo esta estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, es una persona que esta esforzándose para poder ser un profesional útil, no solo a si misma, sino también a las demás personas, comenta que su préstamo anterior le fue de mucha ayuda ya que pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera.
Es muy luchador y comenta que su préstamo de ahora lo quiere usar en la cuota de su carrera para poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Osvaldo is studying for a degree in Commercial Engineering. He striving to become a useful professional, not only for himself, but also for other people. Osvaldo says that his previous loan was a great help since he was able to pay his degree fees.

Osvaldo is very determined and says that his current loan will be used for his degree fees so that he can continue his studies.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.es:
El señor Eulogio  tiene 45 años, vive en la ciudad de Caacupé, él se    dedica a la cría de pollos parrilleros, ayudados por colaboradores en el proceso de crías y comercialización.
Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, que vende muchos pollos y que por medio de los ingresos que tiene puede procurarse una mejor vida.
El pide este préstamo para la compra de avena en cantidad que encontró a buen precio, y que le permitirá poder seguir con la cría de sus pollos.
texts.en:
Sr. Eulogio is 45 years old and lives in the city of Caacupé. He raises broiler chickens and has the help of consultants who provide advice on the process of raising and selling the birds.

Eulogio says that he has a very good clientele. He sells many chickens and his income allows him to secure a better life.

Eulogio is requesting this loan so that he can buy oats in bulk in order to get a good price. This will allow him to continue raising his chickens.

loans.use: to buy oats in bulk for feeding his chickens.

loans.name: Samaleswari Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Doupadi, the lady standing first from right, 43, is a married woman who lives in a village in Sonepur district, Odisha with her three teenage children, all of whom are currently studying. Doupadi primarily does stitching work to run the household and support her children's education. However, with the growing needs of her children, she wants to supplement her income. 

Doupadi needs a loan of 20,000 INR to start a vegetable selling business. She wants to use this money to buy vegetables from the wholesale market and sell them from her home. Setting up the shop at her home will be economical and also allow her to continue her stitching work in parallel. As these are items required daily, there is lot of demand for these. Doupadi is confident of a good margin of profit from her business idea of selling vegetables.

Doupadi, along with her group, has requested a loan of 60,000 INR, which she will use to start her vegetable selling business. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to buy vegetables from the wholesale market and sell them from her home

loans.name: Samaleswari Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Janaki, the lady standing first from right, is a young entrepreneur, 31, who wishes to take her first loan of 20,000 INR to start a breakfast stall at Sonepur in Sonepur district, Odisha, India. Janaki plans to buy utensils and raw materials with the start-up capital. As a homemaker and mother of two boys, Janaki has experience in preparing the items that she now hopes to sell in her stall. She also hopes that this will enable her to contribute monetarily to the household's finances, which are presently solely dependent on her husband who earns about 48,000 INR annually as a laborer.

Janaki, along with her group, has requested this loan of 60,000 INR. She will use her portion to buy utensils and raw materials to start a food stall. She hopes to do well in her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and raw materials to start a food stall.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Beatrice, a mother from Litein, a remote village town in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past 10 years of her life farming. She sells milk and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business to make ends meet. 

Beatrice is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities in which she involves herself, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has a high nutrient value. She is so keen and close with her cows that she has named them. Milking her cows makes Beatrice very proud, and she feels fulfilled. 

Dairy farming is a very profitable business venture, and Beatrice wants to take full advantage of it. She would like to expand her dairy business, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to grow her business. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. Beatrice has planted Napier grass, and feeding the cows will never be a challenge. She also owns an expansive piece of land, and the excess space will be productively used when she acquires the additional dairy cow. The exotic cow she will buy will produce between 10 and 15 litres of milk per day, which will translate to more income and profits. The profits from milk sales will allow Beatrice to grow her business further. She will start to package milk and to process it into dairy products such as cream, yoghurt, and cheese. In addition, she will benefit from the organic manure from the cow. She projects that she will be able to start a biogas plant at her farm, which will save her money on fuel costs. With your loan, Beatrice could achieve her dream of a secure future for her children. Beatrice awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Maa Baishnabi Debi Shg Group

texts.en:
Kunti is a differently able woman who has been running a small food center for the last seven years to manage her household expenses. She has been running it on a partnership basis and has to share the profit with her partner. She struggles hard to support her family out of this income. Her family includes her two sons and a daughter. Her sons have been employed somewhere to earn some additional income for their family. Kunti now wishes to scale up the venture by increasing her volume of business in the area. For this purpose, she seeks financial support and plans to use it for buying grocery supplies in bulk amount from the wholesaler as well as some utensils, etc. to serve more customers and increase her earnings from this venture.

Kunti, along with her group, has requested a loan of 60,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy edible oil, sugar, rice, flour, spices, and biscuits in bulk. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for this support.

loans.use: to buy edible oil, sugar, rice, flour, spices, and biscuits in bulk

loans.name: Samaleswari Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Subasini lives with her husband, two daughters and a son in a village in Odisha. Her husband works as a laborer to support their family. For the last four years, Subasini has been supplementing their family income by running a small grocery shop. From their joint earnings, the couple also support their three children's education and hope for their brighter future. Subasini runs the business by sourcing her supplies from the wholesale dealer and sells with some profit margin. As there is no other similar business in their area, she has been making a good profit from this venture. She now seeks financial support to expand the business and plans to add more varieties of grocery items to her shop. She is confident this will widen her customer base in the area and help her take a step towards her dream of converting the shop to a big general shop.

Subasini, along with her group, has requested this loan of 60,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy edible oil, sugar, and rice in bulk. She is grateful to K iva for this support.

loans.use: to buy edible oil, sugar, and rice in bulk.

loans.name: Los Laras Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Los Lara está integrado por tres jóvenes que buscan la superación personal. Es coordinado por María de los Ángeles que tiene la edad de 20 años, casada y madre de un hijo, su negocio es la elaboración de artesanías en bambú donde el principal producto demandado es canastos, ella los elabora en su domicilio y luego los comercializa en el mercado de Masaya. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de varas de bambú, ya que es el material más utilizado y el precio ha incrementado ultimadamente, razón que la ha motivado a prestar para comprar al por mayor, de esta manera continuar con su negocio y mejorar sus ganancias.  El resto de los integrantes son María Esther que a sus 21 años comercializa confitería (caramelos) de manera ambulante en el mercado de Rivas, y Joel de 26 años comercializa pan en barrios de la capital.
texts.en:
Los Lara Solidarity Group is made up of three young people who are striving for self-improvement.  María de los Ángeles, 20, is the coordinator of the group.  She's married and has one child.  Her business is making handicrafts with bamboo; the main products requested are baskets.  She makes them at home and then sells them in the market in Masaya.

She's requesting the loan to buy sticks of bamboo because it's the material she uses most.  The price has gone up recently, which has motivated her to request a loan for a wholesale purchase so she can continue with her business and improve her earnings.

The rest of the members are María Esther, 21, who sells candy as a street vendor in the Rivas market, and Joel, 26, who sells bread in neighborhoods in the capital.

loans.use: to buy sticks of bamboo, the main material for making baskets

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a thirty-five-year old man living in Hoima, Uganda, who used a previous loan to buy beans and maize to sell. He has three children who all attend school. He works hard to ensure that he can improve his family's standard of living. He hopes to expand his business despite the challenge of unpredictable weather changes, which makes his service delivery difficult. John is acquiring a loan to buy more beans and maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and farm inputs to improve her agricultural production

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is aged 29, married with 3 children of ages ranging from 4 to 8. Two of his children attend school in Hoima, Uganda. In order to generate income, he started a business of buying and selling of maize, beans and rice, among other items. He hopes to grow and expand his business in relation to the available market so as to increase his sales. However, price fluctuations affect his business returns. He will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Sudipta

texts.en:
Sudipta, a young girl who wants to make her career in the banking sector, is 24 years old. She has completed her bachelor's degree and recently got admission into a post-graduate diploma in banking course. Sudipta lives in Bhubaneswar with her friends. Her father is a farmer, and she has two siblings. Her father earns only 6,000 INR per month, so he was unable to pay the course fee for her professional studies as this professional degree course fee is very high for the banking course.

Sudipta has applied for a loan of 40,000 INR to pay for her banking course fee. She is thankful to Kiva for this great support.

loans.use: to pay for her banking course fee

loans.name: Lipan

texts.en:
Lipan is a young man with clear objectives. At his 25 years of age he is almost ready with his bachelor's degree in accounting and finance. Supported by his father who is a farmer and his mother who is homemaker, he has been able to move ahead, putting into practice all the values he learned at home. 

This studious young man who is almost ready with his profession is eager to pursue a post-graduate diploma in a banking and finance course. He needs to finish paying off his banking course fees and certification expenses. In the future, he wishes to work at a bank. He also wants to study for a master's degree and, especially, to give back to his parents for all they have sacrificed for him.

loans.use: to pay for his banking course fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy traditional kabakourouni soap and brushes for resale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose es estudiante de la licenciatura en enfermería, comenta que vive con su papa en la ciudad de Ybycuí, su meta es terminar sus estudios y poder trabajar para generar más ingreso y así mejorar su calidad de vida y ayudar a sus papas.
Al terminar su carrera quiere seguir capacitándose para poder crecer y mejorar cada día. El pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y con ello poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Jose is studying for a degree in Nursing. He says that he lives with his father in the city of Ybycuí. His goal is to finish his studies so that he can work and generate more income. As a result, he will improve his quality of life and be able to help his parents.

Upon finishing his degree, Jose wants to continue his training so that he can grow and improve each day. He is requesting this loan so that he can pay his degree fees, which would allow him to continue his studies just as before.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy root vegetables for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old. She is married with three children. She has had a dress shop business for 10 years. She will be using the loan to purchase fabric and hopes this will help her create more dresses for customers. She will use the anticipated profit to create more dresses for customers.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to go to university.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to help her create more dresses for customers

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is fifty years old. She runs a green grocery business. She has been in business for fifteen years. Her monthly income is five thousand Kenya shillings.

Veronica has taken a loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to buy fruits like pineapples, mangoes, watermelons, bananas and apples to sell.

She plans to use the profits to improve her family’s standard of living. In the future, she wants to transform the business into a shop.

loans.use: to buy fruits like pineapples, mangoes, watermelons, bananas and apples

loans.name: Kelly Herbert

texts.en: Kelly Herbert is a hard working man, a father of two children. One of his children attends school in Hoima, Uganda. He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of maize, beans and rice, among other items. He supplements his income by practicing agriculture. He desires to to expand and develop his business into new market areas although seasonality changes affect his output. He will use the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, salt, rice, millet flour and others to sell.

loans.name: Knight

texts.en:
Knight is 42 years old and supports seven family members. She has been a small scale farmer for the last three years and earns KES 9,000 per month.
 
Knight has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to enable her to increase the number of litres of milk produced per day so as to meet her customers demand. 

She plans to use the generated profits to repay the loan and open a retail shop. Her future hopes are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable her to increase the number of litres of milk produced per day so as to meet her customers demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his banana plantation.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis is aged 27 and married with one child. He deals in motorcycle transport and supplements his income by rearing pigs and poultry. He desires to develop and expand his business, although he meets with hardships of poultry diseases like chicken pox and the high prices of the feeds for pigs and poultry. Besides that, he has hopes of buying a car for his transport business. 

Denis needs the loan to buy a new motorcycle for transport.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Mirna Isabel

texts.es:
Mirna, ha sabido administrar el crédito anterior y sus ganancias, su tienda y venta de pupusas esta activa y hasta la fecha no ha tenido dificultades para trabajar, su familia conserva el mismo núcleo y poco a poco están cambiando su estilo de vida.
Como ve que los créditos le ayudan a surtir su negocio, nuevamente solicita capital para comprar bebidas, harina, verduras, aceite, gas propano, entre otros materiales para fortalecer la tienda y elaborar la venta de pupusas y meriendas.
texts.en:
Mirna was able to manage the previous loan and her earnings.  She's still running her store and pupusa [stuffed tortillas] business, and she hasn't had any difficulties in her work.  Her family group is the same, and they're changing their lifestyle little by little.

She sees that the loans help her to stock her business, so she's requesting more capital to buy beverages, flour, vegetables, oil, propane gas, and other materials to strengthen her store and to make pupusas and snacks.

loans.use: to buy beverages, flour, vegetables, oil, propane gas, and other materials to strengthen her store and to make pupusas and snacks

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis está estudiando para ser abogado, trabaja en una institución en la que poco a poco está aplicando lo que aprende en la universidad.
Él quiere poder ser un buen profesional para que a través de su conocimiento pueda ayudar a las demás personas.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y con ello poder estar cerca de sus metas, para poder cumplirlas y ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Luis is studying to become a lawyer. He works at an institution where he is gradually applying what he has learned at the university. Luis wants become a successful professional so that he can use his knowledge to help other people.

He is requesting this loan in order to pay his degree fees. This will help him to get closer to accomplishing his goals so that he can make something out of his life.

loans.use: to pay his university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes for resale.

loans.name: Abakwatampora Group Kisomoro 11

texts.en: Adolf, a member of Abakwatampora Group Kisomoro 11 where members guarantee each other, is engaged in selling fresh foods and at the same time growing bananas. He is faced with the challenge of limited capital, which hinders progress of his business. However, he hopes to send all his children to school and have enough capital to boost his business. Adolf has asked for a loan to buy fresh foods like cabbage, eggplant, tomatoes and yellow bananas to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh food like cabbages, eggplant, tomatoes and yellow bananas to sell.

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders! Meet Jemima, a dedicated, determined and honest mother of a lovely family. She is based in Kerugoya, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest maize growing regions, lending it the nickname of “maize region”. 

For the past 10 years, Jemima has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been,dairy goat farming, selling milk, eggs, maize and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her to earn a decent income. Jemima passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said. She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village, and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance that assists small-scale farmers through giving out loans and training. 

Jemima is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Jemima will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Benon

texts.en: Benon is a 38-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer and, at the same time, runs a bar that earns more income for him. He is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital that hinders the progress of his business. He has a family dream of educating his children and a business dream of planting maize this season. Benon has asked for a loan to buy maize for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize for planting.

loans.name: Mbuzi Care Group

texts.en: Grace, a member of Mbuzi Care Group where members guarantee each other, is 33 years old with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a restaurant and, at the same time, grows food crops like bananas that earn more income for her after selling the bananas in the nearby market. She is faced with the challenge of competition, which reduces her customers. Besides that, she is working very hard to expand her business to new areas in order to get more income. Grace has asked for a loan to help her stock sodas, beer, and foodstuffs for the restaurant.

loans.use: to stock sodas, beer, and foodstuffs for the restaurant

loans.name: Kounalai Group

texts.fr: Fatimata est mariée et mère de............... son époux est à la retraite.Elle est commerçante et vent des layette,pagne, chaussures. Elle mène cette activité depuis 12 ans. Son succès est lié a la qualité de ses marchandises. sa marchandise est de qualité et à bon prix. Elle travaille avec ACFIME depuis 5 ans et a toujours été correcte dans ses remboursements. son crédit est 100000 pour ce prêt mais elle souhaiterait 500000fcfa au cycle suivant car elle veux rénover sa boutique.
texts.en:
Fatimata is married and a mother.  Her husband is retired.  Fatimata has been a retailer, selling baby clothes, pagnes (traditional, wrap-around clothing) and shoes, for twelve years.  Her success is directly linked to the quality and good price of the products that she sells.

Fatimata has been working with the field partner, ACFIME, for five years and has always repaid her loans correctly.

This loan is for 100,000 francs CFA, but her next loan will be for 500,000 francs CFA as she would like to renovate her shop.

loans.use: to increase the size of her retail clothing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more mangoes to sell to the customers

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Hellen has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. With the little time Hellen has, she sells crops from their small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry. From Kiva lenders, Hellen is seeking a loan worth 30,000 KES to grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Hellen access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Hellen’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his working capital and buy many items of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Mbuzi Tukorrehamu Group

texts.en: Adolf is a member of Mbuzi Tukorrehamu Group where members guarantee each other for a loan. He is a married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a retailer and, at the same time, a farmer growing bananas that earn more income for him. He is faced with the challenges of inadequate capital and unpredictable weather changes affecting his expected output. However, he has a dream of building a permanent house. Adolf has asked for a loan to add stock of sugar, washing soap, cooking oil and sodas for sale.

loans.use: to add stock of sugar, washing soap, cooking oil and sodas to sell.

loans.name: Anish

texts.en:
Anish is very glad for the help of the Kiva lenders and thanks them a lot. 

With the profits of this season, he was able to save some money for a pick-up truck. But that is not enough. He wants to save more so he can buy a truck for his rice transportation.
 
Anish repaid his loan fully and wants to borrow again SRD 8,000 so he can continue with his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, who is in her mid 40s, is married with five children and all of them are still in school. She has been running two projects, a beauty salon and a retail shop, for ten years now. She works from 8am to 10pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Lucy's ninth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to open a retail shop and increased the salon equipment. She has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment, bought a plot of land and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon equipment and to increase the shop inventory. She dreams of opening a bar and also building her own house.

Lucy will make sure she pays her loan at the loan scheduled time.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon equipment and to increase the shop inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy medicine for the pharmacy.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La socia Paulina continua dedicándose a la  venta de chicha de jora y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia Paulina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para la compra de maíz entre otros.
La socia Paulina pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia de Calca del departamento del Cusco, Perú.
La socia Paulina agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Paulina, a member, continues to make a living selling chicha made with maize, and she also breeds small animals, such as guinea pigs and chickens. She has been running her business for a long time, and it has been going well thanks to the hard work she puts into it every day, as this is how she provides for her family.
This time, Paulina needs the loan to buy corn, among other things.
Paulina belongs to the “Virgen de Fátima de Lamay” communal ban, which is part of the Asociación Arariwa in the Calca province in the Cusco region, Peru.
Paulina is grateful for the loan, and values it, and she promises to pay back her monthly debts.

loans.use: to buy corn, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for rice.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson is a 25-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing bananas, coffee and tomatoes. 

Jackson is faced with challenges of limited capital, that hinder progress of his business. With the previous loan, he bought maize for resale. He is hoping to take all his children to higher levels of learning. Jackson has asked for another loan to improve his banana plantation by mulching it.

loans.use: to improve his banana plantation by mulching it.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 54-year-old married man with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing food crops like bananas, tomatoes and maize that he sells to add him more income. 

John is faced with challenges of limited capital and seasonality changes that reduce his banana productivity. Besides that, he is fighting hard to educate all his children to higher levels of learning. John has asked for a loan to pay school fees for his children

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 35-year-old married man with five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer who also operates a bar for additional income. 

Robert is faced with challenges of limited capital and seasonality changes that hinder and affect his business returns. Besides that, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Robert has asked for a loan to plant maize.

loans.use: to plant maize.

loans.name: Mahinder

texts.en:
Mahinder once again thanks all the Kiva lenders for such a great job. He feels very blessed with all the help he gets from them. 

Mahinder has repaid his loan fully and on time. But this season, the paddy price was too low and he couldn't save enough. He wants to continue rice production and for this he needs another loan of SRD 12.000 to buy inputs for his rice production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other inputs for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Nthetsa Umphawi Group

texts.en:
Esnart is a single mother supporting a family by herself, which is very challenging for her. She greatly thanks Kiva for the help that they granted her by giving her a loan. She used the loan to boost up her business and the profits that she made helped her to financially support her family by providing them with food and other basic materials.

She is requesting another loan in order to further expand her business. She plans of building a better house for her family and hopes to be able to sufficiently help her children.

loans.use: to buy flour and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fast moving items for his hardware shop.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es:
Manuel, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos, su pareja se dedica a los oficios del hogar, el niño menor estudia tercer grado y el mayor sexto grado.

Manuel, tiene muchos años de experiencia en manejo de ganado de engorde en repasto, ya que desde niño, sus padres le enseñaron las labores agrícolas y el cuido de sus animales, también trabaja en un taller de carpintería durante todo el día y en los ratos de descanso se va a darle agua a sus novillos, los cuales mantiene en un potrero cercano a su casa.

Manuel, quiere darle a sus hijos lo que a él no le pudieron dar sus padres, por eso solicita el crédito para comprar 3 novillos de engorde en repasto, ya que después de engordarlos podrá venderlos y mantener un ingreso adicional al de la carpintería, para darle estudio y alimentación a sus hijos.

Manuel, sueña con comprar un terreno y construir su propia casa, para que sus hijos puedan vivir en casa propia.- Además, quiere que sus hijos sean profesionales cuando sean grandes.
texts.en:
Manuel, 39, went to school through ninth grade. He has a partner and 2 children. His partner is a homemaker. The younger child is in third grade, and the older child is in sixth grade.

Manuel has many years of experience in management of beef cattle on pasture land. As a child, his parents taught him the farming and keeping of animals. He also works in a carpentry workshop throughout the day, and during the rest hours, gives water to his calves, which are in a pasture near his house.

Manuel wants to give his children what his parents could not give him. For this, he requests a loan to buy steers for fattening. After he fattens them, 
he can sell them and keep an additional carpentry income, to educate and feed his children.

Manuel dreams of buying land and building  his own home, so that his children can live at their own home. He also wants his children to become professionals, when they grow up.

loans.use: to buy 3 steers for fattening.

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en:
Ralph is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in African masks and drums. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stain and polish.

Ralph has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

Born in the Volta region of Ghana, Ralph has always been interested in art. "After finishing school, I worked as a weaver in a textile company from 1973 to 1995. When the company had to lay off some of its workers, I then decided to learn a trade of my own. I was so determined to make it, it took me just a few months to learn wood carving and I discovered a surprising natural ability," he confides.

"I will ever be grateful to those of you who helped fund my last loan, and look forward to reaching new heights with this new loan."

Use the link below to view Ralph's African masks and drums on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/2090

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stain and polish.

loans.name: Kristo Nti Group

texts.en:
Patrick is 46 years old. He comes from Assin Dompen, a suburb of Assin Fosu. Patrick is the group representative for the Kristo Nti group. He is a married with four children. His children are 4 months, 6 years, 14 years and 24 years old respectively  Two (2) of his children are in school. His wife is a teacher who supports him, with her monthly income, in raising the family. 
Patrick is a trader and sells plastic products such as tables and chairs, disposables, food flasks, polythene bags, etc. He set up the business about 15 years ago to support the family. Patrick has two store attendants who work for him. Patrick, together with his group members, have been a client of the field partner since 2006. This is their 16th loan with a good repayment record. All their previous loan repayments were on time. Based on the outcome (profit) he is sure that in the next 5 years he will be able to own two additional shops in addition to the existing ones. Business has been good apart from low sales in a few specific months. Patrick is requesting a micro loan to buy additional plastic products. Patrick will use the profit from the business to support his children in school and for future expansion of his business. He thanks all his micro lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: to buy additional plastic products for resale.

loans.name: Prudence

texts.en:
Prudence is a 46-year-old woman who is married with four children. She sews dresses, skirts, tops and bed covers and sells them in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business.
Prudence has requested a loan to buy a roll of plain white cloth, a roll of soft white material, buttons and cotton to her allow her to sew additional items.
She plans to use her profit to buy a new electric sewing machine which will help meet her family weekly expenses by increasing product. She’s been a SPBD member since 2013.

loans.use: to buy a roll of plain white cloth, a roll of soft white material, buttons and cotton.

loans.name: Psalm 23 Group

texts.en: Mary is a 57-year-old trader and a member of the Psalm 23 group. She is from Mankessim in the Mfantsiman District of the Central Region of Ghana. She is a married woman with three children. Her first born is 20 years old and the youngest is now 18 years old. All three children are in school. She has been in the provision business for over 33 years hence having gained rich experience. Mary buys her goods from suppliers in Accra. She has decided to expand her store gradually with her profits. This allows her to buy in larger quantities to gain a larger discount to lower her costs in the future. Mary has been a client of the field partner with excellent repayment records for all of her previous 13 loans cycles. Mary is requesting a micro loan as working capital to finance the replenishment of her store. She will use the profit from the store for expansion of her business and to support her husband in caring for their children in school. Mary thanks all her micro lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy provisions to stock her store.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en:
Jenny is 28 years old and married with one child. She raises poultry and sells it within the community to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.
Jenny is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so her family can have better living conditions. She will use the loan to buy louver glass, Masonite and Louver frames. She will also use part of her loan to buy chicken feeds, like grower and finisher, for her business.
She plans to use her profits to expand her business and meet her family’s weekly expenses. She has been a SPBD member since 2013.

loans.use: to buy louver glass, Masonite and louver frames and chicken feed.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 30 years old and married with two children. She makes and sells hot dogs in her community and at the schools to earn living. She has been doing this for one year.
Edna is requesting this loan to help her make improvements to her house, so that her family can have better living conditions. She will use the loan to buy copper, ridge caps, chicken wire, roofing paper and Masonite.
She plans to use her profits to build another house to rent out and provide for her family’s daily needs. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy copper, ridge cap, chicken wire, roofing paper and Masonite.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Tem 47 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 5 filhos 3 ainda a estudar, 1 já a trabalhar e outra numa formação espiritual. Vive na casa própria a base de negocio que faz junto com o marido que é também fiscal dos transportes semi-colectivos de passageiros. Está a repetir o credito pela 4ªvez, tem investido na ampliação do seu negocio e na aquisição de mais bens de consumo.
Pretende comprar produtos alimentares tais como: arroz, farinha, óleo, feijão, massas, leite, amendoim, sumos, omo, sabão, bolachas, refrescos, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio.
Seu maior sonho é ver seu negocio crescer mais e garantir melhor educação para os seus filhos.
Seu maior desafio, é o facto de ainda ter que alugar carro para transportar a sua mercadoria.
