texts.en: Isabel is a 47 year old married mother to 5 children: 3 of whom are still at school, 1 is already employed and another is undertaking spiritual training. She lives in her own home which she paid for using the income from the business that she runs in conjunction with her husband, who also works as an inspector for semi-collective passenger transport systems. This will be her fourth loan cycle and she plans to invest this money in the expansion of her business and the purchase of more consumer goods, namely food stuffs such as rice, flour, cooking oil, beans, dough, milk, peanuts, juices, washing powder, soap, cake and soft drinks etc in order to increase her stock. Isabel dreams of seeing her business grow further and ensuring that her children receive a better education, while the greatest challenge that she faces is the fact that she still has to hire a vehicle to transport her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, cooking oil, beans, dough, milk, nuts, juices, washing powder, soap, cake and soft drinks

loans.name: Isabel

texts.pt:
Viúva de 50 anos de idade, mãe de 5 filhos 3 ainda na sua responsabilidade e a estudar, vive na casa própria à base de negocio de venda de produtos alimentares numa barraca em sua casa e faz agricultura de subsistência para reforçar os seus rendimentos. Está a tomar o credito pela 3ª vez e todos creditos foram para o negocio que tem sido a sua principal fonte de renda.
Pretende comprar: açúcar, amendoim, arroz, massas, óleo, feijão, sabão, farinha, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio.
Gostaria de poder desenvolver mais o seu negocio, construir um murro de vedação na sua residência e no futuro adquirir uma viatura que lhe possa facilitar as deslocações.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 50 year old widowed mother to 5 children, 3 of whom still live in her care and attend school. She lives in her own home in which she has set up a stall to run her business selling food items and she also works as a subsistence farmer in order to supplement her income. This will be her third loan cycle and all her previous loans have been used to finance her business as it is her main source of income.
She plans to use this loan to buy sugar, peanuts, rice, dough, cooking oil, beans, soap and flour in order to increase her stock levels. She would like to develop her business further, build garden fencing around her home and, in the future, she hopes to buy a vehicle that will help her to transport her stock with greater ease.

loans.use: to buy sugar, peanuts, rice, dough, cooking oil, beans, soap and flour etc in order to expand her business stock

loans.name: Rosinha

texts.pt:
Tem 51 anos de idade, casada, mãe de 2 filhos maiores de idade ainda na sua responsabilidade, cuida de 4 netos que vivem com ela, vive na casa própria e de material convencional junto com seu esposo que é trabalhador do estado como técnico agrícola, é criadora de frangos e também vendedora de produtos alimentares numa mini loja construída em sua casa, esta a tomar o crédito pela primeira vez e pretende reforçar a sua criação de frangos e venda de produtos.
Com o crédito pretende comprar: pintos, vitaminas, ração e vacinas. Mais alguns produtos para reforçar o seu negocio já existente.
O seu maior sonho é desenvolver mais o seu negocio e com os lucros concluir a construção de sua casa e mobilar.
O seu maior desafio é o facto de as vezes ter quebras na sua criação causada por algumas doenças das aves.
texts.en: Rosinha is a 51 year old married mother to 2 older children who still live in her care. She is also financially responsible for her 4 grandchildren who live with her. She lives in her own traditionally-built home with her husband, who works for the state as a farming technician, and she raises chickens and also sells food stuffs from a small shop which she has set up in her house. This will be her first loan and she plans to invest it in her 2 businesses. She will use the money to buy chicks, vitamins, feed and vaccines, plus other items to reinforce her current stock levels. She dreams of developing her business further and using her profits to finish building work on her home and to furnish it afterwards. The greatest challenge that she faces is the fact that sometimes there are disruptions to her chicken business as some of the birds contract illnesses.

loans.use: to buy chicks, vitamins, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinab is a 57-year-old Lebanese widow woman living with her children. One of her children works together with Zeinab to fulfill their needs. She has spent fifteen years working as a hairdresser and beautician. She owns a beauty salon in her town where she greets her customers with a great smile. Zeinab started her career at a young age with the intention of increasing the family’s revenues. Today, Zeinab wants to get a second loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l, to purchase hairdressing tools and a laser machine. She feels like she is perfect to work in such a business and states that she is very happy.

loans.use: to purchase hairdressing tools and a laser machine.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.pt:
Tem 36 anos de idade, mãe de 2 filhos menores e a estudarem, vive maritalmente numa casa ainda em construção, é negociante e conta com ajuda do esposo trabalhador do TRIBUNAL, esta a tomar o credito pela 3ªvez, com os créditos anteriores conseguiu investir na construção da sua casa, a qual se encontra na fase final.
Com o crédito pretende comprar: janelas, portas, tijoleira, cimento, para concluir a construção de sua casa.
O seu maior sonho é concluir a sua casa e casar oficialmente com o seu marido. Gostaria também de poder construir residências para aluguer num terreno que tem.
Ela se sente muito feliz com os créditos que tem tomado, porque ajudam muito na gestão dos rendimentos de seu marido, pois antes gestão era deficitária e nem chegava para as despesas de casa, mas agora tomou responsabilidade e faz os pagamentos mensais
texts.en: Sandra is a 36 year old mother to 2 young children who are attending school. She lives with her common-law husband in their own home which is currently under construction. She runs her own business while her husband works in the Courts. This will be her third loan cycle and, with her previous loans, she successfully invested in the construction of her house, which is now in its final building phase. She plans to use this loan to buy windows, doors, bricks and cement so that she can finish the building work. She dreams of finishing her house and of officially marrying her husband. She would also like to build other houses on a plot of land that she has ready. She is very happy with the loans that she has already received because they have helped her a great deal with managing on her husband's wage; previously they were short of money and didn't have enough to cover their household expenses but now she has taken on these responsibilities, she is able to pay their monthly costs.

loans.use: to buy windows, doors, bricks and cement to finish building work on her home.

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
El grupo Milagros está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una de ellas, y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando poco a poco.
Una de las integrantes que se destaca es la Sra. Brigida, quien ha ido mejorando poco a poco por medio de su esfuerzo y por medio de las capacitaciones que ha ido recibiendo. Ella es una excelente persona que se esfuerza al máximo, en su pequeño negocio que es una despensa.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, pollo y otros, para poder seguir con sus ventas, luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The Milagros group is carrying out a poverty eradication questionnaire in order to understand the life situation of each of its members and therefore be able to improve their lives little by little.

One of the highlighted members is Brigida who has been improving her life little by little partly due to her own efforts and partly thanks to the training she has been receiving. 

She is a wonderful person who puts a huge amount of effort into her small grocery store. 

She is requesting this loan to buy stock for her grocery store like vegetables, meat, chicken etc so she can continue making sales and improving her life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, chicken etc.

loans.name: Anturio Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad del Estado de México se formó un grupo de préstamo familiar de nombre “Anturio”. Los integrantes eligieron el nombre por un tipo de flor que en alguna temporada también se dedicaron a vender. 

Maximiliano siguió los pasos de su padre en el negocio de la venta de ropa “Es un producto que se vende muy bien, muchas veces puedo obtener hasta 50% de las ganancias”. Ahora, con su propia familia de tres hijos y su mujer, Maximiliano sabe muy bien lo que significa seguir aumentando sus ganancias. 

La mercancía la compra en la Ciudad de México, aproximadamente a tres horas de su comunidad. En cada viaje a la capital del país, Maximiliano compra la mayor cantidad de mercancía posible para no tener la necesidad de hacer otro viaje no planeado ni gastar más en transporte. Por esto, ahora requiere un préstamo que le ayude a tener el capital suficiente para la siguiente compra.  

Además de la venta de prendas, junto con su padre y su hermano, Maximiliano también cose mallones térmicos. El negocio familiar apenas se encuentra despuntando, tan sólo cuenta con algunas máquinas de coser pero él tiene fe en la actividad y espera que las ventas aumenten poco a poco. “Lo más importante es tratar muy bien al cliente, ofrecerle un muy buen producto y un buen precio para que nos recuerde y regrese”. Maximiliano desea seguir brindando mejores oportunidades a su familia sobre todo para que sus pequeños puedan terminar una carrera profesional.

*En la imagen: Maximiliano, quien viste la playera negra, con su padre y su hermano.
texts.en:
In a Mexican community there is a family that formed a loan group called "Anturio".  The members chose the name for a type of flower that they used to sell.

Maximiliano followed in his father's footsteps in the business of selling clothing.  "It is a product that sells very well, sometimes allowing for a 50% profit on the merchandise."  Now, with his wife and three children, Maximiliano knows very well what it means to continue increasing his profits.

He buys merchandise in Mexico City, approximately three hours from his community.  On each trip to the capital city, Maximiliano buys as much merchandise as possible so he does not have to make unnecessary trips nor spend more on transportation.  Therefore, he wants a loan to have enough capital for the next purchase.

In addition to selling clothing with his father and brother, Maximiliano also makes thermal leggings.  This family business is only just beginning and has just a few sewing machines.  But he trusts in this activity and hopes sales will increase littly by little.  "The most important thing is customer service, and offering a good product at a low price so they remember and come back."  Maximiliano wants to continue giving his family better opportunities, especially the young ones so they can finish their education.


*In the photo is Maximiliano in a black t-shirt, and his father and brother.

loans.use: To buy more clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ice, milk, lemons, and jellies to make snow cones, and fish and shrimp to reactivate his business.

loans.name: Favio

texts.es:
Favio es un hombre de cuarenta y ocho años de edad, está feliz mente casado tiene una linda familia de ocho hijos de las edades entre siete y veintiocho años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Favio con el afán de generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia trabaja como guardián de finca de una asociación, él tiene ya cinco meses de ejercer esta labor, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también trabaja extrayendo arena de rio en una comunidad circunvecina. 
Favio desde hace algún tiempo había pensado en construir su casa, pero una de las dificultades que el tenia era que no contaba con un trabajo fijo, pero ahora que ya lo tiene a pensado en empezar la construcción pero con el precio alto que tienen ahora los materiales de construcción, su sueldo no se da abasto, por lo que él ahora solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá para comprar lamina, puertas, cemento, balcones,  y pagar la mano de obra para la construcción de la casa.
El gran sueño de Favio es poder conseguir este crédito para construir la casa y que su familia ya no perezca de necesidades de techo y ver graduados a sus hijos
texts.en:
Favio, 48, is happily married and has a beautiful family of eight children between the ages of seven and 28.  They live in a community in Solola.

In an effort to generate more income to support his family, Favio works as a security guard for an association.  He has been in this job for five months.  But in order to earn more income he works extracting sand from the river in a neighboring community.

For some time now Favio has been thinking about building a house, but one of the difficulties he had was not having steady employment.  Now that he does, he wants to start construction but prices of construction materials are high and his salary is not enough to cover costs.  Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy metal sheeting, doors, cement, railings, and to hire workers to build the house.

Favio's goal is to obtain the loan to build his house so his family will have a roof over its head and his sons can get an education.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, doors, cement, railings and hire workers to build a house.

loans.name: Alma Nubia

texts.es: Alma es una mujer trabajadora que a sus 64 años ha sido ejemplo de superación, y quien a muy corta edad aprendió los oficios de ser comerciante, ella ha dedicado 39 años de su vida a la comercialización de frutas en el mercado de Masaya, este negocio lo impulsó con créditos de cosechas, actualmente ha logrado comprar al por mayor y diversificar los productos ofrecidos, es el décimo sexto ciclo que ADIM le brinda los financiamientos para su negocio y ha demostrado ser una persona responsable con sus cuotas de pagos y digno ejemplo de superación, el crédito actual lo solicita para la compra de cosechas de mango y aguacate, con el fin de cubrir la demanda que tiene de estos productos, ya que son los que mayor demandada tienen en esta temporada.
texts.en: Alma, 64, is a hard-working woman who is an example of self-improvement at her age.  When she was very young she learned to be a merchant and for 39 years has been selling fruit at the market in Masaya.  She started her business with harvest loans, and now buys a variety of products on a wholesale basis.  This is her sixth loan cycle through ADIM which has granted loans for her business because she has proven herself to be responsible in paying back the loans while serving as an example of improvement.  The loan she is currently requeting is to buy harvests of mangos and avocados to cover demand for these products.  They are the most popular fruits in this season.

loans.use: To by mangos and avocados.

loans.name: Sol De Oro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SOL DE ORO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Delia ella es soltera y tiene 46 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz,aceite, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Golden Sun” communal bank, located in the district of Cusco which also pertains to the province and department of Cusco. 

Member Delia is single and 46 years old, with four children. She works in her grocery store and sells products of primary necessity, such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. Through her business she wants to get ahead.  Being an enterprising, hard-working woman, her dream is to expand her grocery business. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. 

Delia's photo is attached to the group photo because hers was taken after the meeting and she had to request permission to be absent because of work. The remaining members have businesses that sell candies, clothing, groceries or books. 

Delia is grateful to those who form a part of her dream. Through this means, she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Liliam Elizabeth

texts.es:
Liliam, de 36 años de edad, estudio bachillerato general, se dedica a los oficios domésticos y también a la producción de granos básicos, está casada y vive junto a sus dos hijos de 17 y 19 años de edad y su esposo trabaja sembrando granos básicos.  

Liliam, conoce muy bien las actividad que desempeña, pues las ejerce desde hace varios años, lo que le ha permitió dar a sus hijos un nivel académico, por supuesto que con el apoyo de su esposo.- Ella realiza la actividad de producción de granos básicos desde que tenia14 años.
  
Liliam, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas, para la producción de sandía y maíz   

Liliam, sueña con mejorar su vivienda, para darle mayor seguridad a su familia y que sus hijos concluyan con su carrera académica, para que se desempeñen en la sociedad.
texts.en:
Liliam is 36 years old and studied until the second-last year of high school. She is a housewife and also makes a living producing staple grains. She is married and lives with her two sons of 17 and 19 and her husband plants staple grains for a living.  

Liliam knows her trade very well because she has been doing it for many years and it has allowed her to pay for her sons' education, along with her husband's help of course. She's been working in basic grain production since she was 14 years old. 

Liliam needs the loan to buy agricultural supplies so she can produce watermelon and corn.

Liliam's dream is to improve her house, to give her family better security and for her sons to finish their education so they can have a role to play in society.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to produce watermelon and corn.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es:
Orbelina, vive con su familia, la cual está compuesta por su esposo y una hija de 5 años de edad, desempeña sus labores domestica como toda madre y esposa responsable, también práctica la comercialización de ganado y destazo de cerdos, lo hace con la ayuda de su esposo, el oficio lo aprendió con la orientación de su madre y lo ha tomado como fuente de ingresos desde hace 2 años, no tiene dificultades para realizar dicha actividad.
Está necesitado de un préstamo para comprar ganado fortalecerá el inventario de su negocio, esperando vender los animales con un mayor margen de ganancias, pues así tendrá una situación financiera mucho más estable.
Orbelina tiene la visión de mantenerse trabajando para resarcir sus deudas y suplir las necesidades familiares.
texts.en:
Orbelina lives with her family, which is made up of her husband and their five year old daughter. She does her housework, like any responsible wife and mother. She also sells cattle and butchers pigs. She does this with her husband's help. She learned the trade with her mother's guidance and she has had it as a source of income for 2 years. She has no difficulties doing this activity. 

She needs a loan to buy cattle. This will fortify her business' inventory, hoping to sell the animals with a larger profit margin. This way, she will have a much more stable financial situation. 

Orbelina's vision is to keep working to pay off her debts and meet her family needs.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fortify her business' inventory, hoping to a larger margin of profits.

loans.name: A.p.p V.e.s Group

texts.es: La Sra. Mary   de 43 años de edad  madre de 1 hijo  y casada, tiene un pequeño negocio de ventas de productos de belleza  ya hace un 1 año.la Sra. Mary a través de sus esfuerzos ha ido captando  clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos para su negocio   (cosméticos)   Y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes  y así poder salir adelante. A la vez la Sra.  Mary  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada.   Mary es la única señora que se encuentra parada, Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: Mary is 43 years old. She is the mother of 1 son and she is married. She has had a small business selling beauty products for 1 year. Through her hard work, Mary had gained customers which has generated earnings to cover the household expenses. In the future, she would like to have her own locale where she can sell her products and obtain more profits. With the loan she will invest in buying more products for her business (cosmetics). This way, she can keep meeting her customers' needs and thus be able to get ahead. In addition, Mary and all of the members are grateful to Kiva for the loan and for the trust that has been put in them. Mary is the only woman who is standing. She takes her leave and promises that she will meet all of the goals she has set.

loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Familia R Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo Familia R viven en una comunidad con raíces indígenas. En algunas conversaciones aún se escuchan palabras  mazahuas y muchas mujeres también llevan los trajes típicos de colores complementados con largos collares. 
El grupo está conformado por los esposos Pedro y Margarita C., y por Margarita H. que es su nuera; los tres se dedican a criar bueyes y vacas. 
Al casarse, Margarita H. quería apoyar a su esposo con los gastos así que trató de aprender todo lo posible de sus suegros para aportar al ingreso familiar. La actividad le permite permanecer en casa, realizar sus actividades del hogar y atender a su pequeño, además cuenta con el apoyo y experiencia de su suegro en todo momento, lo que le da más estabilidad a su negocio. 
Todas las mañanas, Margarita H. se levanta desde muy temprano para atender a los animales y después encargarse de las labores de casa. “Es mejor iniciar desde muy temprano para terminar antes y así aprovechar más el tiempo, además los animales comen mejor el pasto del campo por las mañanas”.
Margarita H. conserva los animales durante un año para cuidarlos y hacerlos crecer en las mejores condiciones. Hace pocos días vendió los dos bueyes que tenía por lo que necesita hacer una nueva inversión para adquirir un becerro. 
Su sueño más grande es tener su casa para tener un espacio propio para su familia.
*En la imagen aparecen los tres integrantes muy sonrientes en una de las milpas. Detrás se pueden ver algunos de los bueyes de los suegros de Margarita H. y ella cargando a su bebé.
texts.en:
The members of the Familia R group live in a community with indigenous roots. During some conversations, Mazahua words can be heard and a lot of women also wear the traditional clothing of colors complemented by large collars.   

The group is made up of the spouses Pedro and Margarita C. and Margarita H., who is their daughter in law. The three of them work raising oxen and cows.  
 
When she got married, Margarita H. wanted to help her husband with expenses, so she tried to learn everything possible from her parents in law to support the family income. The activity allows her to stay at home, doing her household activities and caring for her little one. She also has the support and experience of her father in law at all times, which gives the business more stability.  

Every morning, Margarita H. gets up very early to tend to the animals and later do the house work. “It's better to stat very early to finish sooner and use the time better. In addition, the animals eat the pasture better in the morning”.

Margarita H. keeps the animals for a year to care for them and make them grow in better conditions. A few days ago she sold the two oxen she had and she needs to make a new investment to acquire a calf. 

Her biggest dream is to have a house to have her own space for a family. 

*In the image the three members appear smiling in one of the cornfields. Behind them can be seen some of the oxen that belong to Margarita H's parents in law and she is carrying her baby.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. She is a widow and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

Gloria has requested a 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to dry and sell.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years now and in the future she would like to save money to expand it.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to make dried fish

loans.name: Ma. Bella

texts.en:
Ma. Bella is a resident from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various merchandise ranging from  biscuits, candies, powdered milk, sugar, canned goods, soap, and seasonings. She is 47-year-old married woman with four grown children. Her husband has a small business where in he could help defray the family's expenses.

To be able to sustain her livelihood, she has requested a loan to buy rice, feed, and assorted items.  These will help improved her daily income and ability to display a variety of stock.  This could result in attracting more customers to shop and purchase. Her income will slowly go up  she will be able to handle her finances. 

Ma. Bella  is determined to expand her sari-sari (variety) store to improve the family's status of living.

loans.use: to buy rice, feed, and assorted items

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is from Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He is a very responsible father when it comes to the welfare of his family, since he has always been known to provide the best for them. He is earning a living in his retailing business. 

To generate more income, Ruben decided to expand his resources after he learned that he can access financial assistance from PMPC. 

Consequently, he requested a loan to restock more inventory for his store to increase sales. 

Ruben smiles at the thought of having a comfortable life and providing his family a better life.

loans.use: to restock more inventory for his store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 47 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, coffee, milk, sugar, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Nolhanena

texts.en:
Nolhanena is 48 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of household goods to sell.

Nolhanena has borrowed and paid 30 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods to sell

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 36 years old and has six children.  She is married, and has four children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising ducks in the Philippines. Rhodora requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and additional ducks to raise.

Rhodora has been raising ducks for 12 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and additional ducks to raise

loans.name: Soledad

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Soledad works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Soledad is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Soledad has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Adzo est une jeune femme célibataire sans enfant âgée de 27 ans. Adzo vit à Adidogomé pour faire ses activités. Pour assurer ses charges et faire face à ses besoins, Adzo fait la couture et vend des trousseaux bébés pour gagner son revenu. Adzo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Pour mieux réaliser ses prestations, Adzo désire acheter douze rouleaux de popeline et nécessite ce crédit pour accomplir son objectif et faire plus de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Adzo is a 27 year old single woman with no children; she lives and works in Adidogomé. In order to cover her living expenses and to meet her needs, Adzo is a seamstress and sells baby outfits to earn an income. She buys her supplies twice a month at the market.
To be able to make more outfits, Adzo wants to buy twelve rolls of poplin fabric and she needs this loan to achieve this, and to increase her profit.

loans.use: to purchase 12 rolls of cotton fabric.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is 32 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Rodelyn is borrowing 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rodelyn has been farming vegetables for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling other vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rowena works hard to support her family. She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising goats. Rowena is borrowing 30,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, paints and nails for her business.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, paints and nails

loans.name: Sara

texts.en:
Sara is 46 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. Sara works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, chips, canned goods, etc.

Sara has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like soap, shampoo, chips, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Seth

texts.en:
Seth is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Seth requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Seth has been farming rice for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lyneth

texts.en:
Lyneth is a 40-year-old married woman with two children. She has a small garden where she grows slippery cabbage and other vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year.

Lyneth has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, seed corn, seed melon, a spade, a hoe and a wheel barrow to assist her in running the business. 

She joined SPBD in 2014, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed corn, seed melon a spade, a hoe and a wheel barrow

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie owns and operates a (sari-sari) variety store. She sells commodities ranging from cooking oil, sugar, powdered milk, seasonings, toothpaste, soap and canned goods. She is 40 years old with four dependents. Three of them are still attending school. 

She is asking for a loan to buy stock for the store like soft drinks, and fishing materials like fish net. This will improve the stock in her store, as well as increase her catch and ability to sell more fish. She could now prepare healthy diets for the whole family.

Rosalie dreams to do her best to be able to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy stock for the store like soft drinks, and fishing materials like fish net

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sugar, bananas, cooking oil, etc.

Veronica has been in this business for 22 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sugar, bananas, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.  

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Vilma is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  purchase more stock of household goods to sell in her general store business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods

loans.name: Lyn

texts.en:
Lyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fishing business.

Lyn has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from buying and selling dried fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc for her general store business.

Marlyn has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from food vending.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. 

She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, chips, eggs, noodles, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 28-year-old woman with two children. She runs a small business selling BBQ fish and cassava in her community to earn a living and has been doing this for one year.

Hellen needs a loan to buy more fish, cassava, a storage cooler, paper plates and vegetable oil to assist her to run the business. She hopes to use her profit to build a proper store and meet her family's weekly needs. She has been a SPBD member since 2013.

loans.use: to buy more stock and equipment for her food business

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cecile works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and buying and selling spices. Cecile is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her buy and sell rice business.

Cecile has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies for his store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Batiana

texts.en:
Batiana is a hardworking entrepreneur who is a vegetable farmer in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from running a general store. Batiana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She has successfully repaid her previous loans.

Batiana is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her vegetable business. In the future, she dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farm supplies

loans.name: Silba

texts.en:
Silba works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell vegetable business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Silba has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Silba would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mercina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Mercina works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Mercina is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to  buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Mercina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anneth

texts.en:
Anneth is a 22-year-old married woman with 1 child. She has a small garden where she grows varieties of vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for almost two years.

Anneth needs a loan to buy canned spray, a wheelbarrow, chemicals and other farming equipment to assist her in running the business. She plans to use her profit to provide her children’s daily school expenses and improve her small vegetable plantation. She joined SPBD in 2014.

loans.use: to buy canned spray, a wheelbarrow, chemicals and other farming equipment

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 54 years old and is married with six children, two of whom are in school. For the past 34 years, she has run a food-vending business in the Philippines. Beatriz is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Beatriz is requesting a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 30,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional herbal medicines and food supplements which she resells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Gemma wants to have business expansion so that she can continue to help support her children until they finish their studies. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for herbal medicines and food supplements to sell.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 32 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom is in school.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Cherry requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sack of feed.

Cherry has been pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sack of feed

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell fish business in the Philippines, She is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her buy and sell fish business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
As a married parent of 12 children, Beverly works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing. Beverly is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her buy and sell vegetable business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Beverly has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 55 years old and married with three children. For the past year, she has been running a business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Eva also earns additional income from selling food.

Eva is requesting a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients like flour, sugar, egg, spices, etc for her food vending business.

Erlinda has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from buying and selling ready to wear and tailoring.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients like flour, sugar, egg, spices, etc

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a coconut shell vending business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more coconuts to sell.

Manilyn has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Maevalyn

texts.en:
Maevalyn is 36 years old and married with three children. She has a small garden where she grows vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for almost two years.

Maevalyn needs a loan to buy a wheel barrow, a spray container, a rake, a spade, a hoe, a knife, chemicals, cabbage seeds and fertilizer to assist her in running the business. 

She hope to use her profit to meet her children's school fees and other household expenses. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a wheel barrow,a spray container, a rake, a spade, a hoe, a knife, chemicals, cabbage seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rubby

texts.en:
Rubby is 21 years old and is married with one child. For the past two years, she has owned a cab and taxi business to earn a living. Rubby has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

Rubby is requesting a loan to buy an alternator, tires, shock absorber, and car decorations for her taxi. Her loan will help her provide service for her clients. Rubby hopes to use the profits from her loan to buy another car as well as provide for her family’s weekly demands.

loans.use: to buy an alternator, tires, shock absorber, and car decorations

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden is 58 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, spices, etc.

Eden has been in this business for 15 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, spices, etc

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marilou is 40 years old and has one child in school.

Marilou has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Marilou has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
This is Lilibeth, 44, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ben, and they have two children who are already in elementary school. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lilibeth operates a "Piso-Net" business. Piso Net is basically a merge of PC rental and Arcade rental services wherein customers can pay for the services by inserting coins into the machine. There is more need, now than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school requirements. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or any office documentation, as well as people who would just love to surf the net and any social networks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy an additional Piso Net unit for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Lilibeth desires to open another computer shop so she can extend more her service within the community. She hopes to give her family, especially her children, a good life in the future. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy an additional Piso-Net machine so she can increase her profit from business.

loans.name: Luis Nelson

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 23 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es el cambio y venta de aceites y lubricantes para vehículo.
Él es emprendedor, decidido, independiente, responsable y muy trabajador. su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘Pampahasi’ un área caracterizada por ubicarse sobre la ladera este de la ciudad, de calles en pendientes muy empinadas. Los orígenes de sus habitantes son; campesinos aymaras que pelearon por la liberación de la corona española y se asentaron en ese lugar como trinchera. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados, durante todo el año.
Luis es de tez morena, cabello negro corto crespo, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que es propia y esta construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es el cambio de aceite y lubricantes a vehículos como; motos, autos, camionetas, camiones, etc., actividad que realiza durante todo el día de lunes a sábado, por las noches se dedica a estudiar la carrera técnica de mecánica automotriz en un instituto muy conocido. “inicie mi negocio por impulso de mi mamá porque anteriormente mi familia se dedicaba a este negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que el parque automotor es amplio en la ladera donde está ubicado su negocio, la desventaja es que le quita mucho tiempo para dedicarlo a sus estudios de mecánica automotriz. Su sueño es salir profesional y abrir un taller mecánico, el desea realizar la compra de aceites y lubricantes para ofertar en su negocio y terminar sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Luis solicita un préstamo para la compra de aceites y lubricantes para vehículo para trabajar en su negocio y para terminar sus estudios.
texts.en: Luis is a 23 year old man, single and without children. His business is to change and sells motor oil and lubricants. He is enterprising, decisive, independent, responsible and very hardworking. His business is in the area of ‘Pampahasi’, an area characterized by being on the Eastern slope of the city, with very steep streets on cliffs. The origin of its inhabitants is that they are Aymara peasants who fought against the Spanish crown and settled in this place as a trench. It is cold and dry with temperatures varying from 2-14 degrees Celsius during the whole year. Luis is of dark skin, short black curly hair, short in height, thin. His native language is Aymara which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish as general culture and for his job. He lives with his parents in their own house, built with brick and cement, with corrugated iron roof, drinking water, electricity, domestic gas and sewerage. His business is to change motor oil and lubricants to vehicles such as: motorcycles, cars, station wagons, trucks, etc. He works the whole day from Monday to Saturday. In the evenings, he attends a well known institute and studies the career of car mechanics. "I started this business on my mother's advice, because my family worked in this business previously...", he comments. The advantage of this business is that the car park is ample on the slope where his business is located. The disadvantage is that it takes a lot of time from his studies in car mechanics. His dream is to be a professional and open a mechanics shop. He wants to buy motor oil and lubricants to sell in his business and finish with his studies. This is his first loan cycle with the institution in the two years he has been working independently. This is why Luis is requesting a loan to buy motor oil and lubricants for vehicles, to work in his business and to finish his studies.

loans.use: to buy motor oil and lubricants to work in his business, and to finish his studies.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Angeline works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice. Angeline is borrowing 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store, like shampoo, coffee, eggs, canned goods and soft drinks.

Angeline successfully repaid her previous loan and so is now requesting another loan to further build her businesses. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to further expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store

loans.name: Merry Grace

texts.en:
Merry Grace is 29 years old and has three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 18000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, coffee, etc.

Merry Grace has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, and coffee.

loans.name: Anabentura

texts.es:
El tiempo empleado en el cultivo de los campos resulta ser muy dulce para Doña Anabentura. Ella es una humilde mujer, de 54 años de edad, que desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura y el comercio. Desde hace 25 años cultiva frijoles, maíz y trigo, productos que vende a otros comerciantes;  además desde hace 5 años tiene una pequeña pulpería en su hogar. Lo que la hace esforzase tanto para trabajar son sus hijas y el apoyo que recibe de su esposo. 

Doña Anabentura solicita el  crédito porque desea invertir en su pulpería para la compra de productos como café, azúcar, golosinas, etc. con el objetivo de tener más ventas y más clientes, y así de esta forma, con las ganancias que obtenga, poder tener un ingreso que le permita invertir en la compra de insumos para la cosecha de invierno. Las metas de esta honorable mujer son hacer crecer sus negocios y sus planes futuros son poder comprar más terrenos para sembrar.
texts.en:
Anabentura enjoys the time she spends tending crops. She is a humble 54-year-old woman who has been making a living in agriculture and commerce for 25 years, since she was very young.

She grows beans, corn and wheat, products she then sells to other retailers. In addition to that, 5 years ago she set up a small grocery shop in her house.

What motivates her to make such an effort to work so much are her daughters and the support she gets from her husband.

Anabentura is requesting this loan because she wants to invest in her store by buying products such as coffee, sugar, candy, etc. to increase sales and have more customers. This way, she will be able to make more profits and use them to buy agricultural supplies for the winter harvest.

This honorable woman's goal is to make her business grow and her plan for the future is to expand her fields.

loans.use: to buy products such as coffee, sugar and candy.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 38 years old and has two children. She is married, and one of her children is in school.

Rowena is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rowena has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rowena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Essavi

texts.fr: Divorcée, Essavi est une femme de 40 ans qui vit à Adidogomé avec deux enfants. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants, Essavi vend des  couches et des pinces linge afin d’avoir le revenu. Essavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et réalise un bon bénéfice grâce à son activité. Essavi désire ce microcrédit pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants et  générer assez de revenus pour améliorer son commerce.
texts.en:
Essavi, age 40, is divorced. She lives in Adidogomé with two children. She sells diapers and clothespins to make a living.

Twice a month, Essavi gets her supplies at the market. She turns a healthy profit thanks to her business.

She would like to obtain this loan to improve her business and generate enough income to better support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of diapers and 2 boxes of clothespins

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies that are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

She is positive that she can improve her business more if she can borrow 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to buy additional groceries, beverages, and toiletries. Simultaneously, she can sustain the needs of her family through this assistance.

Juliet dreams of being successful in her business. She hopes that she can continue meet her family's daily needs with the help of her store. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, beverages, and toiletries to expand her store.

loans.name: Maria Marieta

texts.en:
Maria Marieta used her previous loan to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for her family's daily needs and expenditures.

Maria Marieta is requesting another loan for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional groceries and other supplies she needs to increase her product inventory. She will also buy raw ingredients she needs to make more siomai and siopao which she sells. She hopes to sustain the needs of her familywith this loan.

Maria Marieta hopes that her business will continue to flourish and support her family's daily needs. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items, toiletries, and beverages

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 58 years old and has five children. She is a married woman.

Victoria is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines and requested a 6000 PHP loan through NWTF to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

Victoria has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Victoria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the rice grains and the laborers' salaries for her rice mill.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 59 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming flowering plants in the Philippines. Julieta is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like flowering bag, fertilizers, garden tools, etc.

Julieta has been farming flowering plants for 12 years and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like flowering bag, fertilizers, garden tools, etc.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristina is 53 years old and has one child in school.

Cristina has a broom-making business in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy bamboo sticks and other materials needed for her business.  

Cristina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Cristina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bamboo sticks and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Denalyn

texts.en:
Denalyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of banana to sell for her buy and sell banana business.

Denalyn has been in this business for eight years. Denalyn earns additional income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of banana to sell

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felomina is 58 years old now.

Felomina has a corn vending business in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more corn to sell.

Felomina has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Felomina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more corn to sell

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, four of whom are in school, Emelia works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling tomatoes in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.  Emelia is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional trays of tomatoes to sell for her business buying and selling tomatoes.

Emelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional trays of tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Gelina

texts.en:
Gelina is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gelina is 34 years old and two of her children are in school.

Gelina has a corn vending business in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more corn to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Gelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more corn to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 50 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of seed. Gina has been farming rice for 1 year and also earns additional income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of seed

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 54 years old and married with two children. Judith works very hard to provide for them.

Judith runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Judith has been in this business for 25 years now. 

In the future, Judith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Adi

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Adi. Adi lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 mi) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. He lives there with his wife and his children (one son and one daughter). Adi owns a stall that sells mobile phone accessories, mobile airtime credits and provides bill payment services to the community. He decided to join Ruma because he wanted to learn about how to expand his business using technology. Together with his wife, he realized that they need to save more money for their children’s education.  Adi is a friendly and informative mobile provider; that’s why he has many customers.

As the business grows, Adi needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits and provide more bill payment services to his community. Adi’s goal with Ruma is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community in the near future with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Adi is the one who is holding Ruma’s banner. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication and financial services by selling mobile airtime credits and providing bill payment services.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 53 years old and married with six children. She run and operates a small convenience shop selling a variety of food items. To earn extra income, she also sews dresses, skirts, and bed covers.

Lina needs a loan to buy mixed food items, a new sewing machine, and cloth materials to assist her in running the business. She plan to use her profits to extend her shop and also provide for her family's daily expenses. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy mixed food items, a new sewing machine, and cloth materials.

loans.name: Escolastico

texts.es:
Escolatico, se dedica a administrar una tienda en la que ofrece granos básicos y productos de primera necesidad tales como azúcar, especias, huevos, aceite, etc., lo abrió hace 3 años y lo aprendió con el apoyo de amistades, es una persona responsable que trabaja para que su familia tenga todo lo necesario para subsistir, vive con su esposa y un hijo de 14 años de edad.
Comprará sal, granos básicos, jugos, pan, galletas, duces, boquitas, harina, etc., para mejorar las ofertas en su negocio y atraer nuevos clientes, espera que su objetivo de incrementar ventas e ingresos se cumpla para cubrir sus compromisos.
El sr. Escolatico sueña con mantenerse trabajando mejorar la rentabilidad de su negocio y seguir brindándole a su familia un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en:
Escolastico makes a living running a store that offers basic grains and daily needs such as sugar, spices, eggs, oils, etc.   He opened the business three years ago and he learned from friends.  He is a responsible person who works to ensure that his family has what is necessary to subsist.  He lives with his wife and a 14 year old son.  

He will buy salt, basic grains, juices, bread, crackers, candies, snacks, and flour to  improve the offerings at his business and attract new clients.  He hopes that his goal of increasing sales and income will be realized so that he can cover his costs.  Mr. Escolastico dreams of working to increase the profitability of his business and continuing to offer his family a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy salt, basic grains, juices, breads, crackers, candies, snacks, flour, etc. to improve the offerings at his business and attract new clients.

loans.name: Las Abejitas Group

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 60 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos varones de 23 y 25 años, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, comprensiva, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, optimista, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ que se encuentra a 14 kilómetros de la ciudad, en este lugar tienen sus viviendas de residencia los agricultores que cultivan la tierra en el trópico, estas casas son usadas cuando sacan sus productos del trópico a comercializarlos en la ciudad. De clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 6-17 grados centígrados.
Julia es de tez morena, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por los negocios que realiza (la primera de la izquierda, viste blusa rosada). Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio y con sus hijos que estudian y trabajan, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. La necesidad de ampliar su negocio para generar mejores ingresos económicos y ayudar con los gastos de su familia la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de leche, venta de carne de cordero, venta de productos de higiene personal, venta de blusas, venta de fruta, llantería y venta de pollo, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad como; pan, azúcar, fideo, arroz, aceite, galletas, refrescos y otros en una tienda de barrio ubicada en su domicilio. Actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana en horarios del día. Ella quiere ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de un carrito para vender comida rápida como; hamburguesas, salchipapa (salchicha con papas fritas) y otros, por las noches porque no existe ningún negocio de este tipo. “trabaj durante el día atendiendo mo tienda de barrio, los clientes me exigen que me dedique a la venta de comida durante las noches…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que lo realiza en su domicilio y no debe transportarse a ningún otro lugar, la desventaja es que trabaja sola y no tiene quien la ayude. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio, ella desea realizar la compra de un carrito para la venta de comida rápida. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Julia solicita un préstamo para la compra de un carrito para la venta de comida rápida durante las noches para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 60-year-old woman. She is married and has two sons, aged 23 and 25. She owns a small store where she sells food and essential products.

Julia is a good mother. She is understanding, patient, supportive, optimistic, responsible, hardworking, and a good listener. Her business is located in Sacaba, which is located 14 km [9 miles] from the city [Cochabamba]. Farmers who work in the countryside stay in their houses in the city when they come to sell their produce. The city has mild weather, with a temperature that ranges between 6 and 7 °C [43 to 63 °F].

Julia has a dark complexion. Her hair is dark brown and tied up, and she has brown eyes. She is short, and in good shape. Her mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken by locals. She also speaks Spanish due to cultural and professional reasons (she is the first one from right to left and is wearing a pink blouse). She shares her life with her husband, who is a businessman, and her children, who study and work. They own a brick house with metal roof, where they live. It is served with electricity and they take their water from a well.

Julia needs to expand her business and increase her income in order to help to cover the home expenses. This is why she started a group with people that work selling milk, lamb meat, hygiene products, blouses, fruits and chicken, or repairing tires, to request a loan and improve her activity. She sells food and essential products such as bread, sugar, noodles, rice, vegetable oil, cookies, beverages, etc., in a grocery store she has at home. She works every day during regular working hours.

Julia wants to expand her business by buying a fast food cart to sell hamburgers, salchipapa (a mix of sausages and French fries), and other things. She wants to do this at night, because no one else has this kind of business. “I work during daytime selling to my customers, who tell me that I should sell fast food at night,” she says. The advantage of having this store at home is that she does not have to travel to go to work. However, she works alone, so no one helps her. Her dream is to expand her business.

Julia wants to buy a cart to sell fast food. This is her second loan with the institution. She has had her grocery store for five years. This is why Julia is requesting a loan to buy a cart to sell fast food at night and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy a cart to sell fast food.

loans.name: Allin Muju Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ALLIN MUJU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luisa ella es casada y tiene 44 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 70:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
Las socias que esta pegadas a la foto grupal se le tomo despues la foto, porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de pollos, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de confección de ropa, negocio de carpintería y negocio de construcción.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank "Allin Muju".   This group is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.  

One member is Mrs. Luisa.  She is married and 44 years old with 3 children.  She works in her business, a grocery store, where she sells everyday products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She works from 8:00am until 7:00 pm.  She has 10 years experience in this business and it is going very well.  The member's dream is to expand her grocery store business.  The member is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.  The member is happy to receive the loan and promises to comply with the repayment schedule.  

The members whose photos are attached to the group photo got their pictures taken later, because they asked to miss the meeting for work reasons.   The other members make livings selling chickens, running a grocery store, running a garment selling business, a carpentry workshop, and a construction business.  

The members thank those who form part of this dream through this loan, and promise to comply with the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan had greatly enriched her business. She was able to buy products and supplies which are needed in her business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenditures.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will let her borrow again an amount of 20,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional grocery items, toiletries, and beverages which she resells. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family through the help of this assistance.

Teodora hopes to be able to save for the future of her family and dreams of expanding her business soon. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work, and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase her income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow for milk production to enable him increase his income and achieve his farming objectives.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is married and 46 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Juanita has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell.

She has been in this business for 28 years. In the future, Juanita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Emelita works hard to support her family.
