She has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling rice.  Emelita is borrowing 27,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy additional dried fish to sell for her business.

Emelita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Elis

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma agents, Elis. Elis lives in Sukabumi, a city located at the foot of Mount Gede in West Java, about 80 km (50 mi) from the national capital of Indonesia, Jakarta. She lives there with her husband and her only daughter. Elis owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their child’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. 

As the business grows, Elis needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are. Elis’s goal in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. Elis is the one who is standing in her own stall in the photo. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members who want to use mobile phones to connect with loved ones.

loans.name: Mean

texts.en:
Mean is a 19-year-old single freshman who is from the Prey Veng Province in Cambodia. 

He is pursuing an associate’s degree, majoring in banking and finance, at a university in the province. His father is a house builder and his mother is a rice farmer. 

Mean is lacking the finances to cover his university fees from the first to the second year, and therefore he needs a loan. This loan will enable him to successfully earn his associate’s degree. 

Concerning his future dreams, he is going to find a proper job with a reasonable salary. With this, he will be able to help his family and save money to renovate the house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the second year

loans.name: Arenas De Villa Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  6 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “ARENA DE VILLA” una de ellas es la Sra. Sandra de 35 años soltera y con 1 hijos, la Sra. Sandra  se dedica ya hace 3 años a ser Venta de Ropa en un pequeño local  todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de su hijo, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Sandra ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de su hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que su hijo sea profesional es por eso  que la Sra. Sandra trabaja mucho, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más mercadería (tela, hilos. maquinas, ETC) y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la Sra. Sandra  se encuentra parada en la parte de atrás y se le distingue con una blusa color negra, se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en: A group made up of six people responsible for different commercial activities, here are the members of the "Arena de Villa" community group.  One of them is Sandra, 35, who is single and has one child. Sandra has been dedicated for three years to being a clothes seller in a small shop every day with the merit of getting ahead and being able to pay for her son's education. With the fruit of her effort, Sandra has managed to improve her house and support her child's education. By continuing to improve her business, her greatest wish is that her son becomes a professional. For this Sandra works hard. With the loan granted, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise (fabric, thread, machines, etc.) and thus be able to have more income. Sandra is standing in the back and is distinguished by a black blouse. She says goodbye with a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo and is thankful for the loan granted since it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is grateful that she was granted a Php50,000 loan which she used to buy another PC unit to serve her growing clients. She is glad that through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would now like to apply for a Php40,000 which she will use to pay for the repair and maintenance of her personal computers at her Internet shop to ensure efficient and satisfactory service. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help and a good outcome of her business, for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance and fund her children's education.

Teresa aims to have more branches for her internet shop. She desires for her children to finish their studies and earn a college degree. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capita and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her personal computers to rent out.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Erlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase canned goods, milk, noodles, eggs, coffee, soft drinks, etc for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Erlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, milk, noodles, eggs, coffee, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 34 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Merlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Merlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

She has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Merlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, home care products and other grocries

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda is 52 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Glenda has been in this business for five years.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 48 years old and married with three children. With one child in school, Merlita works very hard to provide for the family.

Merlita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Merlita has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Merlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 48 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, diapers, milk, spices, soft drinks, etc.

Marilou has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Marilou aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, diapers, milk, spices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Proserfina

texts.en:
Proserfina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Proserfina is 68 years old now.

Proserfina has a buying and selling of ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell like shirts, etc.

Proserfina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Proserfina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, etc.

loans.name: Rodalyn

texts.en:
Rodalyn is a 42-year-old married woman with three children, who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rodalyn has a buy-and-sell beverage business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy soft drinks, coconut wine, etc. to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Rodalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, coconut wine, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a 51-year-old married woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Rosalina has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell in her stall. She has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell in her stall

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 37 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Maribel has been in this business for three years now. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 42 years old and married with three children who are in school. Belinda works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, soft drinks, etc.

Belinda has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Belinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 40 years old and has seven children. Marilyn is married, and two of her children are in school.

Marilyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marilyn has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Wilfredo Geovani

texts.es:
Wilfredo, repara y vende llantas para vehículos, además ofrece el servicio de transporte, es casado, vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 20, 18, 16, 12 y 7 años de edad, su taller de llantas lo tiene hace 13 años, sus hijos mayores le ayudan a realizar los trabajos, su horario es de 6:30 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. su gran experiencia le ayudan a tener a sus clientes satisfechos y su ventaja es que en la zona no tiene mucha competencia.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar llantas, neumáticos y un destornillador de presión, equipara su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio, al contar con los recursos necesarios don Wilfredo espera administrar muy bien el crédito para obtener los mejores beneficios.
Los sueños que Wilfredo desea cumplir son  realizar la compra de una propiedad para construir su casa propia, mantener funcionando su negocio y abrir un nuevo punto de atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Wilfredo repairs and sells tires for vehicles, and also offers transportation services.  He is married and lives with his wife and his children, who are 20, 18, 16, 12, and 7 years old.   He has had his tire workshop for 13 years.  His older children help him to complete the work.   His work schedule is from 6:30 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  His great service allows him to have satisfied clients and his advantage is that there is not much competition in the area.  

He will use the credit to buy rims, tires and a pressure screwdriver, which will equip his business to offer better service.  Upon having these resources, Mr. Wifredo hopes to administer the loan well in order to obtain the greatest benefits.  The dreams Wilfredo hopes to accomplish are buying a property to build his own house, continue to maintain his business, and open a new service center for his clients.

loans.use: to buy tires, rims, and a pressure screwdriver which will equip his business to offer better service.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria, por la buena atención recibida y facilidad de pago que le brinda la institución esta agradecida y se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar verduras, embutidos, carnes, pollo, aceite, etc., para elaborar la venta de comida, hot dogs y papas, le permitirá seguir teniendo una fuente de ingresos.
Con el crédito anterior se limitó a comprar ingredientes necesarios para fortalecer el comedor, las ganancias las ha invertido en un coche para elaborar  hot dogs y papas y está dando a su familia un mejor estilo de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Candelaria is grateful for the good service and easy payments offered by the institution.  She has decided to apply for a new loan to buy vegetables, cold meats, meats, chicken, oil, etc, to prepare food for sale, hot dogs and potatoes. This will allow her to continue having a source of earnings. With the last loan, she could only buy the necessary ingredients to source the cafeteria. She invested the earnings on a little cart to prepare hot dogs and potatoes and be able to provide a better lifestyle to her family.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, cold meats, meats, chicken, oil, etc to prepare food for sale, hot dogs and potatoes

loans.name: Rheena May

texts.en:
Rheena May is 24 years old and married. She works hard to support her family. Rheena May sells dried fish business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from food vending. 

Rheena May is requesting her sixth loan from NWTF for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy dried fish to sell. She hopes that she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Khatoon

texts.en:
Khatoon is a 58-year-old, married woman and the mother of a son.

Her son has been doing embroidery work through a machine at home to support the family. He has become expert in embroidery through the machine, but a few days ago his machine became out of order due to continuous work. Now he wants to buy a new embroidery machine to continue his business.

Therefore, Khatoon requested a loan to buy an embroidery machine for her son's business so that her son can stitch more embroidery dresses to sell and could grow their income. 

Khatoon hopes to get a boost in her son's earnings through his large sales. She thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine for her son's business

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is the age of 45. She is living with her spouse and two children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a small vegetable shop for many years in a nearby town and earning reasonable income. With the passage of time, the inflation increases day by day, but the sources of income remain constant. To grow the income, he wants to turn his enterprise towards progress. For the purchasing of more produce, he does not have a sufficient amount. He tried to borrow some money from his friends and relatives, but nobody helped him. 

Therefore, Bushra requested a loan for her husband so that her husband would be able to buy more fresh vegetables to sell. Bushra thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables for her husband's shop

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
Noé, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado y se dedica a la pesca artesana en una laguna, también siembra granos básicos, está acompañado y vive junto a su pareja y sus dos hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad, su pareja se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos.    

Noé, es una persona que conoce muy bien acerca de la pesca artesanal y la siembra de granos básicos, dicha actividad la ejerce desde que tenía 12 años de edad, todo lo aprendió de su padre, quien ejercía dichas labores y es lo que le ha permitido sobresalir con su familia, también su pareja le apoya en las actividades..
  
Noé, utilizará el dinero del crédito para comprar redes para el equipo de pesca.

Noé, tiene como visión obtener  una buena estabilidad para su familia,  mejorar su vivienda para mayor seguridad y también que sus hijos se gradúen de una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Noé  is 29 years old, studied through 9th grade, and makes a living through artisanal fishing in a lake.  He also cultivates basic grains.  He is accompanied by his partner and his two children, who are 6 and 3 years old.  His parter does all of the housework.  

Noé is a person who is experienced in artisanal fishing and grain cultivation.  He has completed the said activities since he was 12 years old.  He learned from his father, who completed these same labors, which has permitted him to get ahead with his family.  His partner also offers assistance in the business. 

Noé will use the money from the loan to buy nets for his fishing equipment.  Noé's vision is to obtain stability for his family, improve his house for better security, and have his children graduate with university degrees.

loans.use: to buy nets for fishing equipment.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 26 years old, and married with six children. She owns a small garden where she grows cabbage, tomatoes, beans, and other vegetables that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for almost two years.

She needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, seeds, a container spray, a wheelbarrow, a spade, a rake, a hoe and a knife to assist her in running the business.

She plans to use her loan to improve her garden and meet her family's daily expenses. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, seeds, a container spray, a wheelbarrow, a spade, a rake, a hoe and a knife

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer to foliate and fertilize pineapple.

loans.name: Sorpresa Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mazahua se formó un grupo de préstamo de nombre “Sorpresa”. Doña Leticia, una de las integrantes, fue quien eligió el nombre ya que para ella es realmente una sorpresa que VisionFund la visite hasta su comunidad para ofrecerle un préstamo.  
Todas las integrantes del grupo son mujeres mazahuas, las conversaciones que mantienen entre ellas son completamente en su lengua materna, pero también dominan el español. 
Adelina de 67 años sigue siendo una mujer muy activa y alegre, madre de 7 hijos, ya todos independientes. Desde niña, estuvo involucrada en el campo y los animales debido a que sus padres eran campesinos así que cuando formó su familia y decidió ayudar con los gastos del hogar, sabía que era momento de poner en práctica todo lo aprendido. 
Con sus ahorros, compro algunos corderos para cuidarlos y vender al cabo de unos meses. Adelina continuó con la actividad por poco más de 20 años. Durante ese tiempo también se dedicaba a elaborar artesanías mazahuas que es el negocio que aún conserva. Ella utiliza su préstamo para comprar materia prima como tela cuadrille, estambre, hilos de diferentes colores y agujas. Las piezas que crea son servilletas, manteles, ganchos, dibujando flores y animales de colores en la tela, parte de la iconografía mazahua. 
Adelina se muestra agradecida por los préstamos que ha recibido y que le permitieron tener ganancias para construir una casa propia y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Su única meta ahora es continuar bordando para tener su propio ingreso y poder solventar sus gastos. 

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Leticia y Diana quienes también invertirán en bordados; Juana, Juliana e Hilaria invertirán en borregos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el parque del municipio, Doña Adelina, Juana e Hilaria aparecen con sus trajes típicos, doña Adelina viste la nahua de color morado*
texts.en:
In a Mazahua community, the loan group with the name "Sorpresa" ("surprise") formed. Leticia, one of the members, was who elected the name since, for her, it is truly a surprise that VisionFund visited their community to offer them loans. All of the members of the group are Mazahua women. The conversations that they have with each other are completely in their mother tongue but they also speak in Spanish.

Adelina, 67, continues to be a very active and happy woman, mother to seven children who are all adults. Since she was young, she was involved in the countryside and animals since her parents were peasants so when she started a family and decided to help with the family expenses she knew that it was her time to put into practice everything she had learned.

With her savings, she bought some lambs to take care of and sell after some months. Adelina continued with this work for a little more than twenty years. During this time, she was also dedicated to making Mazahua crafts, which is the business she still manages. She uses the loan to buy raw material like checkered table cloth, yarn, different colored thread and needles. The pieces that she creates are napkins, table cloths, hooks, drawing flowers and animals in color on the fabric, a part of the Mazahua iconography.

Adelina is thankful for the loans she has received and that allow her to have income to build her own house and get her children ahead. Her only goal now is to keep embroidering so she has her own income and can pay her bills.

The other members of the group are Leticia and Diana who also will invest in embroidery; Juana, Juliana and Hilaria will invest in sheep.

*The photo was taken in the town park. Adelina, Juana and Hilaria appear with their typical costime. Adelina is wearing the purple nahua.

loans.use: to buy raw material like checkered table cloth, yarn, different colored thread and needles.

location.town: San Nicolas Guadalupe, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is 57 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

Pacita has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from selling vegetables.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gloria works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of dried coconut meat business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Gloria is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more coconut to sell for her buying and selling of dried coconut meat business.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more coconuts to sell

loans.name: Regie Joy

texts.en:
Regie Joy is 26 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Regie Joy has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of household goods to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 49 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Merlyn has borrowed and repaid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 42 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, groceries, canned goods, etc.

Gemma has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming rice and pre-paid mobile load.

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, shampoo, groceries, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Helina

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Helina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Helina is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

Helina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lolita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Lolita is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional fish nets and materials for her fishing business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish nets and materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 43 years old and married with eleven children. With three children currently in school, Christina works very hard to provide for them.

Christina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, milk, juice, cereals, noodles, etc. to sell. Christina has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Christina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, soft-drinks, milk, juice, cereals, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Lorelyn

texts.en:
Lorelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 9 years. 

Lorelyn is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like rice, shampoo, noodles, sugar, groceries, canned goods, etc. for her general store business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

Lorelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like rice, shampoo, noodles, sugar, groceries, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, manifiesta que el crédito anterior ha tenido un impacto positivo en su negocio, ya que la cosecha fue abundante, permitiéndole abastecer a su familia y a sus clientes, con las ganancias ha construido una habitación más en su vivienda y tiene 3 vacas más, aún realiza los trabajos talabartería. 
Debido a la buena experiencia que tiene con los créditos nuevamente solicita un financiamiento para comprar fertilizantes, abono, insecticidas, semilla mejorada de maíz y maicillo, continuara trabajando en la agricultura.
texts.en: José says that the previous loan has had a positive impact on his business since the harvest was abundant, allowing him to provide for his family and his customers. With the income, he has built one more room in his house and has three more cows. He still performs saddlery work. Due to the good experience he had with the loans, he is requesting a new loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizers, insecticides, improved corn and sorghum seeds so he can keep working in agriculture.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizers, insecticides, improved corn and sorghum seeds and to continue working in agriculture.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Concepcion has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Concepcion is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Ruqama

texts.en:
Ruqama is a 31-year-old married woman who has been running a secondary school for some years. There are close to 90 students in the school, studying in classes from nursery to Class 10. 

Ruqama's commitment to providing the children in her community with quality education is what prompted her to start a school, and it is this commitment that guides her as she takes action to improve and expand her school. Ruqama wants to provide her students with a comfortable school environment that is conducive to learning well. 

She therefore requires a loan of PKR 110,000 to purchase chairs and fans for classrooms, and to build a washroom for her students.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and fans for classrooms, and to build a washroom for her students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy achiote, black pepper, cinnamon, cumin amongst other spices wholesale to stock his business.

loans.name: Señor De Coylloriti Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa ella es conviviente y tiene 57 años y tiene 9 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de maíz, la socia vende maíz al por mayor, la socia también tiene un grifo,la socia en el negocio de venta de maíz ya tiene 30 años y le va muy bien,la socia es una mujer trabajadora que por medio de estos epuqeño negocios la socia saca adelante a su hijos, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender maíz. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz al por mayor.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo ya que los horarios con la reunion se les cruzaba.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de venta de comida y negocio de tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SEÑOR DE COYLLORITTY” coomunal bank which is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

Rosa is 57 years old, in a common-law relationship and has 9 children. She works in her business selling corn. She sells corn wholesale and she also has a gas station. She has been selling corn for 30 years and things are going well for her. She is a hard-working woman who through these small businesses has raised her children. She works from 8 am until 5 pm. Her dream is to have a commercial space where she can sell her corn. She is requesting the loan to buy corn wholesale.

The members who are in the adjoined photo had their photos taken after the group meeting as they had requested permission to be absent as their work interfered with the time of the meeting. The other members work selling clothing, a taxi service, selling food, and a grocery store. The members thanks those who form part of this dream through this loan and promise to pay their loan installments in the established time.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Julieta is supportive of five children. She is engaged in flower vending and flower gardening. She buys and retails a variety of flowers in the nearest village; at the same time, she also buys seedlings of flowers. Her husband is a farmer who plants corn. The income they have is enough to support their basic needs, but Julieta is not content because she wants to have savings for an emergency.  

Julieta applied for a loan with Paglaum to expand her capital and buy fertilizer for flower gardening and vending. She hopes that someday, she can own a flower shop in their village.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for flower gardening vending

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 62-year-old married woman with six children and is a resident of D'ban, Calamba, Philippines. 

She has been in this business for more than a decade and vegetable vending is her primary source of livelihood. She became a member of Paglaum MPC last June 2010. 

Anecita, decided to apply for a loan to buy additional vegetables for her vegetable vending business. She hopes to increase her income with more inventory to sell. In the future, she hopes to save money for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Marifi

texts.en:
Marifi is a 30-year-old  married resident of Poblacion, La Libertad, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. She has one school-age daughter.  

She opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member last April 2011 and has taken out three loans. 

She is applying for 5,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store.  In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart  and  see her daughter finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy stock items.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane earns a living by operating a butchery, where she sells meat. She got her start as a clothes vendor, but she has been involved in her butchery business for six years now. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She is married and describes herself as honest.

Jane will use her Kes 50,000 loan to buy a stock of meat to offer for sale. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within five years.

loans.use: buy a stock of meat to offer for sale

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to buy additional grocery products and other supplies needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs.

Nida now focuses on buying and selling ready-to-wear items like undergarments, women's dresses and men's clothes and other merchandise which is also helping her to provide for her family. She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her an amount of 18,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of clothing items she needs to improve her business. Her customers will be likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed on her store. An increase in sales will also result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result for her business to become viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she could sustain the needs of her family.

Nida wants to improve their present financial condition, and she hopes to grow her business as well as start up other business opportunities. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for different varieties of clothing items she now sells.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maribel works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and also earns additional income selling pre-paid mobile phone credits.  Maribel is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more sales stock like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc., for her general store.

Maribel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sales stock, like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, age 54, fattens pigs to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for two years, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. 

She and her husband have six children, one of whom still attends school.

Helen requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family of 3 children.

She has a food vending business and requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase  milk, sugar, beans, and fruit for her business.

Michelle has sustained her business through 6 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream  which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase  milk, sugar, beans, and fruit.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia works hard to support her family of 2 children.

She has a direct selling beauty & household products business and earns additional income operating a general store.  Alicia requests 9,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy  tea.

Alicia has sustained her business through 2 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy tea.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 64-year-old married woman with thirteen children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lilia has had a fish vending business for 5 years and  requests  1,0000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish to sell.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy  fish.

loans.name: Armaine

texts.en:
Armaine, age 20, buys and sells bread to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for three years. She and her husband have three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 
 
Armaine requested a loan in the amount of PhP 9,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more bread to offer for sale.

In the future, Armaine would like to save enough enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy bread to offer for sale

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 21 years old, married and has two children. 

She is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Mary Jane has been farming vegetables for six years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn earns her living as a fish vendor. She has been in this business for 11 years now. She is married and works hard to support her family. 

Madelyn successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more fish to offer for sale to her customers.

In the future, Madelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Jagannatha Group

texts.en:
Supriya, aged 32, is the leader of a Jagannatha group that hails from Muribahal village of Bolangir district, Odisha, India. She lives with her husband and has three children, aged 12, 8 and 2 years. The member standing at back row, fourth person from the right-hand side of her group with a raised hand, is Supriya. 

Supriya has a house in her village which is also used for a domestic and grocery shop purpose with the active support of her husband. Her husband is helping her in grocery item transportation and selling in their shop. 

Supriya, along with 10 other self-dependent members of her village, formed a group and took a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for development of their existing businesses and better livelihoods. The concerned members are under the poverty line, but they didn't fail to sacrifice their life and instead raised their heads toward their family and community growth. 

Before this loan, her income (5,800 INR per month) was not sufficient to meet the daily requirements of the family. Out of their small income, they are maintaining their family in a very pitiable condition. Now she is very much confident in the grocery business and acquainted herself with the market situation. 

She already has taken a loan from Mahashakti Foundation and wishes to purchase more and more quantities of grocery items like wheat, rice, oil, spices, and other sample items from the nearest market. Both she and her husband will develop their business and meet their social needs.

The other 10 members of her group are well planned to establish their business like a grocery shop, vegetable cultivation, a milk business, a Xerox shop, a mixed shop, a chicken stall, a rice business, tailoring and laundry, etc.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, rice, oil, spices, biscuits, sugar, tea, soap and washing powder

loans.name: Los Amigos Del Once Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 5 personas responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “LOS AMIGOS DEL ONCE” una de ellas es la Sra. Nancy de 37 años soltera y con 1 hijos, la Sra. Nancy  se dedica ya hace 3 años a ser Venta de Comida en un pequeño local  todos los días con el mérito de salir adelante y así poder pagar el colegio de su hijo, Con el fruto de su esfuerzo la Sra. Nancy ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y apoyar en la educación de su hijos. Seguir mejorando su negocio, su mayor deseo es que su hijo sea profesional es por eso  que la Sra. Nancy trabaja mucho, Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más mercadería (arroz, menestras,carnes, ETC) y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez a la Sra. Nancy  se encuentra parada en la parte de atrás y se le distingue con una blusa color negra, se despide con un abrazo a Kiva y Edaprospo y  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
A group formed by five responsible people with different businesses; such are the members of the “Los Amigos del Once” communal group. One of them is Nancy, who is 37 years old and single and has a son. For the last three years, Nancy has made a living by selling food in a small stall every day in order to get ahead and to be able to pay for her son's school. With the results of her efforts, Nancy has been able to improve her home and support her child's education, and to keep improving her business. Her greatest desire is for her son to be a professional; that is why Nancy works a lot. She will invest the loan granted in buying more merchandise (rice, beans, meats, etc.). In this way she will be able to have more earnings. 

Nancy is standing in the back and can be seen wearing a black shirt. She says good-bye with a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo, and she thanks them for the loan provided, as it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy beans, vegetables and meats

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn, age 49 and widowed, has supported herself for more than three years with her monthly pension as a surviving spouse. She is also receiving support from her two adult children as the caretaker of her grandchildren. In total, she receives about PhP 1,800 per month. She lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental.

Merlyn has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Merlyn hopes to build up her hog-fattening business, which she has started in order to better support herself.

Merlyn has requested a loan to be used for purchasing an anti-rabies vaccine for her treatment.

loans.use: to purchase an anti-rabies vaccine

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, age 66 and widowed, earns a living by operating her sari-sari (general store) business. She also sells coconuts and copra, which is the dried meat of the coconut that used to extract coconut oil. She has been engaged in this work for two years and earns approximately PhP 4,000 each month. She lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, and has two children. 

Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for four years. She has requested a loan in order to purchase additional stocks of grocery items and other consumable products to offer for sale in her store. 

In the future, Erlinda hopes to expand her sari-sari store business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of grocery items and other consumable products to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is a businesswoman who earns her income through retailing various items. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks. She is on her way to finishing her house. She wishes to live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of cement and hollow blocks

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda has started her small business and became successful in managing her sari-sari store. She needs to have enough inventory to serve her customers well.  Everyday, she made good sales because of her effort and good salesmanship. Recently she approached Paglaum for her much needed capital to restock store with basic commodities. 

In the future, she hopes to build a descent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a widow with three adult-age children. Her major source of income from operating a grocery store. She has been in this business for years. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children. 

She continues to operate the business because it provides a good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her children. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She plans to expand the business for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. 

She is a previous borrower and is re-applying for a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar works hard to support her family. Maricar is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase new fish nets, bamboo, and gasoline for her business.

Maricar has been in this business for 12 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase new fish nets, bamboo, and gasoline for her business

loans.name: Darwenda

texts.en:
Darwenda is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Darwenda is 26 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Darwenda has a fish-selling business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Darwenda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Darwenda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Brigette

texts.en:
Brigette, age 31, earns her living by operating a general store. She has been in this business for two years and and sells a variety of items in her store, such as soap, milk, juice, shampoo, oil, and condiments. She and her husband have two children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Brigette requested a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy shampoo, coffee, and other grocery items to offer for sale.

In the future, Brigette would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, coffee, and other grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is married with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Narcisa is 54 years old and two of her children are in school.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables and spices in the Philippines. Narcisa has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices to sell.

Narcisa has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Narcisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables and spices to sell

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 53 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Elisa operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years. She earns additional income from selling purified water.

Elisa requested her second loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell in her general store such as condiments, salts, home care products, and other groceries. She hopes to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, salts, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercedes is 41 years old and one of her children is currently in school.

Mercedes has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mercedes has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking foods and frozen foods for her food production business.

Mercedes has been in this business for four years. Mercedes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking foods and frozen foods for her food production business

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 33-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma has run a general store for 10 years and requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to buy condiments, canned goods, home  care products and other groceries.  Sells a variety of items such as vinegar, soy sauce, junk foods, noodles, biscuits, and other groceries. 

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy condiments, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Myrallen

texts.en:
Myrallen works hard to support her family of 5 children.

She has a fishing business and earns additional income from selling dried fish. Myrallen  requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase a additional fishing net for her  business.

Myrallen has sustained her business through 21 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. Elsa is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Elsa has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Elsa has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Elsa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fatten and sell animals

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 40 years old and lives in Dapitan, in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. In order to help the family, she sells snacks. Aside from selling snacks, she operates a sari-sari store. 

In 2013, she became an active member of Paglaum MPC with good credit standing. She wants to obtain financial assistance in the amount of 5,000 PHP to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store because her income from selling snacks is not sufficient for her daily needs. 

She plans to send her children to college so that they can help her in the future, and to repair their house.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila, age 60, earns a living from preparing and selling cooked snacks, mainly puto (a type of steamed rice cake) and hot cakes. She also prepares and sells barbecue. She has been engaged in this business for over seven years and earns approximately PhP 3,000 each month. She and her husband have two children, one grown and one attending school. She lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. 
 
Leonila has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. She requested a loan in order to buy raw ingredients such as malagkit rice, flour, sugar, margarine, oil, and baking powder for making her snack items, as well as meat and seasoning for her barbecue business. 
 
In the future, she hopes to be able to set up shop in a little stall for her snack and barbecue vending business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack and barbecue business

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa, 52 years old,  has been an active member of CCT for years  and she was able to acquire several loans to earn a good profit from her business. She helps her husband to provide for their daily needs and was inspired to improve their lives because she wants to give her family the best for their future. She works hard each day and she is  close to reaching her goals.

Ma. Luisa owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone of making her dreams become a reality. She knows how important it is for her neighbors and daily consumers to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, aPhp5-worth of cooking oil, an egg,  or toothpaste. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price then she sells it per piece for a higher price at  a profit.

She desires to manage a bigger store someday so she requests  8,000 PHP which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she can improve their present financial condition and provide more for her family.

Ma. Luisa meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business  and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, toiletries and beverages.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.en:
Constancia earns an income through her snack vending business. She is a full-fledged member of PMPC and enjoys the benefits of insurance and financial assistance. 

She applied for a loan to purchase marine plywood, nails, sticks and "nipa" thatch for her house. She began repairing her house and hopes to live comfortably and wishes nothing more than to have a happy and healthy life with her family.

loans.use: to purchase marine plywood, nails, sticks, and "nipa" thatch for her house.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. Her earnings helped to cover her everyday needs. 

She would now like to apply for 8,000 PHP   to buy rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, canned goods and toiletries which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Pacita dreams of having a bigger general store, improving her quality of life,  and good health. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and  draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Until recently, Joana worked as a housemaid, where she received only PhP 1,500 each month. As a conscientious wife and the responsible mother of three children, she chose instead to start up a business preparing and selling snack items. Her primary motivation is to support her husband in raising their family. Her business is doing well, and she is devoted to perfecting her own snack recipes. She is maximizing her profits and is continuing to pursue her goals for the good of her family. 

She requested a loan from PMPC in order to buy raw ingredients for her snack vending business. This investment will allow her to cater to more customers, and eventually to be able to accept custom orders for additional earnings. She hopes and prays that her business will grow, and she intends to explore other snack recipes to increase her sales. 

In the future, Joana wishes to build a decent house for the family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Myla

texts.en: Myla, 45, is married with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For two years, Myla has been running a general store in the Philippines. Myla requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy more groceries to sell in her store. Myla would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca, 58, is married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. For three years, Francisca has been running a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a 7000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy supplies such as garments and other materials needed for her business. In the future, Francisca would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella is 59 years old and married with six children. With one child in school, Estrella works very hard to provide for her family.

Estrella runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Estrella has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canton, coffee, dried fish, condiments, shampoo, fabric,  conditioner, and peanuts. 

In the future, Estrella would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Nelfa

texts.en: Nelfa is 37 years old and married with two children who are in school. Nelfa works very hard to provide for them. She has been selling charcoal in the Philippines for 10 years. Nelfa has requested a 26,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future Nelfa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Luis Gilberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de treinta y cuatro años, es casado tiene una familia de tres hijos de las cuales son dos mujeres y un hombre, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Luis con el propósito de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, se dedica a la albañilería construyendo, casa muros y todo lo relacionado con construcción, el realiza esta actividad desde hace seis años, pero para mejorar sus ingresos él trabaja también como guardián de seguridad.

Luis desde hace algún tiempo se ha dado cuenta que su casa no cuenta con mucha seguridad porque está muy expuesto a que cualquier persona entre en la casa, y eso a él le preocupa mucho, por tal motivo él solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, hierro, block para circular su casa y mejorarla.
El gran sueño de Luis es poder conseguir el crédito cuanto antes, para brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia y algún día cuente con un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Luis, 34, is married and has a family with three children, two girls and a boy.  They live in a community in Sololá.

Luis works as a bricklayer building houses, walls, and everything related to construction so he can earn an income and support his family.  He has worked in this job for six years, but he also works as a security guard to improve his income.

Luis has realized for some time that his house has very little security.  It's very exposed and anyone could get into the house, which worries him a lot.  For that reason he's requesting a loan to buy cement, rebar, and cinder blocks to build a wall around his house to improve it.

His big dream is to be able to get the loan as soon as possible to provide his family with better security.  He wants to have his own business one day.

loans.use: to buy cement, rebar, and cinder blocks to build a wall and improve his house

loans.name: Jose Ramon

texts.es:
José, es una persona soltera que se dedica  a realizar actividades agrícolas, cultiva maíz, yuca, entre otros, es el responsable de criar y cubrir las necesidades de sus dos hijos, vive únicamente con sus hijos de 8 y 15 años de edad, inicia a trabajar cada día a las cuatro de la mañana sin tener una hora de exacta de finalización de labores.
Necesita el crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes y semillas para llevar a cabo sus cultivos de temporada, esperando tener una cosecha abundante para abastecer a su familia de alimento y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.
Sueña con tener mayor productividad, resarcir sus deudas y dar a sus hijos todo el apoyo posible para se puedan superar y tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José is single and makes a living in agriculture; he grows corn and cassava, among other items. He is responsible for raising his two children and providing what they need. He lives with just his children, who are 8 and 15 years old. He starts working each day at four in the morning and does not have an exact time that he finishes his work.

He needs the loan to buy manure, fertilizers and seeds to grow his seasonal crops. He is hoping to have an abundant harvest to stock his family with food and meet his customer's demands. He dreams of having greater productivity, repaying his debts and giving his children all of the support possible so they can overcome obstacles and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizers and seeds to grow his seasonal crops

loans.name: Walter Alexander

texts.es:
Walter, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo año de bachillerato, desempeña la actividad de pesca artesana en una laguna, también es albañil y siembra granos básicos, está acompañado y vive junto a su pareja y su hijo de 3 años de edad. 

Walter, es una persona que conoce muy bien acerca de la pesca artesanal, esta actividad la aprendió de su papá y de sus dos tíos que también hacían lo mismo y la siembra de granos básicos realiza desde hace varios años.- La albañilería la aprendió a través de unos amigos que le dieron la oportunidad como ayudante, todo esto le ha permitido suplir las necesidades de su familia.  
  
Walter, utilizará el dinero del crédito para comprar redes y una lancha, para complementar su equipo de pesca y así obtener mejores resultados. 

Walter, sueña con tener estabilidad con su familia, mejorar su vivienda para mayor seguridad y tener un buen equipo de pesca, para mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Walter is 23 years old, studied up to the second year of high school, and works as an artisanal fisherman in a lake. He is also a stonemason and grows basic grains. He is in a relationship and lives with his partner and their 3-year-old son. Walter is someone who knows artisanal fishing very well; he learned this business from his father and his uncles, who also fished. He has grown basic grains for a number of years. He learned stone masonry from some friends who gave him the opportunity to work as an assistant. All of this has enabled him to provide his family with what they need.
  
Walter will use the money from the loan to buy nets and a boat to supplement his fishing equipment. In this way he will obtain better earnings. Walter dreams of having stability with his family, improving his home to have greater security, and having good fishing equipment to be able to improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy nets and a boat to supplement his fishing equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used spare parts

loans.name: Heide

texts.en: As the married parent of two children, Heide works hard to support her family by running a food-vending business in the Philippines and by raising pigs on the side. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more food to sell. Heide has sustained her business with help from three prior loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-making business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a hardworking entrepreneur who operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for eight years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

Nenita is requesting another loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional items to sell such as eggs, shampoo, noodles, sugar,  canned goods, and other groceries. She hopes to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, shampoo, noodles, sugar,  canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha works hard to support her family. Editha is married and has a retail dry goods business in the Philippines.

Editha requested a PHP 21,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of dry goods like slippers, blouses, shorts, and other items to sell.

Editha has been in this business for five years.

Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of dry goods like slippers, blouses, shorts, and other items to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson is 52 years old, married and the father of six children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. He used a previous loan to pay school fees for his children, some of whom have now graduated from university. Wilson is a civil servant who earns a salary, and earns additional income from farming by growing bananas, cassava, rice, onions, mangoes and many other products. Wilson is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and pay for workers on his farm. His dream for the future is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for workers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a high quality dairy cow

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en: Esterlita is 58 years old, married and the mother of four children. She works very hard to provide for them by running a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 14,000 loan from NWTF to buy more items to sell. She has been in this line of work for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, shampoo, and soft-drinks. In the future, Esterlita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Faishale

texts.en: Faishale is 20 old, hard working, married and the father of two children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. He earns a living by running a bar and is committed to earn enough money to care for his family. In the future, he would like to open up a second business, and is requesting this loan to buy a motorcycle to help him get around quickly and conveniently.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Johana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johana, tiene una venta de celulares y accesorios para los mismos, está casada, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 8 años, ella tiene otro hijo de un matrimonio anterior y el niño vive con su padre, ya tiene mucho tiempo de tener su negocio y lo ha mejorado con ayuda de créditos, es la fuente de ingresos para subsistir con su familia.
Invertirá en saldo para vender recargas, celulares, manos libres, carcasas, baterías, etc., podrá dar un mejor servicio de reparación de celulares y surtirá su negocio con productos más recientes, con ello espera que las demandas crezcan y que su situación económica sea más estable.
Sus sueños son continuar ampliando su negocio, tenar más clientes satisfechos y dar a su familia una vida más digna.
texts.en:
Johana sells cell phones and phone accessories. She is married and lives with her husband and an eight-year-old son. She has another son from a previous marriage and he lives with his father. She has had her business for a long time and has grown with the help of loans; this is her family's source of income for subsistence.

She will invest in phone credit, cell phones, hands-free devices, phone cases, batteries, etc. to sell; she will be able to provide better cell phone repair service and will stock her business with more recent products. In this way she hopes the demand will grow and that her financial situation becomes more stable. Her dreams are to continue expanding her business, to have more satisfied customers, and to give her family a more dignified life.

loans.use: to sell phone credit, cell phones, hands-free devices, phone cases, batteries, etc. to be able to provide better service

loans.name: Doris Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doris, ha comentado que la inversión anterior le permitió realizar en el tiempo justo sus trabajos agrícolas por lo que sus cosechas han sido abundante, lo cual es de beneficio para alimentar a su familia y tener parte de la materia prima para elaborar la venta de antojitos como tamales, pan, etc.
Se decidió a solicitar un nuevo crédito para tener recursos económicos con los que de manera inmediata pueda comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar obreros para realizar la limpieza del terreno en el que va a sembrar maíz y seguir teniendo su negoico de antojitos funcionando.
texts.en: Doris comments that her last loan allowed her to do her agricultural work in time so that her harvests were plentiful. This helped her to fed her family and on the other hand have raw material to make her snack foods like tamales, bread etc. She has decided to request a new loan to have the economic resources so that she can immediately purchase agricultural inputs and pay workers to clear the land where she is going to plant corn and keep her snack food business running.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and to pay for labor to clear the land to plant corn and keep her snack food business running.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is from Manila, Philippines and has been an active member of CCT for years now. She has already acquired several loans to make good profit from her business and successfully repaid them. Aurelia is helping her husband to provide for their daily needs, and she also desires to improve their lives and give her children the best for their future. She works hard each day, and she is pretty sure that she is closer to reaching her goals.

Aurelia owns a variety store. She believes that business is her stepping stone to making her dreams become a reality. She knows how important it is for her neighbors to have a nearby store where they can buy a sachet of shampoo, a bar of soap, five PHP-worth of cooking oil, an egg, a toothpaste tube or even ice. She gets her products from a wholesaler at a lower price, then she sells it per piece for a higher price to earn a profit.

She desires to manage a bigger store someday, so she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to buy additional groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She is positive that she will become a successful businesswoman in the future, and she looks forward to seeing her children finish their studies through all her hard work and perseverance.

Aurelia meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies there.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To increase her stocks of groceries, toiletries and other supplies needed to stock her store.

loans.name: Ruel

texts.en:
Ruel is thankful that he accessed an 8,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) loan that he used for the gas and maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings helped cover their personal, household expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan which he will use to buy another tricycle unit to serve the growing population in his town. He is thanking God for the safe trips and good turnout of his service and the financial help, for it will surely help fund his and his wife's everyday needs. 

Ruel dreams to own more tricycle units to grow his income. He aims to give his wife and future kids a good life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay Micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the repair and maintenance of his tricycle.

loans.name: Norlinda

texts.en:
Norlinda is 38 years old and has three children. Norlinda is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Norlinda requested a 10,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Norlinda has been farming rice for eight years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Norlinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Norly

texts.en: Norly is 41 years old, married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She earns a living as a farmer, growing vegetables in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies. Norly has been farming vegetable  for five years, and has borrowed and repaid 10 prior loans to sustain her business. Her goal for the future is to save money to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 31 years old and married with one child.

Jennifer works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, shampoo, home care products and other groceries.
