Jennifer has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from an electronic load business.

Jennifer aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, shampoo, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Joackim

texts.en:
Joackim is 25 years old, a single male with no children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop of general merchandise, a business he has operated for six years. He began the business to raise income to pay fees for his brothers and sisters. Joackim gets additional income from rentals which he inherited from the parents. 

Joackim is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his brothers and sisters.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his brothers and sisters

loans.name: Neslyn

texts.en:
Neslyn is 22 years old and married with one child. She owns and operates a small canteen selling varieties of food items. To earn extra income she dyes and sells cloth. She has been doing this for one year.

She requesting this loan to buy dying colors, roll cloths, painting equipment, and designed patterns. With part of it, she will also buy bagged rice, bagged flour and other mixed goods for her canteen.

She plans to use her profit to extend her shop and build a house for her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2014

loans.use: to buy dying colors, roll cloths, painting equipment, designed patterns; and to buy bagged rice, bagged flour and other mixed goods

loans.name: Manuela Ramos Group

texts.es: El grupo “Manuela Ramos” está conformada por 05 socias responsables y emprendedoras. Este es el caso de Noemí de 36 años, casada. Ella se dedica a la venta de juguetes, hace 10 años que puso dicho negocio, donde le va bien. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a podido construir una parte de su casa .El deseo de Noemí es de seguir implementando su negocio y terminar de construir su casa. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de pelotas y muñecas. El grupo “Manuela Ramos” agradece a los inversionistas de kiva por hacer posible este crédito. Noemí se encuentra en la parte posterior, es la primera del lado derecho viste blusa a cuadros y falda roja.
texts.en:
The “Manuela Ramos” group is made up of 5 responsible and entrepreneurial members. 

This is the case of Noemí, 36 years old and married. She makes a living from selling toys. She began this business 10 years ago, and it is going well for her. Thanks to her effort and dedication she was able to construct a portion of her home. Noemí’s wish is to continue implementing her business and to finish constructing her home. She requested the loan to purchase balls and dolls. 

The “Manuela Ramos” group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for making this loan possible. Noemí can be found in the posterior part; she is the first on the right dressed in a checkered blouse and red skirt.

loans.use: to purchase balls and dolls.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as time conscious. She operates a retail business where she makes soap to sell. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her primary customers are individuals. 

Mary will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy raw materials for making soap. Her business goal is to employ more people within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open other business outlets. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making soap

loans.name: Florife

texts.en:
Florife is grateful that she was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Her store earnings helped a lot in their daily sustenance. 

She would now like to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods to sell at retail. Aside from groceries, she also sells fruits and vegetables for additional income. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help and the good return on her investment, for it will surely cover her family's daily needs.

Florife dreams of having a bigger general store someday to serve and attract more customers. She prays for good health and long life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 46 years old and married with eight children.

Luzviminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, cigarettes, home-care products and other groceries.

She has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from handicrafts.

Luzviminda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, cigarettes, home-care products and other groceries

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 41 years old and married with four children who are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Rose Marie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Rose Marie has been farming rice for 10 years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de sesenta años de edad, está casado y tiene una familia de siete hijos de los cuales todos ya son mayores de edad, ellos viven en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Pedro a pesar de su avanzada edad, aún es un hombre fuerte que para obtener sus ingresos cuenta con una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes en su domicilio, pero para mejorar sus ingresos también vende discos de música cristiana, él cuenta que gracias a estas dos actividades él ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Para este gran hombre seguir prosperando es su mayor objetivo, es por eso que ahora ha pensado en surtir mejor los productos de su tienda, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente capital para realizar esta inversión, es por eso que solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para comprar productos como recitos, gaseosas, azúcar, aceite y arroz para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de la gente.
El gran sueño de Pedro es tener una tienda de consumo diario en la capital.
texts.en:
Pedro is a sixty-year-old man, is married, and has a family of seven children who are all grown. They live in a community of Chichicastenango. In spite of his advanced age, Pedro is still a strong man who has a small grocery store in his home in order to earn an income. To improve his earnings he also sells CDs of Christian music. He says that thanks to these two business, he has been able to get his family ahead.

This great man's primary objective is to keep prospering. For this reason, he has thought about having a better stock of products in his store, but one of the difficulties he has is that he doesn't have enough capital to make this investment. This is why he is asking for a loan that he will use to buy products like toiletries, soft drinks, sugar, oil and rice to better satisfy people's needs. Pedro's great dream is to have a grocery store in the capital.

loans.use: to buy and sell grocery products like toiletries, soft drinks, rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chocolate paste, bananas, strawberries, watermelons, sugar, baggies, milk, etc. to make food for sale.

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, tiene una venta de tortillas, es madre soltera de dos hijas con edades de 18 y 11 años, ella ha luchado toda su vida para ir subsistiendo, trabaja de siete de la mañana a una de la tarde, el oficio lo aprendió a realizar dentro de su núcleo familiar.
Requiere de un crédito para comprar una cocina industrial y gas propano, equipara su negocio para aumentar su productividad y cubrir en menor tiempo las demandas de sus clientes, al invertir en su negocio María espera contar con nuevos clientes y mayores ventas.
Sus anhelos son trabajar de manera permanente para asegurarles un mejor futuro a sus hijas.
texts.en:
María has a business selling tortillas. She is a single mother of two daughters who are 18 and 11 years old. She has struggled all of her life to survive. She works from seven in the morning until one in the afternoon. She learned to work this trade from her nuclear family.

She requires a loan to purchase an industrial kitchen and propane gas. She will equip her business to increase her productivity and take less time to meet her customers’ demands. When she invests in her business, María hopes to count on new customers and increased sales.

Her desire is to work in a permanent manner to assure a better future for her daughters.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial kitchen and propane gas, which will equip her business to increase her productivity and take less time to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Wiliams Tomás Hugo

texts.es:
Wiliams tiene veintisiete años, es muy amable y generoso vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Chichicastenango.
Wiliams es un joven muy optimista, el para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia trabaja como capacitador de mujeres sobre el tema de alimentos, el realiza esta labor desde hace cuatro años en una organización ubicada en su comunidad.
Wiliams es un joven que prioriza las necesidades de su familia, es por ello que ahora ha decidido realizar la remodelación de su casa, aunque una de  sus dificultades es que no cuenta con suficiente dinero, por tal motivo él solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, cal arena, block para remodelar su casa.
El gran sueño de Wiliams es poder contar con sus propios bienes para cuando tenga familia no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Wiliams is 27 years old. He is very kind and generous and lives with his parents in a community in Chichicastenango.

Wiliams is a very optimistic young man. In order to generate an income for himself and support his family, he works for a local organization that offers training to women. His subject is nutrition, and he has been teaching for four years. 

His family's needs are his main priorities, which is why he has now decided to remodel his house despite the obstacle of not having enough money. For this reason, he is requesting a loan, which he will use to buy cement, lime, sand, and blocks to remodel his home.

Wiliams' greatest dream is to have enough assets so that when he starts his own family they will have everything they need.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, sand, and blocks to remodel his house.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina (27, center) has a chicken farm in Campo Los Toros, a Tzotzil community from the central Chiapas highlands. Adelina (36, left) and Lucia (43, right) work with her on the farm and will serve as guarantees of Ernestina´s loan. Ernestina is still single, Lucia is Ernestina´s sister in law and has 9 kids, while Adelina has 8 kids of her own.

Four years ago 10 women from Campo Los Toros received a government grant to start a poultry farm. After some market problems and lack of planning most women left the farm. Ernestina, Adelina and Lucia remained working together. Left with the infrastructure but no chickens to look after, Ernestina reached out to a local NGO in order to restore the farm. With the help of the NGO she realized that there was no market for eggs -the original grant was for an egg producing farm- but there was an unmet demand for locally grown chickens. 

Ernestina is asking for a loan to buy the first 200 chickens, feed and medicines needed to restart the farm. Furthermore, she will be able to start a successful business that will provide three families with a steady source of income in one of the most excluded regions in the country and thus setting the example for other indigenous women in their community.

loans.use: to buy chickens, medicines and feed to increase production in her poultry farm.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su cónyuge e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, ubicado en la provincia Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, población se dedica principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con cultivos de café. Adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agrícola y obrero de mantenimiento de carretera de la zona. Cuenta con una experiencia en el negocio de 5 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El presente crédito que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna, con esto Isabel tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará mayores ingresos que le van a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Isabel is 29 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives with his spouse and children in the district of Pomahuaca, located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region, in the North Andes of Peru.


He works in agriculture, having coffee crops. He also works offering his services as day labor and on road maintenance in the district. He has 5 years experience in the business and has very god personal and work experience in the area. He will use the present loan for agricultural work, applying and incorporating phytosanitary products, fertilizer and labor at harvest time. This will help to improve his crops, physically, morphologically and production wise as well as having a suitable harvest. Doing this Isabel will have higher production, higher quality of product which he will have no problem selling and will generate more income which will allow him to improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to be used in agricultural labors, applying and incorporating phytosanitary products, fertilizer and to pay for labor at harvest time.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es una mujer de 23 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene una hija de 3 años, y su negocio es la venta de café medicinal. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en diferentes ferias de la zona ‘Senkata’, caracterizada porque la mayoría de su población son migrantes del altiplano, jóvenes en busca de nuevas oportunidades de trabajo, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Dina es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con su hija que todavía es una bebé, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, electricidad, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de café llamado medicinal, porque es un café que contiene propiedades curativas; tiene 0.6% de cafeína y contiene extracto de ‘ganoderma’ que es un hongo llamado el hongo de la inmortalidad y se utiliza en la medicina tradicional china. Bajo estos conceptos ella instala su puesto de venta y comenta las cualidades de su producto a sus clientes, también les sirve agua y azúcar par que lo tomen en el mismo lugar, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias de la ciudad. “inicie mi negocio con la ayuda de mi suegra que se dedica a esta actividad anteriormente, luego me independicé y ahora trabajo sola…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que su producto es de un sabor agradable y los clientes compran constantemente, la desventaja es que su negocio es ambulante y debe soportar las inclemencias del tiempo. Su sueño es aumentar sus ventas y vender por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra de café medicinal por mayor para aumentar sus ventas y volverse distribuidora mayorista. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que viene desarrollando esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Dina solicita un préstamo para la compra de café medicinal para vender por mayor y volverse distribuidora.
texts.en:
Dina is a 23-year-old woman. She lives with her partner. She has a 3-year-old daughter and her business is selling medicinal coffee.

She is a good mother, entrepreneurial, generous, kind, responsible, and very hard-working. She carries out her business in different markets in the ‘Senkata’ Zone, characterized by a majority of its population being migrants from the altiplano (high Andean plateau), youths searching for new work opportunities, from a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies between 0-12 degrees centigrade during the day.

Dina has dark skin, long black hair that she ties back, brown eyes, short stature, and a medium complexion. Her mother tongue is Aymara, which she speaks with her family, and Spanish, because of the general culture and the business that she performs. She lives her life along with her partner, who makes a living from construction, and her daughter, who is still a baby. They live in a rented room constructed of brick and cement with a corrugated iron roof, and it has potable water, electricity, home gas, and a sewage system. 

Her business is selling coffee that is called medicinal because it is a coffee that contains curative properties. It has 0.6% caffeine and it contains extract from the ‘ganoderma,’ which is a mushroom that is called the ‘immortality mushroom’ and is used in traditional Chinese medicine. Under these concepts, she sets up her stall and she relates the qualities of her product to her customers. She also serves them water and sugar so that they drink them in the same place, an activity that she performs every day of the week peddling in different markets of the city. “I began my business with help from my mother-in-law who previously made a living from this activity. I later became independent and now work alone...” she comments. The advantage of her business is that her product has a good flavor and the customers constantly purchase it. The disadvantage is that her business is mobile and needs to bear the severity of the weather. 

Her dream is to increase her sales and sell wholesale. She wishes to perform the purchase of medicinal coffee wholesale to increase her sales and become a wholesale distributor. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in the 1 year that she has carried out this activity independently. 

It is for these reasons that Dina is requesting a loan to purchase medicinal coffee to sell wholesale and become a distributor.

loans.use: to purchase medicinal coffee to sell wholesale and become a distributor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal, firewood, and spare parts for his tractor

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has entrenched her business. She was able to grow her fund used for her food stall business. The loan also helped her provide for their daily needs and expenses.

She is positive that she could improve her business even more if you will lend her an amount of 15,000 PHP. This new loan will go to buying more raw ingredients and supplies she needs to make more viands and food she sells so she can increase her profit from the business. An increase in profit will also result in her business being viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she will sustain the needs of her family.

Aside from growing her business, Lydia aims to work harder to improve their present financial status. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy materials and raw ingredients needed in cooking dishes for her food stall.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.en:
Evangelina is 51 years old and married with eight children.

Evangelina earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evangelina has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Evangelina is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangelina is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Clarita is 42 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Clarita has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Clarita has been in this business for one year. In the future, Clarita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is single and has a raising pigs business in the Philippines.

She requested a 15,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

Evelyn has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a hardworking 33-year-old lady, married with one child. She lives in Kasese, Uganda. 

Laila is in a motor vehicle transport business where she has been for three years. She gets additional income from rentals. Laila has a dream of owning many vehicles on the road to make more profits. 

Laila wants money to buy iron sheets for roofing her rentals.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing her rentals.

loans.name: Emmanuella

texts.en: Emmanuella, a female business owner, is 38 yeards old. She has built a small business by selling food to a solidarity group. Emmanuella used to attend a community training that gathered many people. Now, she is looking for funds to buy cosmetics products to retail to this demand in remote areas. As portrayed in the picture, Emmanuella (front) manages her business with two other people: Yvanne (left in the picture) and Rosemonde (on her right). One of them keeps the general legder and the other helps in purchase goods. Last year, thanks to the profits made, Emmanuella supported funeral fees for one of her co-workers. This loan will allow her to generate 34% of net income.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cosmetics products to distribute to retailers

loans.name: Maria March

texts.en:
Maria March, age 41, is a vegetable vendor. She has been engaged in this business for three years and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She and her husband have four children, all of whom are enrolled in school.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy more vegetables to sell in her food stall.

In the future, Maria March would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cocoa to offer for sale

loans.name: Las Comerciantes De Sololá Group

texts.es:
Florinda (la primera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía) es una mujer muy trabajadora que tiene veintidós años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Florinda para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras desde hace tres años en central de mayoreo de su comunidad, ella cuenta que gracias a esta actividad ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Una joven optimista con la mente positiva Florinda ahora ha pensado en seguir incrementado su pequeño negocio, pero para poder hacerlo ella necesita de un capital, es por eso que ha organizado un grupo se mujeres para solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá para comprar cebolla papa, ejotes y zanahoria para luego venderlos.
El gran anhelo de ella es poder comprar un terreno donde pueda construir su casa.
texts.en:
Florinda (the first one from the left side of the photograph) is a very hardworking woman who is 22 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the community of Sololá.

To help her parents with the household expenses, Florinda has worked buying and selling vegetables for three years in the wholesale center of her community. She says that she has been able to provide for her family, thanks to this activity.

An optimistic young woman with a positive outlook, Florinda is now planning to continue expanding her business, but to be able to do that, she needs capital. That's why she has organized a group of women to request a loan that she will invest in the purchase of onions, potatoes, green beans, and carrots to later sell.

Her greatest desire is to be able to buy a lot where she could build her house.

loans.use: to buy and sell onions, potatoes, green beans, and carrots.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma, age 23, owns and operates a small food shop to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for one year. She and her husband have three children.

Emmas has been a member of SPBD since 2014. She has requested a loan in order to buy a bale of rice, tins of tuna, and noodles for her business. 

Her goal is to use her profit to expand her shop, as well as to add money to her family's savings for future needs.

loans.use: to buy a bale of rice, tins of tuna, and noodles for her shop

loans.name: Sermoncier

texts.en:
Sermoncier is 49 years old. He opened a small shops two years ago thanks to a training he received from an NGO. He is now seeking funds to buy 27 sacks of sugar to retail. His previous profits turned around $984 in 2014.Your contribution will allow him to expand his economic activity in a remote area of Haiti.

Sermoncier keeps attending to credit training to improve his business. He is portrayed with two other people in his business (Andre in the middle and Arisda on the right). The loan will improve his life conditions through the profits and as well his co-workers.

loans.use: to purchase 27 sacks of sugar to sell to small retailers

loans.name: Armindo

texts.pt:
senhor Armindo tem 42 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos, frequentando ensino primário e secundário respectivamente, é docente e negociante, vive em casa propria e não sustenta mais ninguem.
O montante financiado sera aplicado para a compra de pedras de ornamentação para revender no mercado local.
Para o futuro deseja abrir um negócio de venda de refeições visto que vive perto de terminal de transportes e a procura é maior .
Liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora e modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
texts.en: Armindo, age 42, is married and the father of four children, all of whom are in elementary or high school. He is a teacher and salesman who lives in his own house. This loan will go toward buying ornamental rocks to sell at the local market. In the future, he hopes to open a business selling prepared meals, as he lives near the main transportation terminal and can stock up in bulk. He will pay back this loan on time in order to remain in good standing for future financing.

loans.use: to buy ornamental rocks to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Armando

texts.pt:
O senhor Armando tem 79 anos de idade, é casado e é pai de 7 filhos, dos quais 4 são maiores de idade e vivem nas suas casas e os outros 3 vivem com ele na casa própria e frequentam o ensino secundário. 
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar 2 cabeças de gado para ampliar o seu negócio.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são crescer no negocio e comprar um carro para auxiliar no próprio negócio.
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz um xitique mensal como forma de poupar e que irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Armando, age 79, is married and the father of seven children, of whom four are adults who live on their own and three are in high school and live with him in his own home. He says that he will use this loan to buy two head of cattle in order to grow his business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to increase his sales and buy a car to help with his business. His main challenge is a lack of funds; to overcome this he maintains a xitique [traditional savings account] and plans to take out more loans in the future to realize his goals.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle to grow his business.

loans.name: Elmer Edgardo

texts.es:
El señor   Elmer   de 41 años de edad  es casado y vive con su esposa en su casa de habitación donde se dedica desde hace varios  años al  enderezado y pintado de vehículos, su taller lo tiene instalado en su casa de habitación donde le visitan todos los amigos y conocido y que lo prefieren por la buena atención y el servicio que les brinda.
Don Elmer está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de una maquina soldadora de segunda mano, una pulidora y electrodos, por que son de uso constante y espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante en su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia con el aumento de los ingresos.
Su sueño es que en su próximo crédito mejorar mas su negocio y vivienda.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero 2015.
texts.en: Elmer is 41 years old, married, and lives with his wife in a home where he has worked for the past several years painting and doing bodywork on cars. His shop is located in his home where all of his friends and acquaintances visit him. They prefer his shop because of the good attention and service that he offers them. Elmer is requesting a loan to purchase a second-hand welding machine, a polisher, and electrodes, because he uses them constantly. He hopes that this investment allows him to get ahead in his business and improve his quality of life and that of his family with the increased revenue. His dream is to improve his business and his home more with a future loan.

loans.use: to purchase a second-hand welding machine, a polisher, and electrodes for his business.

loans.name: Eva Leticia

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer de 26 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijas mujeres de 7 y 5 años, y su negocio es la producción de estuco.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, luchadora, decidida, responsable y trabajadora. Su trabajo lo desarrolla en la localidad de ‘Vichaya’ situado a 86 kilómetros de la ciudad; se caracteriza por las antiguas estructuras funerarias existentes en el lugar llamadas ‘Chullpares’ y sitios defensivos posiblemente de la época de los “Señoríos Aymaras” 1100 - 1400 dc., estas chullpas se pueden observar a simple vista desde el camino, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-16 grados centígrados.
Eva es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al mismo trabajo y con sus hijas que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa alquilada construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con electricidad y agua de pozo, no existe el alcantarillado en el lugar. Su negocio es la fabricación de estuco que consiste en el tratamiento de la roca (el yeso) en estado natural, convirtiéndola en un polvo para ser mezclada con agua y colocada sobre superficies como; muros, cielos rasos, cementos, y revestimiento de acabados de la construcción. “iniciamos nuestra actividad como ayudantes de mi padre, luego él nos heredó esta cantera para que trabajemos…” comenta. Su sueño es construir su casa de ladrillo, ella desea realizar la compra de un motor para la producción de estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eva solicita un préstamo para la compra de un motor para la fabricación de estuco para producir por mayor.
texts.en:
Eva is 25 years old. She is married and has 2 daughters who are 7 and 5 years old. She makes stucco. She is a good mother, entreprising, persistent, determined, responsable and hardworking. She works in the town of Vichaya, located 86 kms from the city. This place is known for the ancient funerary structures, known as "Chullpares" and the defensive areas, probably from the time of the Senorios Aymaras 1100 - 1400 AD. These "Chullpas" can be seen from the trail. 

The weather in this area is cold and dry, the temperature varies during the day between 2 and 16 degrees Centigrade.

Eva has dark complexion, her hair is black and long, and she braids it. Her eyes are brown, she is short and thin. Her fist language is Aymara, spoken in the region, and she also speaks Spanish because it is common and also she uses it to do business.

She shares her life with her husband, whose occupation is the same, and also with her daughters, who attend school. They rent a house made out of adobe with a corrugated iron roof. The house has electricity and water from a well. There is no a sewage system  in that area.

She makes stucco, and this consist on the treatment of stone (plaster) in its natural state. Turning it into dust to mix with water and to put it on surfaces such as walls, ceilings, cement, and construction coating finish. " We started helping my father, then we inherited this quarry to work..." she states.

Her dream is to build a brick house. She wishes to buy a motor to produce stucco. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in 4 years that she has been working. This is why Eva is requesting a loan, to buy a motor to make stucco to produce wholesale.

loans.use: to buy a motor to make stucco to produce wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy grains (corn, millet).

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earning income for her family. To generate additional earnings, Gina engages in buying and selling gasoline for retail. As a  microfinance member of PMPC, she has sought financial help to purchase 60 liters of gasoline for retail. In the future, Gina wishes to renovate her house and live comfortably with her family.

loans.use: to purchase 60 liters of gasoline for retail

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Don Rafael es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable el vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos en una Colonia de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes. Desde hace más de 17 años.
Don Rafael se dedica al cultivo de malanga y trabaja como mayordomo en una finca que tambien es su fuente de ingresos desde hace más de 3 años.
Don Rafael solicita el préstamo para la compra de insumos para su cultivo de malanga. El espera que al invertir en su cultivo la cosecha será de mejor calidad y así obtendrá mejores ganancias.
El sueño de don Rafael es poder hacer hacer más grandes sus cultivos ya que él ha visto que este negocio es muy rentable y con sus ganancias podrá hacerles mejoras a su vivienda. 



Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes, Honduras – Febrero-2015
texts.en:
Rafael is a very hard-working and responsible person.  He lives with his wife and three children in a neighborhood in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Cortes.  Rafael has been growing 'malangas' [a native tuber] for over 17 years.  He has worked as a foreman on a farm for over three years.

Rafael is requesting the loan to buy supplies for his malanga crop.  He hopes that by investing in his crop the harvest will be better quality.  This way he will get better earnings.

Rafael’s dream is to be able to expand his crops.  He has seen that this business is very profitable, and with his earnings he will be able to make improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his 'malanga' [a native tuber] crop.

loans.name: Rosa Delmy

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Delmy de 40 años de edad es casada, vive en su casa propia con sus hijos, radica en la comunidad la montaña al sur de Honduras, se dedica al negocio de la venta ropa nueva y medicamento, su venta es con los pobladores y amigos de la comunidad.
Doña Rosa es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar cemento, arena, grava, arenilla y para ajustar el pago de mano de obra para el albañil que le hara las mejoras a su casa, también desea comprar pintura para pintar su casa, con el apoyo del crédito ella desea mejorar mas su casa.

Su sueño es mejorar su vivienda.

San Lorenzo, honduras - Febrero del 2015.
texts.en:
Rosa Delmy, age 40, is married.  Along with her children, she lives in her own home located in a mountainous community in southern Honduras.  She works selling new clothing and medications.  Her sales are to friends and people in her community.

Rosa is a hardworking woman with a desire to get ahead.  She needs this loan to buy cement, sand, gravel, and stones, and to pay for the labor of a construction worker who will make improvements to her house.  She also wants to buy paint in order to paint her house.  With the support of this loan she wants to improve her home.

Her dream is to improve her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2015

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, and stones, and to pay a construction worker

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en: Magdaline is a married woman with three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Myriam

texts.es: Myriam de 64 años de edad, se dedica a la confección de uniformes en las instalaciones de su vivienda, donde tiene un pequeño taller. Ella después de capacitarse y aprender el arte de la confección hace 11 años, decidió generar ingresos con su nuevo conocimiento y empezó poco a poco, ofreciendo este servicio a sus clientes, quienes llevaban a su taller, toda la materia prima e insumos, para que ella diseñara y elaborara la prenda, ajustada a la moda que señalaban sus clientes y las medidas  particulares de cada uno. Hoy su línea principal son los uniformes y trabaja para una clientela de estudiantes jóvenes y para la comunidad de sus vecinos en general, que cada vez tienen mayores exigencias de calidad, lo cual se ha convertido en su gran desafío. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprara una fileteadora, con la que planea  ofrecerá un mejor acabado de las prendas que elabora y hará que su clientela esté satisfecha, lo cual es el éxito de su credikiva. Su meta es lograr el incremento de las ventas y la disminución de costos productivos que conseguirá con su nueva inversión, porque sueña con ampliar su negocio, ahorrar dinero y más adelante tener su propia vivienda,   gran desafío de vida que debe afrontar, para lograr su bienestar y el de los suyos.
texts.en:
Myriam is 64 years old. She works making uniforms in a small sewing shop set up in her home. After completing her training and learning the art of dressmaking eleven years ago, she decided to apply her new skills to generate an income and started out little by little, providing services to her customers. They would bring all the material and supplies to her shop for her to design and produce each clothing item, conforming to the style they wanted and the particular measurements of each customer.

Today, her main clothing line is uniforms and her customer base comprises young students and her community of neighbors in general, who increasingly demand high quality. This has become her main challenge. She is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which she will use to buy an overlock sewing machine. This will allow her to add a better finishing to her clothing items. She expects this will satisfy her customers and make this loan a success. 

This new investment will allow her to meet her goals, which are to increase sales and decrease cost of production. She wants to expand her business, save money, and eventually buy a home. She must face this challenge in life in order to achieve well-being for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma buys and sells rice to earn a living. She has been engaged in this business for three years and works hard to support her family.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 27,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy additional sacks of rice to offer for sale.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en:
Josephat, age 38, offers decoration services in his local community. He also rents out a variety of items for use at parties, such as tents, mattresses, and chairs. His primary challenge is the seasonality of his enterprise. Though his business capital is currently limited, his goal is eventually to expand his business to include the rental of bridal gowns. 

Josephat is a hard-working man with six children, four of whom attend school. The family lives in Kasese.

Josephat has always hoped to build a residential house for his family.  He is therefore requesting a loan in order to buy cement, sand, bricks, and other necessary materials to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and other necessary materials to build a house for his family

loans.name: Rahat

texts.ru: Рахат 43 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, с 1998 года она стала заниматься сельским хозяйством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было всего 50,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве Рахат есть 4 коровы и 8 овец, полученное экологически чистое молоко она реализует местным жителям, так как молоко очень вкусное, оно пользуется большим спросом. Также у Рахат есть собственный земельный надел мерою 1,02 ГА и арендованный - 2,0 ГА, где она выращивает фасоль, реализуя оптовым покупателям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Рахат обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы и увеличения урожая экологически чистой фасоли. Доходы от кредита позволят Рахат накопить на образование детей.
texts.en: Rahat is 43 years old, married and is raising three children. She has a high school degree and started her farm in 1998 with 50,000 som (KGS). Currently she has 4 cows and 8 sheep, and sells her organic milk to local residents. As the milk is delicious, she has many customers. Rahat also owns 1.02 hectares and rents 2.0 hectares of farm land, where she grows beans for wholesale. In order to grow more crops, Rahat has turned to "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to purchase fertilizer and harvest more beans. She plans to invest profits from this expansion to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to increase the bean harvest

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, elabora la venta de pupusas, tortillas y refrescos para contar con ingresos que luego invierte en cubrir las necesidades familiares, es casada, vive con padre y sus hijos, cada día trabaja para poder mantener su negocio en el mercado, tiene un horario de 9:00 a.m. a 9.00 p.m., por el momento no representa dificultades en el negocio y el oficio lo aprendió con la ayuda de su familia.
Invertirá en maíz, harina, quesillo, aceite, tomates, repollos, cal, etc., tendrá la materia prima para elaborar la venta de pupusas y tortillas, esta ayuda le permitirá seguir trabajando y cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.
Sus sueños son generar más ingresos para que su familia tenga lo básico y poder pagar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Maria works selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas), tortillas, and refreshments in order to generate an income, which allows her to cover family expenses. She is married, and she lives with her children and their father. She works every day to maintain her business on the market. Her business is open from 9:00 am until 9:00 pm. At the moment, her business is not having any difficulties. She learned this work with the help of her family.

She will buy corn, flour, fresh cheese, oil, tomato, cabbage, lime, etc. in order to have the raw materials to make pupusas and tortillas for sale. This loan will allow her to continue working and to meet the demands of her customers. Her dream is to generate more earnings so that she can cover the basic necessities of her family and so that she can repay her debts.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, fresh cheese, oil, tomato, cabbage, lime, etc. in order to have the raw materials to make pupusas and tortillas for sale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a smallholder dairy farmer from the villiage of Londiani, located in the South Rift area of Kenya. The province of South Rift is widely known for both large-scale and small-scale tea farming. Most smallholder farmers mix dairy farming and tea farming to obtain the highest returns from their farming efforts. Until now, Stella has been mostly dairying, but she is looking to start crop farming this year. 

Stella applied for a loan in order to venture into crop farming. With the loan investment, she will pay for agricultural inputs, tools, and labor for her new business. The investment will give her an alternative source of income in addition to milk. Engaging in horticulture will also cushion her from the business risks associated with solely relying on one product. 

Income from the new agribusiness will be used by Stella to meet her family's basic needs. She will also plough part of the profits back into the business to support expansion. 

Ultimately, her higher goal is to elevate her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to venture into horticultural farming

loans.name: Mira

texts.ru: Мира, 44 года, вдова, одна воспитывает 2 детей. У нее высшее образование, работает преподавателем кыргызского языка и литературы в школе. Дополнительно занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 25 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Миры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы,  20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS), также обрабатывает 4,0 Га арендованной земли, где в основном выращивает рис и подсолнечник. Полученный урожай реализуют оптовым покупателям. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян риса, удобрений, подготовку к весенне-полевым работам. Доходы от кредита Мира планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнес деятельности.
texts.en: Mira is a 44 year old widow, she is raising her two children on her own. She has a college degree and teaches Kyrgyz language and literature at the local school. She supplements her salary by farming and raising livestock. Mira started her farm 25 years ago with 10,000 som (KGS). Her hard work allowed the farm to grow, and now Mira owns 4 cows and 20 sheep. She also farms 4 hectares of rented land, where she grows rice and sunflowers. She sells the harvest to wholesale buyers. Her monthly farm income is 10,000 som (KGS). In order to expand her farm, Mira has turned to "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS), which she will use to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and prepare for spring planting. She plans to invest the profits from this expansion back into her farming business.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for spring field work and growing organic products

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Martha ha sido una ama de casa muy dedicada, siempre pendiente del cuidado de su familia conformada por sus 3 hijos y su esposo; desde siempre le ha gustado trabajar como comerciante independiente, comenzó a vender mercancía desde hace 3 años, pues es responsable de llevar la carga económica del hogar junto con su esposo y necesita generar los recursos para hacerlo. 

Sus clientes son variados, trabaja sola todos los días en su negocio y encuentra en su labor la ventaja de poder estar pendiente de su familia, al mismo tiempo que logra ser productiva como comerciante.

Actualmente solicita el crédito para comprar surtido al por mayor de juguetería, ropa, entre otros, pues es una gran oportunidad en esta época del año, esto le permitirá abastecerse con más variedad para satisfacer la demanda que se incrementa en la temporada, dando como resultado la obtención de mejores ingresos para su familia.

Martha manifiesta que su mayor deseo es poder seguir apoyando económicamente a su familia y dar educación a todos sus hijos, para verlos convertirse en profesionales y tengan un futuro próspero y exitoso.
texts.en:
Martha has been a very dedicated housewife always attentive of the care of her family made up of 3 children and her husband. She has always enjoyed working as an independent businessperson. She started to sell merchandise 3 years ago as she is responsible along with her husband of supporting the household economy and she needs to generate resources to do this. Her clients are varied and she only works days in her business and has the advantage in her business of being able to take care of her family. At the same time she manages to be productive as a vendor.

She is requesting this loan to buy a variety of toys and clothing amongst others as it is a great opportunity at this time of the year and this allows her to stock up with more variety to satisfy the increased demand for the season. As a result she can obtain greater income for her family. Martha states that her main wish is to continue supporting the family economically and provide education to all her children to see them become professionals and have a bright and successful future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of toys and clothing amongst others, wholesale.

loans.name: Gabriela Soraya

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, un sector muy agradable por su gente y clima, además por ser un sector muy productivo vive Gabriela, una joven madre de 19 años, quien tiene dos hijitos, vive también con su esposo que es de mucho apoyo en la familia comenta.
Gabriela es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, todos los días trabaja vendiendo ropa interior, blusas, pantalones y pijamas, recorre vendiendo a clientes de su sector, ya es muy conocida y tiene varios pedidos, con los créditos pequeños comenta que ha podido crecer en su negocio.
Cuenta con una pequeña casa en un terreno de su madre, poco a poco ha podido ir mejorándola.
Gabriela ya es clienta fiel de la institución, ahora está renovando el crédito, se siente feliz porque ha podido incrementar su negocio, con este nuevo crédito seguirá invirtiendo en la ropa para seguir creciendo y en un futuro ponerse ya un local fijo.
Agradece enormemente a la institución y a todos quienes conforman Kiva por este aporte que le ayudan a crecer personal y profesionalmente.
texts.en:
The city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a very pleasant place because of its inhabitants and climate, as well as being a very productive area, is where Gabriela lives. She is a young mother, 19 years old, and has two small children. Also living with her, is her husband, who is of much support within the family, she tell us.

Gabriela is a woman who enjoys working. She works everyday selling undergarments, blouses, pants and pajamas. She goes to various houses in her sector selling to her clients, and is already well-known and has various orders pending. She mentions that she has been able to grow her business through small loans. Gabriela has a small house on her mother’s land, and little by little has been improving its conditions

Gabriela is already a loyal customer of this lending institution, she is renewing her loan and feels happy that she’s been able to grow her business; with this new loan, she will continue to invest in clothes to keep the business growing and have a permanent shop in the future. She is extremely grateful to the foundation and all those who are part of Kiva, for the support that helps her grow personally and professionally.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise to stock her business. With this growth this young mother will be able to support her two children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her food place in order to improve her son's level of life.

loans.name: Médessé

texts.fr: Médessé est une femme mariée âgée de 27 ans qui vit dans le quartier d’Avédji avec ses enfants. Médessé participe activement à l’épanouissement de sa famille en vendant du riz préparé avec de l’haricot. Médessé a une bonne rentabilité et s’approvisionne  une fois par mois au marché pour mieux vendre. Médessé sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des bols de riz et du haricot afin d’améliorer sa situation de vie grâce au bénéfice et aider son mari dans les besoins quotidiens de la famille.
texts.en: Médessé is a married woman, 27 years old, who lives in the Avédji district with her children. She actively helps her family to thrive by selling cooked rice with beans. She make a good profit and gets her supplies once a month at the market to improve her sales. Médessé is requesting this loan to purchase tubs of rice and beans in order to improve her living conditions, thanks to the profits, and to help out her husband to meet the family’s day-to-day needs.

loans.use: to purchase 20 tubs of rice and 10 tubs of beans

loans.name: Kanfitine

texts.fr: Kanfitine est une femme mariée âgée de 32 ans et vit à Anomé avec ses deux enfants. Grâce à son dynamisme et son courage, Kanfitine est une commerçante d’alimentations générale dans son quartier afin de disposer d’une bonne capacité financière. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Kanfitine s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Kanfitine désire ce prêt pour acheter des sacs de riz et de maïs pour son commerce et aider son mari dans l’éducation de leurs enfants.
texts.en: Kanfitine is a married woman, 32 years old, who lives in Anomé with her two children. Thanks to her energy and courage, she is a merchant of food stuff in her district in order to have a good financial situation. To attain her goals, Kanfitine gets her supplies once a month at the market. She would like to have this loan to purchase some sacks of rice and corn for her business and to help out her husband to provide education for their children.

loans.use: to purchase rice and corn

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: GUILLERMO: Es un señor jovial que tiene un pequeño negocio de ropa y calzado en uno de los mercados de Waspam. Pertenece a la etnia miskita; tiene 56 años de edad, casado, tiene 8 hijos: 4 mayores de edad y 4 en edad escolar. Tiene 10 años de experiencia como comerciante de venta de ropa nueva y calzado. Está solicitando un préstamo para incrementar su mercadería de ropa y calzado que comprará en Managua y Masaya; esto le permitirá vender a precios favorable a sus clientela en Waspam y también incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio grande y próspero.
texts.en: Guillermo is a cheerful man who has a small business selling clothes and footwear in a market in Waspam. He belongs to the Miskito ethnicity; he is 56 years old, married, and has 8 children, four of whom are school-age. Has has been selling new clothes and footwear for ten years. He is requesting this loan to increase the amount of clothing and footwear stock he will buy in Managua and Masaya, which will allow him to sell his products at a favorable price to his customers in Waspam, and increase his income. His dream is to have a large and prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear and clothing in Managua and Masaya to increase his stock.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos tiene 34 años, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora, esta casado con la Señora Noelia con quien tiene dos hijos, motivo de lucha de ambos.
Manifiesta que son una familia muy trabajadora que comenzó desde muy abajo, tiene una panadería que pudo montar con mucho esfuerzo y privaciones.
Hoy ya tiene muchos clientes y pide este préstamo para la compra de harina al por mayor para poder seguir con la producción de panes como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos is 34 years old and married to Sra. Noelia. They have two children and are motivated to strive on their behalf. Carlos is a responsible and hardworking individual.

He says that he comes from a hardworking family that started from very humble beginnings. Carlos has a bakery that he established with great effort and hardship. Today he has many customers and is requesting this loan so that he can buy flour in bulk. This will allow him to continue producing bread just as before.

loans.use: to buy flour in bulk.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Elsa  se dedica al negocio de artesania, la socia es una mujer trabajadora y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su familia, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de tejidos y telares. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar tejidos, chompas y telares.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the Nueva Victoria community bank located in Chinchero District, which belongs to Urubamba Province, in the department of Cusco.

She has a business selling crafts. She is a hardworking woman who manages to help her family get ahead through her business. Her dream is to increase sales of sewing and weaving. She is seeking a loan to buy sewing, sweaters, and weaving.

Elsa is happy to have a loan and promises to make the repayments.

loans.use: buy sewing, sweaters, and weaving

loans.name: Gs La Bendicion Group

texts.es:
La señora Ericka es una mujer emprendedora y dedicada al negocio propio el cual es venta de ropa americana desde hace 20 años, este negocio opera bajo el nombre de venta de ropa americana los hermanos, las ventas las realiza todos los días de la semana en su casa de habitación, ella vende camisa de varón, pantalón de hombre, calzonetas, faldas, camisa de mujer.
Ericka manifiesta que este negocio le ha sido de gran ayuda, porque a través de las ganancias que obtiene le sirve para que sus hijos puedan estudiar en la escuela y colegios,  ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropa clasificada como camisa de varón, pantalón de hombre, calzonetas, faldas, camisa de mujer.
Ericka sueña con poder tener un mejor nivel de vida familiar, solicita el préstamo de forma grupal con las siguientes personas:
Luz se cuenta con un salón de belleza desde hace 1 ½  años.
Robertina se dedica a la venta de plásticos desde hace 1 año, todos ellos solicitan el préstamo porque no cuentan con el capital suficiente. 
 
 Marzo 2015
texts.en:
Señora Ericka is an enterprising woman and is dedicated to her own business where she has been selling american clothes for 20 years. She sells clothes from her home every day, she sells men's shirts, men's trousers, swimming trunks, skirts, and women's blouses.

Ericka says that this business has been a great help to her, because the income she gets is used so that her children can study in school. She is asking for this loan in order to buy sorted clothes such as men's shirts, men's trousers, swimming trunks, skirts and women's blouses.

Ericka's dream is to be able to have a better family life. She is asking for this loan in a group with the following people:
Luz, who started a beauty salon 18 months ago,
Robertina, who has been selling plastic tupperware for a year. They are all asking for a loan because they do not have suffiicient capital.

loans.use: to buy sorted clothes such as men's shirts, men's trousers, swimming trunks, skirts and women's blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Alvaro Henry

texts.es:
Alvaro es un hombre joven de 19 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de diseño gráfico.
Él es inteligente, alegre, feliz, atento, comprometido con sus estudios, responsable  muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona de ‘Pampahasi’ que se caracteriza por situarse sobre la ladera este de la ciudad, las calles son pendientes muy empinadas. Los orígenes de sus pobladores son; campesinos aymaras que lucharon por la liberación de la corona española y se acomodaron en ese lugar como trinchera. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 2-14 grados centígrados, durante todo el año.
Alvaro es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que es propia y está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Él estudia la carrera de diseño gráfico, se encuentra en primer año y sus principales aptitudes son; la creatividad, la imaginación, el pensamiento libre, sabe dibujar, es auténtico, visualiza la imagen en su mente y después la proyecta sobre el papel. Y se prepara para desempeñarse en el ejercicio libre de la profesión de diseño gráfico o para prestar servicios de asesoría y desarrollo de proyectos de comunicación visual, formando parte de grupos multidisciplinarios en diferentes empresas públicas o privadas del área de las comunicaciones o que se vinculan a ella, brindando soluciones gráficas comunicacionales. Paralelamente a sus estudios su negocio es el mantenimiento de computadoras a domicilio, se encarga de reparar y configurar ordenadores para empresas y clientes particulares, ambas actividades las realiza de durante toda la semana. “trabajo y estudio, ambas actividades me ayudan en mi desarrollo personal…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no es agotador y cubre sus gastos personales, la desventaja es que es libre y algunas veces se cruza con los horarios de clases. Su sueño es salir profesional y trabajar en un medio de comunicación, él desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil y pagar por adelantado las cuotas de su universidad para obtener un descuento. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en menos de 1 año que estudia y trabaja. 
Es por esos motivos que Alvaro solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora portátil y pagar las cuotas de sus materias por adelantado para recibir un descuento
texts.en:
Alvaro is a 19-year-old young man, single, without children, and who studies graphic design.

He is intelligent, cheerful, happy, attentive, committed to his studies, responsible, and very hard-working. He performs his business in the ‘Pampahasi’ Zone, characterized by being situated above the eastern mountainside of the city, whose streets have very steep slopes. The origins of its inhabitants are Aymara farmers that fought for liberation from the Spanish crown, and settled in that place that is like a trench. It has a cold and dry climate with a daily temperature that varies between 2-14 degrees centigrade during the whole year.

Alvaro has dark skin, short black hair, brown eyes, short stature, and a thin build. His mother tongue is Aymara, which he speaks with his family, and Spanish, through the general culture and the business that he realizes. He lives his life in his parents’ home which is their own and is constructed of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof. It has potable water, electricity, gas, and a sewage system. 

He is studying graphic design. He finds himself in his first year of studies and his main aptitudes are creativity, imagination, free thinking, he knows how to draw, he is authentic, and he visualizes the image in his mind and then projects it onto paper. He is preparing to work in the free exercise of the graphic design profession or to provide advisory and visual communication project development services, forming a part of multidisciplinary groups in different public or private business in the area of communications or that are based on it, providing graphic communications solutions. 

Parallel to his studies, his business is maintaining computers on-site. He is responsible for repairing and configuring computers for businesses and private customers. He performs both of these activities during the week. “I work and study. Both activities help me in my personal development...” he comments. The advantage of his business is that it is not tiring and it covers his personal expenses. The disadvantage is that it is free and sometimes it overlaps his class schedule. 

His dream is to come out a professional and work in the media. He wishes to purchase a laptop and pay his university fees in advance to get a discount. This is the first sequence of loans with the institution in less than 1 year of studying and working.

It is for these reasons that Alvaro is requesting a loan to purchase a laptop and pay the class fees in advance to receive a discount.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop and to pay the fees for his classes in advance to receive a discount.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe, age 44, operates a tire shop to earn an income. The business offers tire replacement, tire repair, and tire sales. Fe's husband Jumar handles the labor, such as vulcanizing and tire repair. Fe handles the finances and inventory as well as the promotion for their business. The shop's regular customers are vehicle owners from the local community. Fe and Jumar earn a minimum of PhP 800 in service fees every day. 

Fe and Jumar live with their children in Pasay City. They share both the management of their household and the operation of the business, and they work hard in order to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

To help her continue operations of her business, Fe is requesting a PhP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing her loan funds to buy materials and supplies needed in her tire shop business. She expects a boost in income as she expands her business.  

Fe's goal is to grow the customer base of the tire shop, for she wants to increase their profit. Her dream is to provide her children with a good life and to provide them with a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, as well as to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy equipment, supplies, and materials needed for her tire repair shop

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is a married man with four children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a farm where he grows maize. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a productive area, and his primary customers are maize millers and the Cereals Board. He describes his biggest business challenge to be bad weather.

Gideon will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable farm. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Evame

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Evame works hard to support her family.

She has a business farming vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Evame is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to  purchase additional seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies for her farm.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested this loan to further build her businesses.

Evame has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seed, fertlizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her general store.

Maricel has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, fabric conditioner, coffee, biscuits, vinegar, hair clips, condiments and other groceries.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Masifina

texts.en:
Masifina is 39 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Masifina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like beverages, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

Masifina has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as beverages, medicine, ketchup, vinegar, soy sauce, noodles, biscuits, candles, shampoo, soap and other groceries.

In the future, Masifina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store, like beverages, condiments, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, age 60, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of grocery items such as biscuits, milk, snacks, candies, soft drinks, and juice. She also sells household items like shampoo and candles. Nenita and her husband have eight children. 

Nenita has requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000. She will use her loan funds to buy beverages, cigarettes, home use products, and grocery items to offer for sale.

In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, cigarettes, home use products, and grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Melessa

texts.en:
Melessa is a 42-year-old married mother of seven children, four in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.
Melessa has a business vending condiments in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like salt.

Melessa has been in this business for three years. In the future, Melessa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her condiments business.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a 45-year-old man who is married with three children and living in Kasese, Uganda. John is a farmer who began commercial farming in order to generate income for his family and earn a living.  John is a hard-working man with a dream of expanding his business and fighting poverty. However, he is faced with a challenge of floods and too much sunshine. John wants money to buy pesticides and fertilizers to improve on his farm products.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers to improve on his farm products.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Айгул среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 17 лет назад, с покупки скота на 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Айгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 20 овец. На 4,0 Га земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян, топлива и удобрений для обработки почвы. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Aigul is 40 years old, married and is raising 2 children with her husband. Aigul has a high school degree and supplements that family's income by farming and raIsing livestock. She started 17 years ago by purchasing livestock with 50,000 som (KGS). Due to her persistence and hard work she now owns 3 cows and 20 sheep. She also grows beans on 4 hectares of land. In order to further expand the business, Aigul has turned to "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 100,000 com (KGS) to purchase seeds, fuel and fertilizer for spring planting. She plans to invest the profits form the expansion back into her farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fuel and fertilizers for cultivating the land and growing organic products

loans.name: Walter Oswaldo

texts.es:
Walter, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domestico, él les ayuda a sus padres en la agricultura, cultivando maíz, frijol y ajonjolí, estos cultivos los siembra especialmente en tiempo de invierno.

Walter, actualmente trabaja en un proyecto de agua en su comunidad.

Walter, necesita el crédito para comprar una ternera para criarla y esperar que se convierta en vaca, para ordeñarla y vender leche.

Walter, sueña en un futuro poder tener cinco vacas lecheras, para tener más leche para comercializar y así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Walter is 23 years old and studied through high school. He is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the household duties. Walter helps his parents in agriculture by cultivating corn, beans, and sesame. These crops are planted during the winter season. Walter currently works for a water project in his community.

Walter needs a loan in order to buy a calf that he can raise until it matures into a dairy cow so that he can sell the milk it produces. In the future, he dreams of owning five dairy cows so that he can have more milk that he can sell, thereby generating more income.

loans.use: to buy a calf.

loans.name: Ana Lilian

texts.es:
Ana, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está  casada, tiene 4 hijos, pero solo 3 viven con ella, 3 de ellos estudian.

Ana, tiene un negocio de compra y venta de madera, el negocio lo tiene desde hace 5 años, su esposo comenzó comprando madera para vender y luego ella tomo ese cargo; no dispone de otras actividades económicas, sus hijos se involucran en el negocio cuando no van a la escuela, el horario de atención es desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. 

Ana, quiere comprar cuartones, regla vara, regla pacha y otros para comercializar, porque le hacen pedidos grandes, con esto su negocio mejorará, ya que tendrá más clientes y la necesidad de hacer crecer el negocio  
estará realizada.

Sus sueños son ampliar el negocio y pintar su casa para darle mejor imagen a su negocio,  espera que sus hijos aprendan a manejar el negocio.
texts.en:
Ana, aged 37, studied up to high school. She is married and has four children, but only three of them live with her. Three of her children go to school.

Ana has been running a business buying and selling timber for five years now. Her husband started by buying timber to sell, and then she assumed that duty. She doesn't follow any other occupations. Her children get involved in the business when they are not in school. Their business hours are from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

Ana wants to buy beams, scantlings and other timber products to sell because her customers place large orders. With this purchase, her business will improve because she will have more customers, and the need to make the business grow will be fulfilled.

Her dreams are to expand her business and paint her home to improve the image of her business. 

She hopes that her children learn to run the business.

loans.use: to buy beams, scantlings, and other timber products to sell.

loans.name: Soelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Soelia, una campesina muy amorosa y de gran pasión por la naturaleza, trabaja con animales, pero no sacrificándolos ni vendiéndolos solamente, trabaja con la leche de las vacas; es tanta la admiración y respeto por los animales que prefiere que mueran por vejez antes de tener que sacrificarles para conseguir una rentabilidad por su carne. 

Es madre de 2 hijos, trabaja con ellas enseñándoles la pasión por el campo, por amar la naturaleza y el amor por los animales. 

Pensando en su vivienda y en sus hijos la señora Soelia quiere expandirse y por tal motivo tiene un dinero juntado para comprar una vaca lechera por lo que requiere un crédito para ajustar el dinero suficiente para comprar la vaca pues si abona un capital y queda debiendo el otro los interés serían muy altos y estaría pagando el doble de la vaca. 

Con la ayuda de esta vaca tendrá más producción lechera garantizando una vida económica estable para el futuro de ella y sus hijas. 
Sueña con tener una finca con muchas vacas rodearse de estos mamíferos que le ayudan a llevar el sustento a su familia.
texts.en:
Soelia—a very loving farmer with great passion for nature—works with animals. However, she doesn’t slaughter them or sell them only; she works with cows’ milk. She has a lot of admiration and respect for the animals, and she prefers that they die of old age before having to slaughter them to gain a profit for their meat.

She is the mother of 2 children. She works with them, teaching them passion for the country, to love nature, and to love animals. 

Regarding her home and her children, Mrs. Soelia wants to expand her home, and for this reason, she has to collect some money to buy a dairy cow.
