For this, she needs a loan to make sure she has enough money to buy the cow. With any other loan, if she pays off the capital, the very high interest payments would remain and she would be paying double for the cow.

With the help of this cow, she will have more guaranteed milk production, as well as a financially stable life for her and her daughters’ future.

She dreams of having a farm with many cows to surround herself with these mammals, which help to bring sustenance to her family.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her farm.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y vive con sus hijos, los cuales dependen economicamente de ella.

Santos, se dedica a la elaboración de tortillas desde hace 8 años, lo cual aprendió de su madre; el negocio lo tiene en la comunidad.

Santos, necesita el crédito para comprar maíz por mayor y reparar el lugar donde está el negocio.

Los sueños de Santos son, seguir trabajando con su tortilleria y en un futuro sueña con poner un negocio de pupusas y tacos.
texts.en:
Santos has a ninth-grade education. She is married and lives with her children, who depend on her financially. 

Santos has worked making tortillas for 8 years. She learned it from her mother. She has her business in the community. 

Santos needs the loan to buy corn wholesale and to repair the place where she has her business. Santos' dream is to keep working in her tortilla business and in the future she dreams of opening a pupusa and taco business.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale and repair the place where she has her business.

loans.name: Ileen

texts.en:
Ileen is 34 years old, married and has three children. She runs a small convenient store where she sells a variety of food and household items. She has been doing this for three years.
She requested a loan to buy food items such as rice, corned beef, canned food, ice blocks and sugar.
She will use her profit to meet her family's weekly expenses and pay for her children's school fees. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy corned beef, canned food, ice blocks and sugar.

loans.name: Monedas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Monedas, está integrado por tres mujeres de etnia Miskita, que viven en Bilwi, Municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se unieron hace un año con el propósito de tener la oportunidad de accesar a financiamiento con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana, para  incrementar su nivel de ingresos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

Reina Isabel. Es integrante del grupo solidario. Es una mujer emprendedora de 29 años de edad. Está casada con 2 hijas: La mayor de 13 años cursa su segundo año de secundaria y una pequeña de 5 años. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como albañil. Desde hace un año estableció un comedor en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de Puerto Cabezas, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y educación de su hija. Solicita financiamiento para comprar insumos e ingredientes para elaborar frito, vigoron, taco, refrescos naturales.  Ella sueña con tener un negocio prospero

Con el crédito anterior otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado a través de KIVA, le permitió a Alexa, coordinadora del grupo solidario comprar productos y cosméticos de bellezas.
texts.en:
The communal bank Monedas is comprised of three Miskita women who live in Bilwi, municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They started this group one year ago in order to have access to group loans through Pana Pana, increase their income and improve their families’ living conditions.

Reina Isabel, 29, is one of the members. She is an entrepreneurial woman. She is married and has two daughters. The eldest one is thirteen years old and is a sophomore student in high school. The youngest one is five years old. Her husband works in the informal sector, as a mason.

Reina Isabel opened a restaurant a year ago in one of Puerto Cabezas’s marketplaces. This is how she contributes to the home expenses and pays for her daughter’s education. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to prepare fried food, vigorón [cabbage salad, boiled cassava and fried pork wrapped in banana leaf], tacos and natural beverages. Her dream is to have a prosperous business.

The previous loan was coordinated by Pana Pana and financed through Kiva. With it, Alexa, the group coordinator, could buy beauty products.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepared fried food, vigorón, tacos, and natural beverages.

loans.name: Ygnacia

texts.es:
Ygnacia, de 57 años de edad, no estudio, está casada y su esposo trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 7 hijos, pero ninguno depende ellos.

Ygnacia, se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace más de 25 años, lo aprendió de su mamá.- Además de la tortillería, ha colocado una pequeña tienda en su casa, su hija le ayuda en la tortillería.

Ygnacia, solicita el crédito para comprar productos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, sal y productos lácteos.- El dinero como capital para continuar con la tienda.
 
El sueño principal de Ygnacia, es hacer crecer su tienda, para mejorar los ingresos de su familia y cumplir con sus obligaciones crediticias.
texts.en:
Ygnacia, aged 57, didn't go to school. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture. They have seven children, but none of them are their dependants.

Ygnacia has been making and selling tortillas for more than 25 years—a trade she learned from her mother. Besides running the tortilla shop, she has set up a small grocery store at her home. Her daughter helps her out at the tortilla shop.

Ygnacia is requesting a loan to use the money as working capital to continue with the grocery store. She will buy products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, and dairy products. 

Ygnacia's main dream is to grow the grocery store in order to improve the family income and meet her financial obligations.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, beans, sugar, oil, salt, and dairy products.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe plants and harvests bananas in order to help her husband provide for the needs of the family. Currently, her banana farm brings her PhP 2,000 each month. Fe would like to increase this income so that she can better meet the increasing needs of her family. She has four children. 

Fe decided to request a loan in order to buy fertilizer for her banana farm. This investment will boost production and increase her income.

In the future, Fe has ambitions of buying a motorcycle with which to transport her bananas to market. This would prevent her from having to rent a motorcycle for this purpose.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her banana farm

loans.name: Don Max Group

texts.es:
Don Maximiliano es un hombre campesino muy trabajador, en su comunidad es una persona muy respetada porque es el delegado, pero también le tienen un gran cariño y confianza. Mejor conocido como don Max, tiene 58 años y es padre de 8 hijos, aunque ya sólo dos de ellos dependen económicamente de él. 

Hace algunos años don Max tuvo que dejar a su familia para viajar a Estados Unidos en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo, pero su intención era mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos. Permaneció en el extranjero varios años hasta que su esposa enfermó y regresó a su comunidad. Afortunadamente, la esposa de don Max se recuperó y actualmente continúa apoyando a su esposo en el negocio.

Después de identificar que en la comunidad no había una ferretería, don Max invirtió sus ahorros y emprendió su propio negocio. La ferretería ya tiene cuatro años operando y continúa teniendo buenas ganancias, los préstamos de VisionFund le han permitido surtir herramientas como desarmadores, pinzas, tuercas, martillos, macetas, palas, azadones y carretillas entre otros.

“Tener mi negocio a pie de carretera en un local estable que además es propio me ayuda mucho” comentó don Max entusiasmado. Su mayor sueño es abrir una sucursal más en alguna comunidad vecina, pero sabe que le hace falta más capital sin embargo sabe que aumentando sus ganancias y con el apoyo de VisionFund lo puede lograr.

El grupo también está integrado por Teresa quien invertirá en borregos; Eligio, en su carpitería; Gilberta y Francisco; en la cría de cerdos.

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del municipio, Don Max es quien viste una camisa blanca*
texts.en:
Maximiliano is a very hardworking countryside man. In his community he is very respected because of being a representative, but he is also well liked and trusted. Better known as Max, he is 58 years old and has 8 children, although only two of them are still dependent of him financially. Some years ago, Max had to leave his family to travel to the United States looking for better job opportunities, but his intention was to improve the quality of life of his family. He stayed abroad for many years until his wife got sick and he returned to his town. Fortunately, his wife recovered, and currently she keeps on supporting her husband in the business. After noticing there was no hardware store in his town, Max invested his savings and started his own business. His hardware store has been open for four years, and he keeps on having good earnings. VisionFund's loans have allowed him to stock up with tools such as screwdrivers, pliers, screws, hammers, flowerpots, shovels, hoes and wheelbarrows, among other things. 
“Having my business next to the highway at a stable place which also belongs to me helps me a lot", commented Max enthusiastically. His biggest dream is to open a branch at a neighboring town, but he knows that he needs more capital. However, he knows that by increasing his earnings and with VisionFund's support, he will be able to achieve it. The group is also formed by Teresa who will invest in sheep; Eligio, in his carpentry shop; Gilberta and Francisco, in raising pigs. 
*The picture was taken on the steps of the Municipality. Max is wearing a white shirt.*

loans.use: to buy screwdrivers, pliers, screws, hammers, flowerpots, shovels, hoes and wheelbarrows.

location.town: San Miguel La Labor, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Fatima

texts.pt:
A senhora Fátima tem 39 anos de idade, é solteira e é mãe de 1 filha que frequenta o ensino técnico, é uma funcionária pública e vive com a sua mãe.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar frangos, legumes, mariscos, refrigerantes, cadeiras e mesas para reforçar o seu negócio.
Seus sonhos e esperanças para o futuro são abrir uma clínica de psicologia pessoal e um restaurante grande para aumentar a renda familiar..
Diz que tem como desafios insuficiência de   fundos  e para ultrapassar esta situação faz um xitique como forma de poupar  e irá solicitar mais créditos para concretizar o seu plano.
texts.en: Fátima is 39 years old, single, and the mother of one daughter who is in technical school. She is a public administrator and lives with her mother. She says that she will use this loan to buy chickens, vegetables, seafood, soft drinks, tables and chairs, to enhance her business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to open a psychology clinic and a big restaurant to increase her family's income. Her challenges include a lack of funds, but to overcome this she maintains a xitique [traditional savings account] and plans to take out future loans to realize her plans.

loans.use: to buy chickens, vegetables, seafood, soft drinks, tables and chairs, to enhance her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth sells cooking items such as sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil to earn an income. She is the single mother of three children. She has been involved in this business for 21 years and describes herself as experienced. Her business is located in an area with growth potential, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

This will be Ruth's fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance. Her previous loan was repaid successfully, and she will use her new Kes 50,000 loan funds to buy a stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil, and other items to offer for sale. 

Her business goal is to be a successful entrepreneur within five years.

loans.use: to buy a stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil, and other items to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, bread, flour and other items to enable him start a retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Ndoro

texts.en:
Ndoro is a married man. He has five children with ages ranging from 2 to 13 years. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, maize flour, cooking oil and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock.

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil and other items

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Pamela has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Pamela has been in this business for two years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 65 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for 13 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Vevencia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 53 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, rice, condiments and other groceries.

Norma has been in this business for one year and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, biscuits, soft drinks, candies, junk foods, rice, vinegar, soy sauce, coffee and other groceries.

In the future, Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, rice, condiments and other groceries

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is 53 years old and married. She has six children, two of whom are in school.

Sofia is in the agriculture business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Sofia has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Sofia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 32-year-old married man with two children living in Fort Portal Uganda. He sells maize flour and at the same time grows bananas to earn more income. He is faced with the challenge of agricultural product price fluctuation. He has hopes of having a good business and educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Richard needs a loan for maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José es un confeccionista de 59 años de edad que lleva operando en el mercado desde el año 1985, sobreviviendo a la crisis de cierres de empresas de confección que hubo pro los años 90.
Es casado y junto con su esposa trabaja arduamente para generar su propio sustento, ambos se apoyan y trabajan para cumplir los contratos que tienen,
Se especializan en la confección de blue jean, 
Un propósito que se han trazado en su vida es poder mejorar las condiciones de su hogar, ahorrar para vivir una vejez tranquila puesto que no tienen hijos que le ayuden en momentos difíciles, solo se tienen el uno al otro.
Para cumplir un contrato grande que se le presento y agradece esa bendición, José quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido:
•	Telas
•	Hilos
•	Botones
•	Cremalleras
texts.en:
José is a 59-year old clothing manufacturer who has been operating in the market since 1985. He survived the crisis in the '90s when manufacturing businesses were closing up.

José is married, and he and his wife work hard to generate the income that supports them. They support each other and work to fulfill the contracts they have. They specialize in manufacturing blue jeans.

One intention they have established in their lives is to improve the condition of their home. They also want to save so they can live peacefully in their old-age; they don't have children to help them at difficult times. They only have each other.

To fulfill a large contract they were presented with, and they are grateful for that blessing, José wants to take out a loan so he can purchase some supplies: • Fabric • Thread • Buttons • Zippers

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Levys Milenys

texts.es:
Levys es una mujer cabeza de familia, madre de una adolescente de 17 años de edad, genera los recursos para mantener a su hija y su humilde hogar alquilando lavadoras, actividad que inicio a ejercer en el año 2010 por necesidad económica. 

Está trabajador mujer aspira a seguir ejerciendo su actividad, tener sostenibilidad del negocio, mandar a su hija a estudiar a una institución universitaria pero de momento debe esperar a que su negocio sea lo suficientemente rentable ya que apenas genera para comer y pagar las deudas. 

Ella quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar una lavadora y repuestos dado que en esta actividad se presentan muchos averíos.

Apoya a una mujer cabeza de familia que ante la falta de empleo fue recursiva y se idea  la forma de generar sustento para su familia.
texts.en:
Levys is the head of household in her family. She has one teenage daughter, who is seventeen, and she generates enough income to provide for her and to run her humble household by renting washing machines. She started this business in 2010 because of her financial needs.

This hardworking woman wants to keep working and have a sustainable business. She would like to send her daughter to college but for now she must wait for her business to become more profitable, because so far she is only making enough to feed her family and pay off her debts.

She is requesting this loan to buy a washing machine and spare parts, because this business requires many repairs.

Please help support this resourceful woman, who in the face of unemployment was able to find a way to single-handedly support her family.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine and spare parts.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a mixed farmer from Munanda village in Ndaragwa, Kenya. She has been married for 24 years and as a result she has a very strong bond with her husband and seven children. Teresia practises mixed farming, which offers her multiple sources of income.

Teresia is seeking a loan to purchase a water pump. Her one acre farm is comprised of two dairy cows, three sheep, thirty heads of poultry, a variety of crops and twenty trees--all of which need water to thrive. The problems she is facing due to the remoteness of her home is lack of electricity, lack of clean cooking fuel and lack of a tap water system. As a result, she resorts to the use of solar-powered devices, firewood and a water well.

With your loan investment, Teresia will be able to pump water in huge volumes from the well in a much easier and much faster manner compared to the method of fetching buckets. The water pump will also clear the way for the introduction of irrigation technology in the future when she is ready to invest in that technique. The impact of your loan will be evident in the greener crops and healthier animals henceforth. Improving Teresia's farm business will definitely bring a positive change in her family life as well.

loans.use: to buy a water pump

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Vilma works hard to support her family. She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Vilma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her bicycle transport business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, está casada, tiene 3 hijas, todas son mayores de edad, solo una de sus hijas vive con ella y es quien le ayuda con el trabajo de la casa y el negocio de la pupuseria.

María, tiene una pupusería desde hace más de 9 años, esta labor la aprendió desde que estaba muy pequeña, este negocio le ha permitido salir adelante con su familia, el negocio está a 2 minutos de su casa, sobre la calle principal de su comunidad.

El dinero lo utilizara para comprar harina, aceite y una mesa para brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Los planes de María, es que su negocio crezca y ser la preferida por sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old, married, and has three adult daughters, only one of whom lives with her and helps her with housework as well as with her business, which is a pupusa stand. 

María's pupusa stand has been in business for over nine years. She started learning this business when she was very young, and it has allowed her to provide for her family. The stand is located two minutes away from her home, on the main street in her community.

She will use this money to buy flour and oil, as well as a table to better serve her customers. María's plans are for her business to grow and become her customers' preferred establishment.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, and a table.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali has been struggling since he graduated from the university of Haja, Yemen. A 36-year-old married man, Ali wants to cover the necessary expenses of his family. Because of high rates of unemployment, he couldn't find a job so he decided to start his own business selling canned food, soft drinks, and other items in his small shop. He applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase food items to expand his business. Taking out this loan will make Ali able to attract more customers that will lead him to increase his income as well as his profits. This loan will help him to create jobs in his community. Ali plans to let his brother work in the shop.
Ali looks forward to opening another shop to be able to create a lot more jobs.

loans.use: To purchase food items to expand his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy organic manure

loans.name: Mlimani Group

texts.en:
Tabita, who is in her late thirties, runs a pharmacy business to earn her living. She has operated her business for five years. She works daily from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. and is able to make a good monthly profit. Tabita and her husband have one child who is still a baby. 

This will be Tabita's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She utilized the previous loans to buy a larger variety and quantity of medicines, so now the pharmacy is well-stocked with medicines and looks attractive to customers looking for local pharmacies. She will use the profits to help her take care of her baby and family, as well as to cover household expenses and repay her loan.  She will use this loan to replenish fast-moving medicines like anti-malaria medications, painkillers, and anti-infection medicines. She dreams of eventually buying a plot of land and of expanding her business into an international pharmacy.
 
Tabita will share this loan with her loan group "Mlimani," which consists of nine members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. Tabita is truly happy to receive this loan, and she appreciates Kiva for the support of her loan group, the members of whom will be better able to take care of their families as a result.

loans.use: to replenish fast-moving medicines in her pharmacy, such as anti-malaria medications, painkillers, and anti-infection medicines

loans.name: Sengpov

texts.en: Sengpov is a 21-year-old freshman who is pursuing an associate’s degree, majoring in banking and finance at a university in a province. He is from the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. His father has a rice mill machine for rent and his mother is a rice farmer. Due to the fact that he is lacking the finances to cover his university fees from the first to the second year, he has decided to request a loan. This loan will help him have enough finances to earn an associate’s degree and earn skills for his future job. After graduation, he dreams of having a good job with a decent salary to help his parents. He also wants to save money to build his own proper house.

loans.use: to cover his university fees from the first to the second year

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 42 years old, married and has two children. To earn a living, she owns a transport business.  She wants to earn a good income and has taken out a loan to buy parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle to serve more passengers.

Fe wants to buy an additional motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy another cow

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan to pay for grocery items and direct selling personal products. Her earnings helped a lot in sending her children to school and meeting their daily needs. This time she has added "halo-halo" snacks at her store.

She would now like to apply for an 18,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and canned goods which she sells at retail. Part of the loan she will use to buy beans, gelatin, sweet potatoes, milk and other ingredients to make and sell "halo-halo," which is a traditional Filipino treat consisting of a blend of fruits, sweet preserves, evaporated milk, and shaved ice. The name literally means "Mix-Mix". Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 700 a day. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for it will surely help cover their daily sustenance and her children's education.

Myrna hopes to maintain and grow her business so she could continue to send her three children to school. She prays to lead a happy and victorious life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items to sell and bananas, beans, gelatin, sweet potatoes, milk and other ingredients to make and sell "halo-halo" as well.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 57-year-old married mother of six children, one in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Myrna has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Myrna has been in this business for one year. In the future, Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed

loans.name: Ana Dolly

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer muy tierna, carismática, una verdadera guerrera, excelente madre y muy leal, ella es madre cabeza de familia, tiene 4 hijos que depende exclusivamente de ella, dos hombre y dos mujeres.

Ella opera desde u hogar u negocio de confección a terceros, no tiene un local pues debe alternar sus actividades comerciales con las de ama de casa.

Ana solo quiere ser suficiente, ver a sus hijos felices, aunque se sienta cansada por su extenuante horario laboral, pero que ellos progresen y se capaciten para ser buenas personas y unos profesionales es suficiente para ella.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una maquina recortadora, ya que con ella se puede ahorrar tiempo de producción y será más eficaz.
texts.en:
Ana is a very gentle woman, but also a true fighter. She is an excellent mother and very loyal. She is the head of her household and has four children who depend exclusively on her, two boys and two girls.

She works from home and her business involves dressmaking for third parties. She doesn't have a separate business space because she has to alternate her business operations and her homemaking chores.

All that Ana wants it to be self-sufficient and for her children to be happy. Even if she feels tired because of her exhausting work schedule, if they are able  to advance and learn in order to become good people and have a career, that is enough for her.

She is requesting this loan to buy a fabric cutting machine, because it will allow her to cut down on production time and be more efficient.

loans.use: to buy a cutting machine.

loans.name: Myriam De Jesus

texts.es:
Myriam es una viuda de 62 años de edad que se dedica a la confección ella tiene dos hijos ambos tienen familia y solo está en su casa luchando por sobrevivir, por generar ingresos para su alimento, para pagar servicios públicos como agua, electricidad, gas, saneamiento entre otros.

Ella tiene un humilde taller de confección en su hogar, trabaja arduamente desde el año 1984 y tiene clientes que le ayudan y le brindan trabajo. 

Su mayor preocupación es el sostenimiento de su negocio ya que están surgiendo muchos talleres jóvenes de confección y ella no tiene la misma agilidad que tenía hace unos años. 

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos como lo son hilos, telas, broches.
Con estos insumos tendrá material para trabajar y demostrar que le faltan muchos años por trabajar y competir en el mercado.
texts.en:
Myriam is a 62-year-old widow that works in sewing.  She has two children, both have their own families.  She is alone at home fighting to survive, to generate income for her food, to pay for services like water, power, gas, sewage and others.

She has a humble sewing shop at home, she has been working hard since 1984 and has customers that help her by providing her with work to do.  

Her biggest worry is keeping her business alive as there are new and upcoming tailor shops and she doesn’t have the same agility she had a few years ago.  

She requests a loan to buy materials like threads, fabric and brooches. With these materials she will have working capital and she wants to show she still has many years left to work and to compete with the market.

loans.use: to buy materials like threads, fabric and brooches.

loans.name: Onis Manuel

texts.es:
Onis es una persona emprendedora, trabajadora, le gusta el trabajo independiente generar su propio sustento a partir de su negocio, desde el año 1982 tiene una venta de frutas y verduras, su negocio tiene una existencia desde el año 1982 y sigue en pie desarrollando su actividad. 

A diferencia de hace 23 años Onis tiene dos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad y lo que le preocupa hoy en día es que se está viendo muy corto para generar el sustento de sus hijos, la razón principal es que no cuenta con capital para abastecerlo y traer mayor surtido de mercancía y las únicas personas que le prestan dineros son naturales informales que le cobran un interés muy alto. 

Con la llegada de interactuar a una zona como Sincelejo, puede apoyar a personas como Onis que no solo recibirá un préstamo, recibirá asesorías que lo ayudaran a potenciar sus ventas y masificar su ganancia.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de frutas y verduras, cree que este es el año donde progresara, donde generara ingresos para reparar su hogar, para darle regalos a su esposa e hijos, para comprar vitrinas y estanterías este es su año, apóyalo.
texts.en:
Onis is an enterprising, hard-working person. He likes working independently and generating his own means of support through his business. Since 1982 he has had a fruit and vegetable stand. His business has been in existence since 1982 and he continues to develop it.

Unlike 33 years ago, Onis has two children aged 7 and 9, and what worries him today is that he is very short on what he needs to support his children. The main reason is that he doesn't have capital to stock the store and bring in more merchandise and the only people who loan him money are informal local people who charge him a very high interest rate.

With the arrival of Interactuar to an area like Sincelejo, it can support people like Onis, who will not only receive a loan but will receive advice that helps him to improve his sales and increase his income.

He is asking for a loan to buy a supply of fruit and vegetables. He believes that this is the year in which he will make progress, in which he will generate income to repair his home, give his wife and children gifts, and buy display cases and shelves. This is his year; support him.

loans.use: to buy a supply of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Julia Estebana

texts.es:
Julia, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada, tiene cuatro hijos, de los cuales uno de ellos ya está acompañado y los otros tres viven con ella y están estudiando.

Julia, desde que se acompaño ha trabajado junto a su pareja en la agricultura, ellos cultivan chile y maíz, su hijo mayor trabaja juntamente con ellos.

Julia, con el crédito que solicita alquilará 14,000 metros cuadrados de tierra, para poder sembrarla una parte de maíz y una pequeña parte de chile.

El sueño de Julia, es poder vender la cosecha en el tiempo donde pagan bien la masorca de elote, para obtener buenas ganancias y guardar una parte del dinero de las ganancias, para seguir cultivando más.
texts.en:
Julia is 38 years old, and she studied until the seventh grade. She is married and has four kids. One of them is already married and the other three live with her and are studying.

Ever since she got married, Julia has worked with her husband on the farm. They grow chili peppers and corn, and her oldest son works together with them. With the loan Julia is requesting, she will rent 14,000 square meters of land to plant it with one part corn and a small part of chili peppers.

Julia's dream is to be able to sell the harvest at the time when people pay well for corn on the cob in order to obtain good profits and save part of the money earned to keep cultivating more.

loans.use: to rent 14,000 square meters of land to plant it with one part corn and a small part of chili peppers.

loans.name: Rosa Liliam

texts.es:
Lilian, de 29 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, debido a los escasos recursos de su familia, se dedico a trabajar y aprendio todo lo relacionado a la agricultura; actualmente está soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres.

Lilian, es empleada en una empresa y en sus tiempos libres siembra maíz con sus padres, puesto que siempre le ha ayudado a ellos, desde que dejó de estudiar.

Con el crédito que solicita Rosa, pretende cultivar 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y comprará dos sacos de abono, pagará mano de obra y pagará el alquiler de la tierra.

Lilian, sueña en el futuro, poder cultivar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, para poder vender una parte en elote y la otra parte dejarla para vender el maíz.
texts.en:
Lilian is 29 years old and went to school until the 8th grade, due to her family's scarce resources. She dedicated herself to work and learned everything related to agriculture. Right now, she's single with no children and lives with her parents.

Lilian works in a business and grows corn with her parents in her free time. She has always helped them ever since she stopped attending school.

With the loan she's seeking to grow 7,000 square meters of corn. She will buy two sacks of compost and pay for labor and rent on the land.

In the future, Lilian dreams of being able to grow 14,000 square meters of corn, to be able to sell a part as elote (a popular street food involving corn on the cob) and leave the rest to sell the corn.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of compost and pay for labor and rent on the land.

loans.name: Los Jovenes De Exito De Chuabaj Group

texts.es:
Gregorio es un hombre de cuarenta años de edad, es casado tiene una hermosa familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 7 y 22 años, esta familia vive en una comunidad denominada Chichicastenango.
Gregorio (el primero del lado derecho de la fotografía de camisa rayada)  este gran hombre es un ejemplo a seguir, porque a pesar de los escasos recursos que su familia tenía, el con esfuerzo y dedicación logro graduarse como maestro de música y ahora gracias a esta profesión ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia, el desde hace diez años está ejerciendo esta profesión.
Gregorio ahora ha pensado en construir una casa, donde su familia pueda vivir mejor, Gregorio se ha esmerado mucho para construir su casa, pero a pesar de todos sus esfuerzos no ha sido posible, Gregorio con el afán de cumplir su objetivo a organizado a un grupo de personas para solicitar un préstamo para comprar cemento, arena, cal, arena y hierro para la construcción de su casa.
El gran sueño de Gregorio es poder seguir estudiando para música y ser reconocido internacionalmente como un gran músico.
texts.en:
Gregorio is a 40 year old man. He is married and he has a beautiful family of four children between the ages of 7 and 22 years old. This family lives in a community called Chichicastenango. Gregorio (the first on the right in the photo in the striped shirt) is a great man and an example to be followed because, in spite of the scarce resources that his family has, with his strength and dedication he was able to graduate as a music teacher and now, thanks to this profession, he has been able to get his family ahead. He has spent 10 years in this profession. 

Now, Gregorio is thinking of constructing a home where his family can live in better conditions. Gregorio has taken great care to construct his home, but despite all of his efforts it has not been possible. With the desire to complete his objective, Gregorio has organized a group of people to seek a loan to purchase cement, sand, lime and iron to construct his home. Gregorio's greatest dream is to be able to continue studying music and to be recognized internationally as a great musician.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, lime and iron for the construction of his home.

loans.name: Jagannath Group

texts.en:
Jagannath Group was founded in the year 2015 in Sindhekela village with 10 active village self-dependent women, with an objective for developing their existing businesses as well as their livelihood. All the members of this group have their own professional businesses. Anita is one of them who taken a great role for her development and the group members livelihood improvement. 

Anita is standing in the second row, second person from the right hand side in the photo. She is about 27 years old and living with her small family as she has a husband and only two children. 

Anita has been engaged in a Screen Printing job at her own home for six years; her husband is also helping her to promote the business. Through this business she earns a monthly income of 5,800 INR. Her opinion is that this income is not sufficient to maintain her family, with sufficient surplus for investment in the business to materialize her dreams. So to get more income by expansion of her business, she planned to improve her business over the course of the loan, and will purchase a photocopy machine, a spiral-binding machine and other related items from the local market. She hopes to get more and more profit from her business expansion and save money for construction of a house and provide better education to her children.

The other nine members of her group  also work hard at their businesses like vegetable vending, milk business, popped rice business, general store and transport business and with this loan, they hope to boost their livelihoods.

loans.use: to puchase a photocopy machine and a spiral binding machine

loans.name: Dimas Orlando

texts.es:
Dimas, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado, no tiene hijos y viven en la casa de un familiar.

Dimas, después de terminar su noveno grado, decidió trabajar para ayudar económicamente a su familia, trabajo en la agricultura y como ayudante de albañil; desde hace seis meses se asoció con un amigo y colocaron un taller de estructuras metálicas, afortunadamente en la zona donde está el taller, no hay competencia fuerte, el negocio ha funcionado muy bien.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar una maquina soldadora de estructuras metálicas, debido a que el equipo que poseen actualmente, es de un amigo y con su propio equipo podrán realizar más rápidos las estructuras metálicas que les soliciten.

El sueño Dimas, es hacer crecer el negocio con el apoyo de su socio y ser reconocidos como personas que realicen trabajos de calidad, para lograr que sus ingresos mejoren y mejorar su situación económica.
texts.en:
Dimas is 22, studied up to 9th grade, he is with someone and has no children. They live in a relative’s house.

After he finished 9th grade, Dimas decided to work to help his family financially.  He worked in agriculture and as a construction worker.  Six months ago he partnered up with a friend and they started a metallic structure shop, fortunately, there isn’t much competition in the area and the business has worked out really well.

The money will be used to buy a welding machine for metallic structures.  The equipment they currently have belongs to a friend and with their own equipment they will be able to work faster on requests. 

Dimas’ dream is to grow the business with his partner’s help and be recognized as people that do quality work. This way their income will grow and therefore their financial situation will improve.

loans.use: to buy a welding machine for metallic structures.

loans.name: Ceferino

texts.es: Ceferino un hombre trabajador y responsable que tiene 46 años de edad, él cuenta que gracias al crédito anterior logro comprar su fertilizantes y logro realizar su cultivo de frijol y maíz, con la que ahora sostiene a su familia con los alimentos y parte de ellas los vende que también de dejan buenas ganancias, Ceferino  cuenta que el confía en ADICLA porque le dan su crédito rápido y fácil, por tal motivo él ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar abono químico y pagar la mano de obra para el cultivo de maíz. Ceferino tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente el crédito para  seguir incrementando su cultivo para generar mejores ganancias y poder construir una casa para sus hijos.
texts.en: Ceferino is a hard-working and responsible man who is 46 years old. He says that, thanks to the previous loan, he managed to buy his fertilizer and managed to have his bean and corn crop, with which he now sustains his family with the food and part of it he sells which also gives him good earnings. Ceferino says that he trusts ADICLA because it gives quick loans, for this reason he is now asking for another loan which will be used to purchase chemical fertilizer and pay labor costs for his corn crop. Ceferino has the hope of getting another loan to continue expanding his crop to generate more income and be able to build a house for his children.

loans.use: to purchase chemical fertilizer and pay labor costs for the corn crop.

loans.name: Ramos Petronila

texts.es: Ramos Petronila es una joven de veinte años, esta joven está profundamente agradecida por el prestamo anterior porque gracias a ello ha mejorado su negocio de compra y venta de ropa típica que tiene en uno de los lugares más bello del mundo como es llamado el lugar donde se encuentra el  lago de Atitlán, ella cuenta que antes del crédito su negocio no contaba una variedad de productos con las que ahora ya cuenta, es así como sus ingresos han incrementado, ella ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo una vez más en su negocio de venta de ropa típica. Ramos Petronila tiene las esperanzas de conseguir este crédito, para seguir prosperando.
texts.en: Ramos Petronila is a twenty-year-old young woman. She is deeply grateful for the previous loan because thanks to the loan she has improved her business buying and selling traditional clothing that she has in one of the most beautiful places in the world, as they call the area around Lake Atitlán. She says that before the loan, her business didn't have a variety of products that she now has; this is how her earnings have increased. She is now asking for a new loan to once again invest in her business selling traditional clothing. Ramos Petronila hopes to get this loan in order to keep prospering.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia, age 55, earns her living by catching and selling crabs. For additional income, she also raises hogs. Her husband is a fisherman. They have seven children, two of whom are still attending school. 

Sonia has requested a loan in order to buy a crab trap. As a result of this investment, she will augment her ongoing catch and sell more crabs. She will also buy pig feed and additional piglets, thereby improving her hog raising business. By catching more crabs and selling selling more pigs, she will be able to afford to provide a more nutritious diet for her family. 

Her goal is to expand her both businesses so that she will be able to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a crab trap, pig feed, and piglets to raise

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a very hardworking entrepreneur from Malibay, Pasay City. She is 44 years old and has two children. One is working and the other is still studying. Leonilo, her husband, is a cook and they are helping each other to provide for their everyday needs and expenses. Elena manages a buy-and-sell business, and her income from the business is helping with their everyday needs and expenses.

What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and then sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from ready-to-wear clothing and bags to other similar products. She also sells peanuts and 'pastillas' (a sweet and sugary dessert that is well known and loved by many people in the Philippines) and other goods. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options they are offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

Elena is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to purchase more products and merchandise to sell. She will use her loan to improve her sales and her additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

In the future, she hopes to prosper through her business and give her children a good life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise such as women's bags and the like and also to add more stock of pastillas and peanuts.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida, age 54, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been in this business for 25 years. She sells a variety of grocery items such as soft drinks, hopia (a traditional bean-filled pastry), packaged snack foods, and biscuits. She also offers household items like soap, shampoo, and candles. She and her husband have six children. With two children still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Zenaida requested a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy grocery and household items to sell in her store.

In the future, Zenaida would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy grocery and household items to sell in her store

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a 32-year-old married mother of three children. With all three currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

For six years Marissa has been running a general store in the Philippines that sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc.  She has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional such items to sell.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items such as canned goods, snack foods, sugar, coffee, shampoo, fabric conditioners, etc. to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 57 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Susana has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle.

Susana has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle, a 25-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are in school, has been farming rice and corn in the Philippines for two years. The recipient of four previous loans from NWTF, Michelle has requested a new one for PHP 15000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer perseverante y trabajadora de 41 años de edad, que se dedica a la venta de alimentos, actividad que realiza desde su casa, en ella misma atiende y tiene una mesa para la comodidad de sus clientes, esta actividad le permite generar el sustento para su familia, junto con su pareja sostiene una hija adolescente para que se capacite en una universidad y se convierta en la primera profesional del hogar.

Rosa quiere vender y vender más, para alimentar no solo los sueños de su hija si no uno propio el cual es poder tener un hogar propio que sería algo espectacular para ella.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de alimentos como lo son panes, carnes, ensaladas, arepas, papas, refrescos, salsas, etc.

Tu ayuda servirá para impulsar la actividad de la empresaria y lograr tener precios más competitivos puesto que sus costos de producción se reducirán por comprar en mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
Rosa is a determined and hard working 41-year old woman.  She makes her living selling food, which she does from her home.  She serves her customers herself and has a table so her customers can be comfortable.  Her business allows her to earn enough to support her family.  She and her partner support their adolescent daughter so she can get into college and become the first professional from their household. 

Rosa wants to sell more and more so she can feed not only her daughter's dream, but also a dream of her own.  Rosa wants to have her own home, which would be something amazing for her. 

Rosa is requesting a loan so she can purchase a variety of food, such as bread, meat, salads, corn cakes, potatoes, sodas, sauces etc.

Your help will serve to drive this entrepreneur's business.  It will help her to offer more competitive prices; her production costs will go down because she will be able to make larger quantity purchases of supplies.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food such as bread, meat, salads, corn cakes, potatoes, sodas, sauces, etc.

loans.name: Carmen Virginia

texts.en: Carmen is 50 years old and married. She is an entrepreneurial woman who, ten years ago, started a recycling business that over the years has became a copy center and internet service center. She would like a loan of MXN 15,000 to buy a printer and to cover stationery expenses. The printer will allow her to increase production and help to offer a better service, thus increasing her sales. Carmen always looks for ways to get ahead and provide the best for her sons and finds the means to afford the best possible education for them. Her business also gives advice to those who initiated a proceeding in a government institution, so all customers who visit the business return because they are very satisfied with the service. Carmen will be very grateful if lenders support her business to continue growing. She is very responsible when managing credits and is very committed to making payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a printer and cover stationery expenses.

loans.name: Sara Nohemi

texts.es:
Sara, de 28 años de edad, estudio bachillerato contador, está soltera, trabaja como secretaria, vive con sus padres y hermanos, quienes siempre están apoyándose entre familia.

Sara, se dedica a vender comida típica por la tarde y noche después de salir del trabajo, se ha dedicado desde hace 7 meses, su mamá realizaba la venta anteriormente.

Sara, necesita el dinero para comprar repollo, quesillo, maíz, frutas y verduras.

El sueño principal de ella, es tener una casa propia y estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en: Sara is 28 years old, studied accounting, is single, works as a secretary, and lives with her parents and siblings. Her family always supports each other. Sara also makes a living by selling traditional foods in the afternoon and evenings after getting out of work. She has done this work for seven months; her mother used to sell before then. Sara needs the money to buy cabbage, cheese, corn, fruits and vegetables. Her biggest dreams are to have a house of her own and to study for a university degree.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, cheese, corn, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar home system that will allow him to reduce spending in kerosene, candles, and improve the home lighting.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una joven de tan solo 19 años de edad que se dedica al mundo del comercio, vende calzado femenino para niña y para dama, esta actividad le permite generar el sustento para su hija de 3 años y para pagar sus estudios universitarios, apoyada por su familia incondicionalmente esta joven demuestra cada día sus ganas de progresar y de salir adelante, trabaja extenuantemente para que su hija no llegue a pasar necesidades y siempre este dibujado en su rostro una enorme sonrisa.

Manuela quiere adentrarse un poco más en el mundo de las ventas por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de ropa y surtido de accesorios como son balacas, joyería en acero, aretes, collares y pulsaras en murado.

Este préstamo le permitirá diversificarse y llegar a más personas.
texts.en:
Manuela is a very young entrepreneur. She is only nineteen and sells women and girl's shoes. This business allows her to provide for her three-year-old daughter and also to pay for her college education. Her family supports her unconditionally. This young woman demonstrates daily her eagerness to advance and get ahead. She works tirelessly for her daughter to never be in need and to always have a big smile on her face.

Manuela wants to delve a little further into sales, so she is requesting a loan to buy clothing and assorted accessories like headbands, steel jewelry, earrings, necklaces, and bracelets. This loan will allow her to diversify and reach more customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, and accessories.

loans.name: Marcelina Azucena

texts.es:
Marcelina, de 42 años de edad, está soltera y tiene 3 hijos, de los cuales solo una está con ella y está estudiando en la universidad, pero en los ratos libres le ayuda en el negocio a su mamá.

Marcelina, se dedica a vender pupusas en un cafetín, también vende también jugos y gaseosas; ella se ha dedicado a este negocio desde hace 10 años; antes trabajaba de cocinera en un restaurante, se desplaza en bus junto con su hija.

Marcelina, solicita el crédito para comprar maíz, tomates, repollo, vinagre, cebolla, aceite y entre otros ingredientes para la elaboración de pupusas e incluyendo también bebidas como jugos y gaseosas para así poder mejorar su negocio y generar mayores ingresos.

El sueño principal de Marcelina, es ampliar su negocio y abrir otro en otro lugar.- También, sueña con tener una casa propia y que su hija logre sus metas y que se convierta en una profesional.
texts.en:
Marcelina is 42 years old, and a single mother of three. Only one of her children still lives at home while attending college, but she helps her mother with her business in her spare time. Marcelina works selling pupusas at a snack stand where she also sells juice and soda. She has been in business for ten years, and before that she worked as a cook at a restaurant. She travels to work by bus as well as her daughter.

Marcelina is requesting this loan to buy corn, tomatoes, cabbage, onion, oil, vinegar, and other ingredients to make pupusas, as well as juice and soda in order to be able to improve her business and generate more income.

Marcelina's main goal is to expand her business and open a second location. She would also like to buy a home and for her daughter to achieve her goals and earn her professional degree.

loans.use: to buy corn, tomatoes, cabbage, onion, oil, vinegar, and other ingredients to make pupusas.

loans.name: Laura Itzel

texts.en: Laura Itzel is 26 years old, unmarried and has a child. For a year and a half, she has ran a business selling woman’s clothes, shoes, accessories and handbags. Laura sells in a street market and has to transport her merchandise to and from the market each day. She is a religious and hard-working woman and is always looking for new opportunities to provide the best for her child. Laura Itzel is requesting a loan of MXN 12,000 to buy more products in bulk such as skirts, dresses, handbags and shoes in order to expand her inventory as well as her customer base. Laura is very persistent and always sees the results of the work she puts into her business in the clients' satisfaction. With this loan, she will earn a higher income to come closer to her goal of expanding into a formal setting and to be able to make successful repayments on her first loan with Konfío.

loans.use: to buy skirts, dresses, and handbags in bulk.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Isidro está en su ciclo número 7° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde gracias al esfuerzo de cada una y con las capacitaciones ellas han recibido han podido crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana, quien se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, es una mujer muy trabajadora que está esforzándose para poder dar a su familia una vida digna y sin privaciones. 
Juana pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas para poder vender, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna.
texts.en:
The San Isidro group is in its seventh loan cycle with the women's communal bank program, in which they all work and help each other to get on. They are taking the poverty elimination survey. Thanks to the efforts of each of them, and the training they have received, they have been able to grow and improve.

Juana, one of the members, sells fruit and vegetables for a living. She is a very hardworking woman who is striving to be able to give her family a decent life free from deprivation.

She is requesting this loan to allow her to buy fresh fruit and vegetables that she can sell. This will enable her to carry on with her work, struggling to be able to give her family everything they need for a decent life.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables that she can sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita is married and has 4 adult-age children. She lives in Dipolog, Zamboanga del Norte. She earns a living through buying and selling various commodities to the local community. As a mother, she believes education is a key to succeed in life. Carmelita hopes to provide for her family needs, especially her grandchildren's education. With this loan of PHP 5,000, she will be able to pay for the tuition fee of the final examination for her grandson. Carmelita will be more happy seeing all her grandchildren finish their studies and have stable jobs.

loans.use: pay tuition for her grandson

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and also farm inputs to improve his agricultural produce to sell to his customers in the market.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 47 years old and married with five children.

Thelma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

Thelma has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and food vending.

Thelma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Merwind

texts.en:
Merwind is 30 years old and married with two children.  She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Merwind is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Merwind has been in pig fattening for 4 years and also earns additional income from food vending.  She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy pig feed & vitamins

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina is a married woman with five children.  She is 45 years old and three of her children are in school.  She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Antonina has a fishing business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.  Antonina has been in this business for 1 year. 

In the future, Antonina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en:
Gertudres is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy more materials for her tailoring business.

Gertudres has been in this business for 3 years. She also earns more income from a general store.   Gertudres successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gertudres has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 39 years old, married and has five children who are all in school. 

Arlyn is in the agricultural business farming rice and corn in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to pay for rice seeds and the laborers salaries for her rice mill.

Arlyn has been farming rice and corn for 4 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Arlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy rice seeds & pay farming labor

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada, age 58, runs a general store to earn an income. She sells grocery items like bread, eggs, canned goods, noodles, candies, and biscuits, as well as household items like detergent soap. She has been running the store for 10 years, and she supplements her income by fattening and selling pigs. She and her husband have three children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 
 
Diosdada has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has successfully paid back her most recent loan and is now requesting a new one to further build her business.

Diosdada's goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to sell in her store, such as bread, eggs, canned goods, noodles, candies, and biscuits

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 57 years old, married and living in Bundibugyo Uganda. He deals in the cocoa business, mainly buying and selling in the markets.  He also gets additional income from rentals.  

Tom started his business to raise income for his family and pay school fees for his children. His main challenge is limited capital. He hopes to expand his business and construct a residential house. Tom has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: buy cocoa

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay harvesting labor

loans.name: Kabugho  Kikora

texts.en: Ellen is single, 27 years of age, and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in second hand shoes, selling mainly to local markets and also gets supplementary income from rentals. She started the business to get income but lacks enough capital and sometimes receives damaged shoes when re-stocking. Ellen wants a loan to buy second-hand shoes for selling to her customers.

loans.use: buy shoes

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a smallholder farmer who earns her living from engaging in mixed farming. This lovely, smart woman lives and farms in the village of Nyaki, which is near the town of Meru. She owns an eight-acre piece of land where she raises cows, poultry, and goats. The farm also includes cereal crops and over two dozen trees.  
 
Nancy started farming 25 years ago. Through the years, she has constantly adopted the best techniques available to cut costs and improve yields. For example, she acquired two high-yielding dairy cows, then constructed a cowshed to improve their health and productivity. Now, she is looking to introduce zero-grazing/confined feeding. She is therefore seeking a loan in the amount of Kes 60,000 in order to implement zero-grazing technique on her dairy farm. With her loan funds, she is planning to build a crop inventory so that she can store feed for the cows' daily consumption. She will also invest in making water available 24/7 so that the animals can continually hydrate. 

This investment is a game-changer for Nancy's business and will be a boon to her family. The increased income from zero-grazing will go towards the education of her two children, ages 17 and 22.

loans.use: to introduce zero-grazing techniques to her dairy farm

loans.name: Haruna

texts.en:
Haruna, age 32, sells food items such as sugar, rice, maize flour, ground nuts, and cooking oil to earn his living. He is hard-working and operates his enterprise on a busy street in Bundibugyo. To earn an additional income, Haruna also operates video hall shows and runs a motorcycle transport operation. 

Haruna and his wife have four children. His primary ambition is to ensure the education of his children, and he also dreams of building a residential house for the family. At present, however, he is faced with the challenge of inadequate capital.  

He has requested a loan in order to buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.use: to  buy a motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Jemusi

texts.en:
Jemusi, a 27-year-old married man, lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. His main business involves buying and selling cocoa in the markets; he earns additional income from his cocoa plantation. His main challenge is the increasing transport costs that affect his expected business growth. 

Jemusi hopes to expand his business but lacks adequate capital. He is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle and more cocoa.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and cocoa

loans.name: Arnobia

texts.es:
Arnobia es una mujer de 47 años de edad que se dedica a la confección de terceros, como lo pueden ver en la foto su fuerte es la confección de pantalones (blue jean), esta actividad genera 5 empleos fijos y su meta es progresar, expandirse lograr más contratos para que sean más personas las que pueda emplear.
Tiene una metodología de trabajo muy admirable y leal con sus empleados, ella siempre los capacita y los presiona no por su trabajo sino para que abran los ojos y estén dispuestos a montar su propia empresa, una oportunidad que le genero un antiguo jefe y ahora comparte su filosofía.
Como podemos ver en la foto esta mujer es sonriente y muy agradecida por todas las bendiciones que ha recibido, y en el momento está dispuesta a recibir otra, pues está solicitando su primer préstamo en la corporación interactuar junto con su aliado Kiva, le contaron de que se trata el tema y está muy motivada por la ayuda y la amabilidad que puede recibir de cualquier persona en el mundo.
Solicita un préstamo para reparar su maquinaria, comprar insumos como hilos, nylon, broches, cremalleras, botones, tela entre otros.
texts.en:
Arnobia is a 47-year-old woman that works in sewing for third parties, as you can see in her picture her strength is making blue jeans.  This activity generates five permanent jobs and her goal is to progress, expand and get more contracts so she can employ more people.  She has an admirable work methodology, she is loyal to her employees, trains them and pushes them not for her own gain but for them to able to start their own business.  This is something her previous boss did for her and she now shares the same philosophy.  
As we can see in the picture she is smiling and grateful for all the blessings she has received, including the one she is about to receive with her first loan with Interactuar and their ally Kiva.  They told her what the process is all about and she is very motivated for the help and kindness that she could get from any person around the world.
She requests a loan to fix her equipment, buy materials like threads, nylon fabric, brooches, zippers, buttons fabric and others.

loans.use: to fix her equipment and to buy materials like threads, nylon fabric, brooches, zippers, buttons fabric and others.

loans.name: Delmis Carolina

texts.es:
Delmis, vende panes con pollo y ropa, su negocio es móvil y lo desempeña de una de la tarde a cinco de la tarde, lo fundo por la necesidad de generar recursos económicos para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, ella aprendió el oficio con la ayuda de sus padres, Delmis es madre soltera, vive con su hijo y su mamá, hasta la fecha se aprecia que ha sabido administrar su negocio.
Invertirá en prendas de vestir, pan, bebidas, embutidos, aderezos, etc., fortalecerá su negocio con los productos que sus clientes necesitan y elaborara la venta de panes con pollo sin ninguna escases de ingredientes, el riesgo es que algunos ingredientes son perecederos.
Su visión es tener su negocio mejor establecido y contar con los ingresos necesarios para darle a su hijo oportunidades de superación académica.
texts.en:
Delmis sells chicken sandwiches and clothing. She works as a street vendor from 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm. She started her business because she needed to generate financial resources to cover her household expenses. She learned the trade with help from her parents. Delmis is a single mother and lives with her son and her mother. So far it is plain to see that she has run her business wisely.

She will invest in clothing items, bread, lunch meat, condiments, etc. She will strengthen her business by buying the products that her customers need and she will be able to make her chicken sandwiches without running low on any of the ingredients. The risk is that some of these ingredients are perishable.

Her vision is to have a more well-established business and have enough income to give her son better schooling opportunities.

loans.use: to buy clothing, bread, drinks, lunch meat, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Roberto Abraham

texts.en: Roberto Abraham lives in a community in the department of Atlántida Honduras. He is a retired teacher, he has always been dedicated to the breeding of cows and produce dairy products, he is 56 years old; He is married and has four children. Roberto is requesting a loan to buy a solar-powered highest efficiency refrigeration system from Soluz Honduras that will allow him to have a better lifestyle, and a significant growth in the business. He is often providing new options for food in a community that would otherwise have no refrigeration to offer foods such as milk and cheese.

loans.use: To buy a solar-powered highest efficiency refrigeration system

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, maize flour, bread, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in an area with growth potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital.

Ruth will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, flour, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, flour, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Bernalda

texts.en:
Bernalda is 46 years old and has six children. She is married and one of her children is in school.

Bernalda is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Bernalda has been farming rice for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bernalda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania works hard to support her family. Epefania is widowed and has a buy-and-sell firewood business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

Epefania requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of firewood to sell to her customers.

Epefania would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more firewood stocks to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Satenik

texts.en:
Satenik is a farmer. She cultivates potatoes, carrots, and beets on the family's own land, and she sells the products at market. Her husband works as a seasonal migrant worker, but he makes every effort to help Satenik around their farm as well.
  
To expand her cultivation efforts, Satenik has requested a loan. She will use her loan funds to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. This investment will allow her to gather a good harvest that can be sole at a high price, allowing her to earn a better income to support her family.
 
Satenik lives in the village of Arevshat in the Shirak region. Shirak is considered a poor region, where the unemployment rate is very high and living standards are low. Lack of access to loan products, bad market conditions, and high costs make it difficult for people to develop their businesses in this area. Satenik's loan has been approved within a joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to underserved population of the Shirak region. This allows them to improve their businesses, increase their income, and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.es:
Alejandra es una joven de tan solo 23 años de edad ella es madre de dos hijos, una princesa de 7 años de edad y un campeón de 5 años, como su pareja es joven les toco salir de estudiar, postergar muchos sueños por dedicarse de lleno a lo que ahora tienen una familia. Por su parte Alejandra se dedicó a la actividad del comercio, vende mercancía, ropa femenina la cual distribuye en almacenes, a amigos, vecinos y referidos de estos.

Sus clientes en el momento le están solicitando la manera de que les pueda dar un plan de pago que les quede cómodo pagarlo que de momento no había podido brindarles pues aunque saben que sus clientes como ella son muy humildes no podía puesto que trabajaba con un capital muy bajo y necesita el pago para resurtir. 

Esta situación de dar cómodas cuotas es la que tiene a Alejandra solicitando un préstamo y se siente muy motivada con el proyecto Kiva pues esta ayuda la recibirá de cualquier persona en cualquier parte del mundo y de ante mano le dice gracias por apoyarla y ayudarla a crecer.
Con el préstamo que solicita comprara surtido de ropa para mujer como lo son jean, camisas, blusas, faldas, abrigos, vestidos etc.
texts.en:
Alejandra is a young woman, just 23 years old, and the mother of two children, a 7-year-old princess, and a 5-year-old champion. Since her life's partner is still young, he has to attend school, postponing many dreams to completely focusing on his family. For her part, Alejandra dedicates herself to commercial activities, selling merchandise -- women's clothing -- which she distributes in markets to friends, neighbors, and people they refer to her.

At present, her customers are requesting clothes in such a manner that she needs to sell  her merchandise on time payments that her customers can readily pay. At present, Alejandra can't offer them that, fully aware that her customers are poor people like herself. She works with very little capital and she needs to pay in order to restock.

This situation of having to offer comfortable payment plans is why Alejandra is requesting a loan, and she feels very attracted to Kiva, since this source of aid is available to anyone in anywhere in the world. And in advance, she wishes to say “Thank You” for helping her and assisting in her growth.
