With this requested loan, Alejandra will also purchase women's clothing such as jeans, shirts, blouses, skirts, coats, dresses, etc.

loans.use: buy a selection of personal-use products to sell, and offer her customers better payment terms.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Desde 1997 el señor miguel ejerce su profesión como relojero una actividad que fue aprendida y heredada por parte de su padre y la que ahora busca poder dejarle a alguno de sus 4 hijos en algún momento.
Aprendió todo acerca de la relojería gracias a sus padres y al igual que él con este negocio que ubica en una ventana de su hogar genera los recursos para mantener a su pareja e hijos.

Su meta es antes de dejarles a sus hijos cumplir estos 4 ítems.
•	Generar empleo
•	Ofrecer servicios nuevos
•	Que su negocio exista y siga en pie
•	Mejorar las condiciones de vivienda.
Miguel solicita un préstamo para la compra de relojes, pulsos, pilas, cristales, manillas etc., el monto es para comprar relojes en mal estado y variedad de repuestos para reparar y posteriormente vender.
texts.en:
Since 1997, Miguel has carried out his profession as a watchmaker, a trade that he learned and inherited from his father.  Now, he is looking to leave to it one of his four children sometime.  He learned everything about watchmaking thanks to his parents, and also himself.  With this business located in a window of his home, he generates the resources to support his partner and children.

Before leaving it to his children, his goal is to fulfill these four items:
Generate employment
Offer new services
Keep his business running and remaining standing
Improve his housing conditions

Miguel is requesting a loan to purchase clocks, wristbands, batteries, glass, watch hands, etc.  This amount is to purchase clocks in poor condition and a variety of parts to repair and to then sell.

loans.use: to purchase clocks in poor condition to repair, wristbands, batteries, glass, watch hands, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials and start constructing a porch.

loans.name: Los Higos Group

texts.es:
Los Higos es un grupo conformado por integrantes indígenas, la mayoría de ellos aún conserva su lengua materna. Su comunidad se caracteriza por el gran número de invernaderos donde se cultiva el nopal. 

Los miembros del grupo están muy contentos y agradecidos por la oportunidad de recibir un préstamo para invertir en sus negocios: Manuel, Ma Guadalupe, Josefina, Teresa, Amelia y Gabriela invertirán en accesorios para el cabello y joyería de fantasía; Victoria, en trastes; Icela, en artículos de limpieza; José Manuel y María, en sus nopaleras y Eduardo, en lentes.

Doña Amelia es una persona sumamente responsable y muy alegre, tiene 51 años de edad y es madre soltera de un hijo que ya es independiente. Doña Amelia no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, cuando nació su hijo se vio en la necesidad de comenzar a trabajar y comenzó a vender bolsas para el mandado. En su momento fue una actividad productiva pero poco a poco la demanda comenzó a disminuir. 

Actualmente, vende accesorios para el cabello y joyería de fantasía, mercancía que compra en la capital del país donde obtiene mejores precios y que posteriormente vende en las plazas, mercados y ferias de su comunidad. “Me va muy bien en el negocio. Cuando vendo mucho estoy muy contenta, pero cuando no vendo nada eso me entristece. Siempre ha sido así hay días buenos y días malos”. 

Gracias a los préstamos que ha recibido anteriormente, ha podido invertir para comprar mercancía en grandes cantidades como aretes, moños, ligas, entre otros y con sus ganancias, logró sacar adelante a su hijo. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa del señor Manuel quien tiene la playera blanca con el pants azul. Doña Amelia se encuentra sentada y viste un suéter blanco. La mayoría de las mujeres del grupo se dedican también a bordar servilletas para tener un ingreso extra y se pueden ver sus artesanías en su regazo.
texts.en:
The Los Higos group is comprised of indigenous members.  Most of them still preserve their maternal language.  Their community is known for the large number of greenhouses that grow prickly pears.

The members of the group are very happy and grateful for the opportunity to receive a loan to invest in their businesses.  Manuel, Maria Guadalupe, Josefina, Teresa, Amelia, and Gabriela will invest in hair accessories and costume jewelry.  Victoria will invest in dishes and Icela will invest in cleaning items.  José Manuel and María will invest in prickly pear patches, and Eduardo will invest in glasses.

Amelia is an extremely responsible and very happy person.  She is 51 years old, and she is the single mother of a now independent son.  Amelia did not have the chance to go to school.  When her son was born she saw the need to start working.  She started selling grocery bags.  At the time it was a productive business activity.  However, the demand started to decline little by little.

She currently sells hair accessories and costume jewelry.  She buys this merchandise in the capital of the country, which is where she gets the best prices.  She later sells the merchandise at plazas, markets, and fairs in her community.  “It is going very well for me in the business.  When I sell a lot, I am very happy.  However, when I don’t sell anything it makes me sad.  It has always been this way; there are good days and bad days.”

Thanks to the loans that she has previously received, she has been able to buy large quantities of merchandise like earrings, bows, hair ties, and others.  With her earnings she managed to get her son ahead.

*The photo was taken at Manuel’s house.  He has on a white t-shirt and blue pants.  Amelia is seated, and she is wearing a white sweater.  Most of the women in the group also embroider napkins in order to have extra income.  Their handicrafts can be seen in their laps.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of merchandise like earrings, bows, hair ties, and others.

loans.name: Abifaisi

texts.en:
Abifaisi, age 39, earns a living by growing and buying cocoa, then selling it at market. She earns an additional income from selling local brew. She started her business to generate income to support her family and pay her children's school fees. Her main business challenge is limited capital. She lives in Bundibugyo with her husband and their seven children. 

Abifaisi's goal is to expand the business so that she can ensure the education of her children. She would also eventually like to construct for the family a permanent house. 

Abifaisi has requested a loan in order to buy cocoa to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay workers to help him harvest his maize

loans.name: Maria Alifa

texts.es:
María es una viuda de 66 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, dos de ellos tiene su familia y el menor de ellos adolescente que vive junto con ella. Genera el sustento gracias a la venta de mercancía, un negocio que aprendió de un vecino y ese negocio hasta el día de hoy es lo que el que le permite llevar un alimento a su mesa.
Su obsesión es tener un negocio estable, y pagar la educación de su hijo que está iniciando a vender mercancía para apoyarla en todos los gastos.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa, el monto es justificado debido a que la mercancía que comprara será para que ella venda, y una parte para que hijo menor empiece a vender igualmente a sus amigos, y así ambos se apoyen en el sostenimiento del hogar.
texts.en:
María, 66, is a widow. She has three children, two of whom have their own family and the youngest adolescent lives with her. She earns a living thanks to selling goods, a business she learnt from a neighbour and this business up to now is what has allowed her to put food on her table.

María's dream is to have a stable business and pay for her son's education, who is starting to sell merchandise to help with the bills. She is asking for a loan in order to buy clothes. The amount is justified because the merchandise she buys will be resold, and some will be used to help her son start selling goods like his friends, and so both will help with the household costs.

loans.use: buy a variety men's and women's clothes.

loans.name: ٍsawsan

texts.en:
Sawsan, age 41 and unmarried, lives in Irbid with her parents and family. Her father works as a public servant with a low income, and she wanted to help generate income to help him in supporting the family. To that end, she started her own business three years ago, selling home supplies from her home to her neighbors and friends. 

Sawsan feels a responsibility toward her family and wants to help them as much as she possibly can, so she applied for a loan in order to buy more products to offer for sale. This will allow her to increase her income, which will allow her to help improve her family's standard of living.
  
Sawsan has the determination and the willpower to achieve her goals, and she would like to serve as an example to other women as well. She is grateful for your support, which she feels will help her to become a successful woman in the future.

loans.use: to buy household products to offer for sale

loans.name: Zafaniah

texts.en:
Zafaniah, aged 58 years, is married and has 8 children, 6 attending school in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He operates a cocoa business, mainly buying and selling in the markets, and gets additional income from a retail shop. Zafaniah started the business to raise income for his family and school fees for the children. His main challenge is limited capital. 

Zafaniah hopes to expand his business and construct a permanent residential house in the future. Zafaniah has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is a 42-year-old woman from the Kharagauli district. She lives with her parents and has a stable job, earning a fixed salary of 400 GEL. However, the income is hardly enough for her 3-member family, even to cover basic needs. Ketevan requested a loan to earn additional income for her family's welfare. Her loan application was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provisions to business start-up loans to borrowers who don't have access to regular credit products. 

Ketevan plans to use the requested amount to renovate her house and purchase all the needed tools for a dental clinic. She will open a clinic and will get the chance to earn additional income to cover her family's increased needs more effectively. This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase her income and family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To open a dental clinic and earn business income

loans.name: Yenis De La Paz

texts.es:
Yenis, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en  mantenimiento de cielos falsos, tiene 3 hijos, los cuales se encuentran cursando educación básica.

Yenis, tiene un negocio de bisutería, lo realiza desde hace 6 años, lo aprendió de una amiga, antes trabajaba en un comedor.- El lugar donde tiene ubicado su negocio, está a una distancia de 5 minutos de su casa y su hija mayor le ayuda en sus tiempos libres, después de ir a estudiar.  

El dinero será utilizado para comprar más mercadería y a si ofrecer más variedad a sus clientes, que en su mayoría son señoritas estudiantes, el dinero servirá como capital de trabajo.

El sueño principal de Yenis, es ampliar el negocio y a si contratar a su hermana, porque se encuentra desempleada, para que le ayude con las ventas.
texts.en:
Yenis, 38, studied up to 9th grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works maintaining drop ceilings. She has 3 children, who are studying for a basic education. 

Yenis has a costume jewellery store which she started 6 years ago. She learnt the trade from a friend, as before she worked in a canteen. Her shop is located 5 minutes away from her home and her oldest daughter helps her in her free time after studying.

The money will be used to buy more merchandise and so offer more variety to her customers, who are mostly female students, and the money will also be used as working capital.

Yenis' main dream is to expand the business so that she can hire her sister, as she is unemployed, to help her with sales.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and offer more variety to her customers.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.fr: Agée de 32 ans, Elisabeth est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Elisabeth vit à Adidogomé et pour arriver à ses fins, Elisabeth vend des plastiques et du sucre pour gagner assez de bénéfices. Elisabeth s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Elisabeth désire ce microcrédit pour financer l’achat des sacs de sucre et des cartons de plastiques afin de faire évoluer ses enfants dans leur éducation.
texts.en: Elisabeth, aged 32, is a married woman and the mother of two. She lives in Adidogomé. To meet her aims, she sells plasticware and sugar to earn enough profit. She gets her supplies twice a month at the market. Elisabeth would like this micro-loan to finance the purchase of bags of sugar and boxes of plasticware, so she can advance the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase 5 bags of sugar and 5 boxes of plasticware

loans.name: Wend-Biga Group

texts.fr: Le groupe Wend-Biga est à son 12ème contrat de prêt avec ACFIME et jusque là, tout se passe bien. Ce groupe est formé de 2 femmes battantes qui mettent tout le sérieux dans ce qu'elles font comme activité. Aguirata, responsable du groupe est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 sont scolarisés. Cette brave dame fait le commerce des pagnes et des sous vêtements des femmes et cela fait déjà 10 ans. Aguirata a besoin de ce crédit pour acheter plus de vêtements et vendre à sa clientèle. A l'issue de ses ventes, son bénéfice lui permettra de faire certaines dépenses(soins médicaux, habillements,...) de ses enfants tout en continuant ses activités.
texts.en:
The group Wend-Biga is on its 12th loan contract with ACFIME, and everything has gone well so far. This group is composed of two determined women who do business with all seriousness. 

Aguirata, the group’s official, is a married mother of four children, including two in school. This good and honest woman has been doing commerce in 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and in women’s undergarments for ten years. She has need of this loan to purchase more clothing to sell to her customers. Following her sales, her profit will enable her to cover certain expenses (medical, clothing, …) for her children while continuing in her work.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth and women's undergarments to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 56-year-old mother from the Siaya region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married and has two children, 4 and 6 years old. Margaret supports three people in her family by providing income.

For the last 5 years, Margaret has operated a kiosk where she sells cereals, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000. She is taking her 3rd loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which she will use to purchase more cereals. Margaret will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to purchase more maize and wheat to sell to her customers to make more profit

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna lives in Gadu with her family. She is 34 years old and has three children. Edna manages a food stall, selling cooked food for meals and vegetables for income. She wants to increase her sales and is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy additional eggplants, cabbages, chicken, fish and bananas to sell. She hopes to maintain good sales in her business. Additional revenue will be used to pay school expenses.

loans.use: to buy eggplants, cabbages, chicken, fish and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Kitainge

texts.en: Kitainge is a Kiva borrower. He operates a quarry where he produces slabs for sale. Kitainge has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are house builders. Kitainge will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of slabs for resale.

loans.use: to buy more stock of slabs for resale

loans.name: Rene Antonio

texts.es:
Rene, se encuentra acompañado, vive con su pareja y sus hijos, su actividad económica principal es atender un taller de estructuras metálicas, también cultiva granos básicos para el consumo familiar, su taller ya ha ganado popularidad en la comunidad en que vive y lo fundo hace 5 años, es reconocido por ser una persona honesta y responsable.
Comprará láminas, polines, pintura, electrodos, hierro y otros materiales para la elaboración de piezas de metal y así contar con clientes satisfechos, espera que sus trabajos sean de mayor calidad y le generen nuevos ingresos.
Rene sueña con mantener su familia unida y viviendo en mejores condiciones, que su negocio cuente con más clientes y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Rene is married.  He lives with his wife and children.  His main business is working in a metal structures workshop.  He also grows staple grains to feed his family.
Rene's workshop has gained popularity in the community where he lives.  He started the business five years ago.  Rene is known for being an honest and responsible person.  
With the loan, he will purchase sheet metal, beams, paint, electrodes, iron and other materials used in making metal objects so that he can count on satisfied customers.  Rene hopes that his works keep improving in quality and generates additional income for him. 
Rene hopes to keep his family united and living in better conditions.  He also hopes his business gains more customers and that he can pay off his debts.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal, beams, paint, electrodes, iron and other materials for making metal objects so he can have satisfied customers.

loans.name: Sugey Victoria

texts.es:
Con el apoyo de los créditos facilitados por la Microfinanciera Mi Crédito, Sugey ha podido salir a delante con su negocio de elaboración de calzado. Con el primer crédito  pudo comprar materiales básicos como cuero, pega e hilo. Lo cual le ayudo para cumplir unos encargaos que tenía pendiente. 
Ahora, ella solicita un nuevo crédito para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio con la compra de materiales para calzado, con los que podrá hacer nuevos y juveniles diseños, aprovechando la temporada escolar. Sugey espera que su negocio crezca y con  los ingresos ayudar a la economía familiar de su hogar.
texts.en:
With the support of the loans provided by the Mi Crédito solidarity group, Sugey has been able to succeed in her shoe making business. With the first loan, she was able to buy basic materials such as leather, glue and thread which helped her to complete some orders that she had outstanding. 

Now, she is asking for a new loan to continue investing in her business with the purchase of materials for shoes, with which she will be able to make new and youthful designs, taking advantage of the school season. Sugey hopes that her business grows and can help her household financially with the income.

loans.use: to buy materials for footwear.

loans.name: Nympha

texts.en: Nympha, 63 years old, is married and has three children. For the past 20 years, Nympha has operated a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from food vending. Nympha is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business. She works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Deomalyn

texts.en: Deomalyn, 21 years old, is married and has two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past year, Deomalyn has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies. In the future, Deomalyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Ma. Lebilla

texts.en:
Margaret Lebilla operates a general store to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She is married and works hard to support her family. 

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 13,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase more grocery items to sell in her general store.

In the future, Margaret Lebilla would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Walter Alonso

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre de 46 años de edad que se dedica a atender un negocio de video-tienda, es un hombre casado responsable que trata de promover su negocio, hacerlo más vistoso y rentable y luchar contra la piratería.

Su propósito a corto plazo es sostener su negocio que ha sufrido baja en las ventas por la piratería en las calles y en las redes.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de material de películas, tener títulos llamativos, tanto los de cartelera, como los que no alcanza a exhibirse a cine.
texts.en:
Walter, 48, runs a video shop business. He is a responsible, married man who is trying to promote his business, make it more attractive and profitable and fight against piracy.

Walter's short term plan is to maintain his business which has suffered low sales due to pirated films in the street and online. He is asking for a loan in order to buy movies, so that he will have appealing titles. This will include blockbusters as well as films that were not shown in cinemas.

loans.use: to buy Blu-Rays and DVDs to stock his shop.

loans.name: Gencis Yasmin

texts.es:
Gencis, de 26 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, pero su esposo está fuera del país, tiene un hijo de 8 meses de nacido y actualmente ella vive junto a sus padres.

Gencis, es una persona que se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, pero decidió poner su propia tienda, para ayudar a sus padres, este negocio lo tiene en su casa desde hace 2 años.

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar harina, pan, café, jabón, detergente, entre otros productos para su tienda. 

A futuro Gencis, sueña con ver crecer sanamente a su hijo y lograr que su negocio sea estable, para poder generar los ingresos necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Gencis is 26 years old and an enterprising woman. She has a ninth-grade education and is married, but her husband is outside the country. She has an eight-month-old son and currently lives with her parents.

Gencis is a housewife, but decided to set up her own store in order to help her parents. She has had this business in her home for two years. The loan she is applying for is to buy flour, bread, coffee, soap, detergent and other items for her store. 

In the future Gensis dreams of seeing her son grow up healthy, and succeeding in stabilizing her business, so that she can generate the necessary income for her family.

loans.use: To buy flour, bread, coffee, soap, detergent and other products for her store.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad used his first Kiva loan to start up his wedding materials shop. In his shop, he now successfully rents out wedding gowns and ladies' dresses for weddings. He is very thankful to his Kiva lenders for having offered him his first loan, which helped him increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family. 

Ziad has repaid his loan and has now applied for a second loan in the amount of 160,000 YER from Kiva. He will use his loan funds to purchase more ladies' wedding dresses to rent to his customers for their wedding ceremonies. This loan investment will help his business expand and enable him to attract many brides to his shop, allowing him to rent them dresses at good prices. 

As a result of this loan, he will be able to improve his family's standard of living. Specifically, he intends to renovate the old house where he lives with his wife and two children, and he will be able to afford to send his children to a school next year, as well as providing them with the necessary educational materials.

loans.use: to buy wedding dresses to rent to his customers for their wedding ceremonies

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha, 31 years old, lives in Dair Alla. She is married and blessed with two children. Rasha wants to meet the needs of her children, and to provide for completing their education to be successful people in the future. Therefore, she started her own business to be able to help her husband with expenses and to be a productive woman.

Rasha sells blankets to her neighbors and her family from her home. Lately, her husband has been facing financial problems because of the rise of the standard of living, so Rasha decided to expand her work to increase her income. She needs your support to do this, and has asked for a loan to help her to buy more blankets to sell, to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more blankets to sell

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita, age 48, prepares and sells snacks to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for the past eight years. Her husband is a baker and trikisad driver. (A trikisad is a type of bicycle rickshaw.) They live in Punta, Panaon, and have raised five children. From her snack vending business, Adelita earns approximately PhP 2,000 per month. She and her husband combine their incomes to support the needs of the family.  

Adelita has been a member of PMPC for 10 years. She has requested a loan, which will be used in purchasing assorted ingredients for her snack vending enterprise. 

In the future, Adelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her snack vending business

loans.name: Alba Wendy

texts.es:
Alba es una joven mujer de 21 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia la carrera de ingeniería comercial. 
Ella es inteligente, responsable, comprometida con sus estudios, constante, dulce, sincera y muy trabajadora. Sus estudios lo realiza en una universidad privada en la zona Central de la ciudad, un área caracterizada por encontrarse rodeada de edificios que albergan a oficinas comerciales, públicas, restaurantes, plazas y todo tipo de comercios, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 4-16 grados centígrados.
Alba es de tez morena, cabello negro largo peinado a la moda, su lengua materna es el Aymará el cual ya no utiliza porque estudia y vive en la ciudad, y habla español para estudiar y para trabajar. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan en su negocio propio, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con los servicios de agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Ella estudia la carrera de ingeniería comercial y se encuentra en 2 año de 5 años que dura la carrera; disfruta ayudando a las personas, le gusta entender los principios del comercio, su carácter es de servicio. Paralelamente trabaja de forma ambulante vendiendo plásticos como; jarras, baldes, recipientes para comida, etc., “inicie mi negocio con ayuda de mi madre, este trabajo me ayuda con parte del pago de mis estudios…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no tiene horario y puede escoger que días trabajar y que días estudiar, la desventaja es la competencia y la falta de tiempo. Su sueño es ser profesional para crear una empresa y administrarla, ella desea realizar la compra de una computadora portátil y pagar por adelantado las cuotas de su carrera para obtener un descuento. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que estudia y trabaja. 
Es por esos motivos que Alba solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil, pagar las cuotas de su universidad y terminar su carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Alba is a 21-year old young woman. She is single, has no children and is studying toward a commercial engineering degree. Alba is intelligent, responsible, committed to her education, tenacious, sweet, sincere and very hard-working. She is studying at a private university in the city center. The city center is known for being surrounded by buildings that house commercial and public offices, restaurants, plazas and all kinds of shops. The climate is cold and dry with a temperature that varies between 4 and 16 degrees centigrade during the day.

Alba has dark skin and long black hair that is stylishly worn. Her native tongue is Aymará, which she no longer uses because she is going to school and living in the city. She speaks Spanish at school and at work. Alba lives with her parents and works in her own business. They live in their own house, which is built out of brick and cement and has a corrugated metal roof. They have water, electricity and a sewage service.

Alba is studying toward a commercial engineering degree. She is in the second year of a five-year program. Alba enjoys helping people and learning business principles. She has a service-oriented character. In addition to going to school, she works as a street vendor. She sells plastics such as jugs, pails, food containers etc. She says, "My mother helped me start my business. The work helps me with a part of my tuition." The advantage of her business is that she doesn't have a set schedule, so she can choose which days to work and which days to study. The disadvantages are competition and a lack of time. Alba's dream is to become a professional and create and administrate her own company.

Alba wants to purchase a laptop computer and to pay her tuition upfront so she can get a discount. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the two years that she has been studying and working.

These are Alba's reasons for requesting a loan- to purchase a laptop computer, to pay for her university tuition and to complete her university degree.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop computer, to pay for her university tuition and to complete her degree.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk supply.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elma is 36 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Elma has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Elma has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Teojerma

texts.en: Teojerma, 52 years old, is married and has three children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 8 years, Teojerma has operated a broom making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more raw materials for her business. In the future, Teojerma would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her broom making business

loans.name: Linda Raquel

texts.es:
Linda, nuevamente hace la solicitud de un crédito para comprar tomates, repollos, condimentos, bebidas, dulces, boquitas, etc., para surtir el chalet y elaborar las meriendas que ahí vende.
El crédito que anteriormente le facilito Padecomsm y los inversionistas Kiva le han dado la oportunidad de seguir vendiendo en el chalet de la escuela, sus nuevos ingresos han sido de utilidad para cancelar algunas deudas y tener una vida más confortable junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Linda, is again requesting a loan to buy tomatoes, cabbage, condiments, drinks, candy, snacks, etc., for stocking her snack bar and making the snacks she sells there.

The previous loan that Padecomsm and the Kiva investors provided has given her the chance to continue selling in the school's snack bar. Her new income has enabled her to pay some debts and to have a more comfortable life for her and her family.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, cabbage, condiments, drinks, candy, snacks, etc. for supplying her snack bar and making the snacks she sells there.

loans.name: Fidel Alexander

texts.es:
Fidel, está percibiendo mayor demanda en su tienda de consumo por lo que ha decidido solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar granos básicos, bebidas, boquitas, jabón, pastas, etc., así surtirá la tienda y cubrirá las necesidades de sus clientes.
Con el financiamiento anterior ha tenido una gratificante experiencia, puesto que su negocio es más competitivo, a logra atraer nuevos clientes, con las ganancias a remodelado su vivienda y ha mantenido un buen record crediticio.
texts.en:
Fidel's grocery store is in high demand. He has decided to request a new loan to buy basic grains, drinks, snacks, soap, pasta, etc...that way he will supply the store and he will cover his customers' basic needs. 

He had a great experience with the previous loan. His business is more competitive now, he has been able to get new clients. He has remodeled his home, and has kept a good credit history thanks to the profits.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, snacks, soap, pasta, etc...he will supply the store and will cover his customer's needs.

loans.name: Zeninanda

texts.en: Zeninanda, a responsible mother, requested a loan from Paglaum MPC which she will use to increase her inventory. She wants to buy more kilos of fruits and vegetables for retail. This way, she will be able to sell more products which will allow her to earn more money and provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for retail.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is single and a mother of one child. She is engaged in a transport business to earn a living and she makes a good living from this. With her generated income from this business, she has provided for their needs and had successfully repaid her previous loan.

To make her business more accessible and to solicit more clients for the services, she took a new loan to repair her motorcycle used for her business.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and she also wants to improve her living situation.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle used for her transportation business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase her income from the supply of milk.

loans.name: Virgita

texts.en: Virgita is 59 years old and married with four children, who are all adults. Her major source of income is rice farming. She is also engaged in palay trading and sells rice. She has been in this business for 21 years. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her children until they graduated and got jobs. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Virgita wants to expand her rice production to meet her customers' demand and be able to supply more sacks of rice in the market. She is planning for a business expansion for the good of her children and even her grandchildren. She already availed of loans previously to pay for sacks of higher yielding rice seed and now she is re-applying for another loan.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of  higher yielding rice seed

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is 58 years old and lives in Punta, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has 4 children, who are all adults. Victoria earns a living from her commission as a barangay drug store sales attendant. She has also been engaged in the pig fattening business for more than 11 years, from which she earns approximately PHP 3,000 monthly. Victoria has requested a loan to purchase 3 sacks of booster feed and vitamins for her business. Victoria has been a member of PMPC for almost 10 years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other forms of business.

loans.use: To purchase 3 sacks of booster feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
This is Leilani. She sends you her thanks for your generosity because her previous loan has really helped her business. She was able to buy more supplies and products needed to increase her inventory. The loan also helped her provide for her family’s daily needs.

She is very positive that she could improve her business more if you will lend her 45,000 PHP. This new loan will go to additional supplies of sportswear items to sell, like jogging pants, shirts, uniforms for students, and the like. She will also buy more musical instruments, which she also sells. Her customers will be more likely to buy more items if she has more of her products displayed in her store. An increase in sales will result in a significant increase in profit, which will also result in her business becoming viable and sustainable. Simultaneously, she can provide for the needs of her family.

Leilani wants to expand her place of business so she can add more items. She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase sportswear items and musical instruments

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cresilda is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed, and other supplies for her pigs.

Cresilda has been raising pigs for fourteen years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bienvenida is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Bienvenida has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Bienvenida has been in this business for five years. In the future, Bienvenida would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Nestoria

texts.en:
Nestoria is 47 years old and is a very hard working entrepreneur.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Nestoria requested a PHP 2,0000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell.

Nestoria has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a hardworking 51-year-old farmer from Koibarak village located in Kapsowar area of Kenya. In a location in between Kerio Valley and Cherengani ranges, farmers from this region mostly keep sheep and goats because they graze well on steep terrain.

Hellen's piece of land, however, is fairly level because it is situated at the base of a steep contour: This allows her to keep dairy cows.

Hellen is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The additional dairy cow will be of great importance since, from this investment, she is expecting almost a 30% increase in the volume of milk supplied to the market. Returns will be used to service the loan debt. Once the loan obligation is closed, Hellen will focus on meeting her family and business needs.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike so she can deliver her products to the market on time.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a 56-year-old married man with five children and two dependents. He lives in Kasese, Uganda. For the past 28 years, Innocent has been a teacher. He joined the profession because of his love to associate with children. His challenge of low and delayed salary payment causes him to struggle to meet his daily needs. He has hopes of joining commercial farming. Innocent is requesting a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay for school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles, aged 34 years, sells motorcycle spare parts to earn a living, and he currently makes a monthly income of KES 25,000. He is married and blessed with five children. 

Charles intends to use his loan to expand his business by buying more tires, springs, tubes, bolts and motorcycle seats to sell; the additional income will help him pay school fees for his children. 

In the future, Charles hopes to become a wholesaler and distributor of spare parts in the area.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle tires, springs, tubes, bolts and motorcycle seats to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase milk supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
This is Elvie, 32, resident of Batasan Quezon City, Philippines. She is married to Niño, a company driver, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Elvie operates a Piso-Net business. Piso Net is basically a merger of PC rental and arcade rental services wherein customers can pay the services by inserting coins to the machine. There is need, now more than before, for services like these as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who require her services for school assignments. She also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume and office documentation, as well as people who would just love to surf the net and any social network. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 450 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy pay for the maintenance of her Piso Net units used for her business. She will also buy grocery products needed in her variety store. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Elvie desires to expand soon for she desires to give her family a better and sustainable livelihood. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her computer units used for her Piso Net business and to buy grocery supplies for her variety store.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 58 years old and has six children. She is a married woman. 

Marilyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marilyn has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 59 years old and has ten children. Antonia is married and has one child who is still in school.

Antonia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Antonia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Antonia has been in pig fattening for 18 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Antonia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Rosaline is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosaline is 30 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosaline has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Rosaline has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah, 52, is a diversified rural smallholder farmer from Mugirango village in Nyamira area of Kenya. In Mugirango, she has a five acre piece of land where her home is situated. She lives with her husband, in whom she has been married to for 33 years. The couple has four children. 

Norah is seeking a loan to purchase a motorcycle. The motorcycle will be very beneficial to her businesses that range from dairying to poultry keeping to tea farming to grain milling. With all these activities, Norah surely has tons of produce to move around. Currently, transportation of her produce over short distances are her major problem. With a motorcycle, the problem will be solved for the most part. 

If you lend Norah the money, the motorcycle she acquires with it will help with transportation of milk and eggs to Nyabite market, transportation of tea leaves to the tea factory, transportation of processed flour from her grain mill to clients' destinations, and transportation of farm inputs from the market to her farm. 

With all these farm activities, if you're imagining that Norah is a full-time farmer, you are wrong. She's also a career-lady who gets a monthly salary. This means that the motorcycle can also be applied in areas outside farming such as dropping Norah off to her work place and taking her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase a farm transportation motorcycle

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah, 24, practices mixed farming in the Kitutu East location in the Nyanza region of Kenya. She has been married for two years. She liives with her husband and 2-year-old child. She owns two dairy cows, five heads of poultry, a garden of tea crops, and a kiosk (small retail shop). 

Lydiah is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to start a grain mill business in Kitutu East. Most farmers from the area cover long distances to have their cereal produce processed into flour. Starting a grain mill near these farmers will save them time and energy. This investment will also encourage farmers to process more quantities because it is manageable to transport considering the close distance from their farm. 

Income from this investment will be used by Lydiah to clear the loan debt and meet her family's basic needs. She wants a secure foundation for a better life for her infant child.

loans.use: to start a grain mill business.

loans.name: Ofik

texts.en:
Ofik lives in Azatan village of Shirak region with her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and little grandson.

To tackle financial hardships and earn income for daily expenses, Ofik runs a farm. She is sure that she can enlarge their farm and earn greater profit from it. For that, Ofik needs some funds to purchase fuel and fertilizer for cultivation work. So, that's the reason why she asks for this loan.

Currently on her farm, Ofik cultivates potatoes, cabbage, carrots, and garlic, which she sells in the local markets. Because the economic situation in the whole Shirak region is quite bad, farmers here need to work hard to have little success.

Ofik mentions the catastrophic earthquake in 1988 in her native village, which still has a great impact on human health. Even after 26 years through the generations, it is obvious. For many years her region was in ruins, and being the disaster zone, there were few schools and very few hospitals.

Ofik's loan has been approved within the joint initiative between SEF and Kiva, which provides loans to the underserved population of Shirak region, to help them to access markets and earn a living.

loans.use: to pay for fuel and fertilizer for cultivation work, so she can gather income for the family's living.

loans.name: Martha Lucia

texts.es:
Martha es una humilde trabajadora ambulante, con dos mesas, y muchas ganas de progresar monto un negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, no cuenta con un carro de comidas, todo lo hace fuera de su casa y con este negocio se siente orgullosa de generar el sustento para sus tres hijos.
Inicio su negocio pro necesidad económica, ella siempre fue ama de casa y le fue difícil emplearse.
En el momento las entidades la están molestando y le sugieren conseguir un puesto de alimentos, es por ello que quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un carro de comidas rápidas y el resto en insumos para realizar sus alimentos.
Con este préstamo quiere mejorar sus ventas, poder generar recursos para que sus hijos estudien, se alimenten bien, para que tengan calidad de vida y porque no, comprar una vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha is a humble and hard-working street vendor.  With two tables and a lot of desire to improve her situation, she started a business selling fast food.  She doesn't have a food cart.  She runs her whole business outside her house.  She feels proud that her business is able to support her three children. 
Martha started her business out of a financial need.  She was always a homemaker and so found it difficult to get a job. 
Lately, the authorities have been bothering her, and it occurred to her to get a food sales stall.  That is why she wants the loan, to purchase a fast food cart.  The rest of the loan will be used to purchase supplies for making her food. 
Martha wants to use this loan to improve her sales so she can generate additional income that will allow her children to go to school, eat well and have quality of life and, why not, so she can purchase a house.

loans.use: to purchase a fast food cart, as she doesn't have one.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 55 лет, замужем, воспитывают 5 детей. В 1995 году, начала сельскохозяйственный бизнес, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 7,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес, в хозяйстве Гулмиры на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 10 овец, на 1,98 Га она выращивает люцерну. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Гулмира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья коров. Доходы от кредита Гулмира планирует вложить в постройку большого дома для семьи.
texts.en: Gulmira is 55 years old, married and raising 5 children. She started her agricultural business in 1995, using 7,000 som (KGS) as the initial capital. Having been able to develop her business, Gulmira now has 3 cows, 10 sheep and 1.98 hectares of land, where she grows alfalfa. In order to further grow and expand her business, Gulmira requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to increase the number of cows. Gulmira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into building a big house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Abeli

texts.en: Abel is a cattle trader who is thirty-six and married with four children. He lives in Kyenjojo-Uganda. He also sells goats to supplement his income and to support his family with the basic needs. Abel has asked for a loan facility to buy cattle to sell this Easter season. His business would be self-sustaining if it wasn’t for inadequate capital and, like other people in the same business, the prolonged drought. His business dream is to increase the number of cattle he has and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy cattle to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products to sell and expand her work to increase her income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy software for an embroidery machine

loans.name: Sri

texts.en:
Hello lenders! We’d like to introduce you to one of Ruma’s agents, Sri. Sri lives in Yogyakarta, a city located about fifteen hours drive from Jakarta or only one hour by airplane. Sri is happily married, and together with her husband, they have two children. As a main source of income, Sri owns and manages a small stall that sell cosmetics. She joined Ruma since last year and she was introduced to Ruma by a Ruma sales executive who came to her stall. She feels excited to learn more about mobile technology from Ruma’s mobile application. Her community sees Sri as a friendly and trusted mobile provider.
 
Sri has become an agent for Ruma’s layaway product designed for lower income communities called 'Mapan'. Mapan enables customers to save up, little by little, by depositing change at agents like Sri. As their balance grows, it allows customers to make major asset purchases like housewares, appliances, and school supplies for their children. As a Mapan agent, Sri is responsible for processing deposits from customers into their Mapan accounts as well as receiving orders from customers who want to buy products listed in Ruma's Mapan catalog. When a customer orders, Sri will submit the order via SMS and within 5-10 days the product will be delivered to the customer. With Mapan, Sri believes that her community will be able to have access to higher quality products with better prices. 

As seen in the photo, Sri is the one who is holding Mapan’s poster. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to increase the working capital deposit needed to help community members save up for big purchases through Ruma's layaway product called Mapan.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plastic, empty cans, bottles, and old newspapers to re-sell for profits.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.es:
Natividad es una mujer de 52 años, casada, tiene un hijo varón de 1 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida para el almuerzo.
Ella es buena madre, optimista, de buena actitud, generosa, amable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Panamericana’ un área céntrica donde conviven empresas, restaurantes, departamentos, universidades y todo tipo de comercio, de clima templado con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-26 grados centígrados.
Natividad es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que trabaja como constructor y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo y energía eléctrica. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; Conejo lambreado (conejo Cuy rebozado con pan molido y frito, rociado con chorrillana y con guarniciones de chuño p’uti y papa blanca), Chicharrón de cerdo (cerdo Cocido al perol en su propia manteca, con mote de maíz blanco y llajua de locoto), Phampaku (carne de pato, lechón, cordero, pollo y lappin condimentadas. Se sirve con papa y plátanos al horno y ensaladas), actividad que realiza para en el horario del almuerzo de lunes a sábado. “siempre me he dedicado a la cocina, trabajaba como ayudante de cocina, cocinera, lava platos, todas actividades relacionadas con la cocina…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es la experiencia que tiene, la desventaja es que trabaja sola, a veces le ayuda su hijo. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea realizar la compra de mesas y sillas de plástico para atender a más personas y mejorar sus ingresos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que trabaja de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Natividad solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para abrir un restaurante y vender comida tradicional a muchos clientes.
texts.en:
Natividad, 52, married with a son and her business is preparing and selling food for lunch.

She is a good mother, optimistic, has a good attitude, is generous, kind, responsible and hard working.

She runs her business in the Panamerican area, a central area where there are companies, restaurants, apartments, universities and all kinds of businesses. It has a warm climate with a daily temperature that varies between 18 and 26 degrees celsius.

Natividad has a brown complexion, long black hair that she wears in a braid, brown eyes, she is of short stature, robust, and she wears traditional dress (hat, poncho and skirt). Her mother tongue is Quechua, which is spoken in this area. She also speaks Spanish because of the general culture and for business.

She shares her life with her husband, who is a construction worker and her son who is in school. They live in their own house, built with adobe that has a calamine roof. They have well water and electricity.

Her business is preparing and selling traditional dishes, like conejo cuy lambreado (breaded and fried guinea pig with french fries and onions, and garnished with black cooked freeze-dried potatoes and white potatoes); chicharrón de cerdo (pork cooked in a pot in its own butter, with boiled white corn and hot pepper sauce); and Phampaku (seasoned duck, suckling pig, lamb, chicken and rabbit meat. It's served with roasted potatoes and plantain and salads). She works for the lunch hour from Monday to Saturday. “I've always been interested in cuisine. I worked as a kitchen helper, cook, dish washer and all activities that relate to cooking", she says.

The advantage she has in her business is experience and the disadvantage, she works alone; sometimes her daughter helps her. Her dream is to open a restaurant. She wants to buy plastic tables and chairs to be able to serve more people and improve her earnings.

This is her first loan with the institution in the five years she has worked independently.

For these reasons, Natividad is requesting a loan to buy tables and chairs to open a restaurant and sell traditional dishes to many customers.

loans.use: buy tables and chairs to open a restaurant and sell traditional dishes to many customers.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is aged 52, married, and blessed with four children. Marilyn has been selling used clothes in their village for almost fifteen years and earns a net income of PHP 8,000 weekly. 

Her picture above is her transportation which she uses for the delivery of her commodities. Her net income from her business is usually spent on their daily expenditures. Due to insufficient capital for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 28,000 to purchase used clothes to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock

loans.name: Kiptoo

texts.en:
Kiptoo is 31 years old. He is married with one children. He has had a livestock farm business for three years.

He will be using the loan to purchase more milk and hopes this will help him to build a house for his family.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his dairy farm and educate his children well.

His monthly income is KES 5,000 and he has borrowed KES 5,000 to be repaid in one year. He is in his second loan cycle and he repaid his earlier loan well.

loans.use: to purchase more milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk supply.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 58 years old and has eight children. Lydia is married and has two children who are in school.

Lydia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Lydia has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 54 years old and he lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Martin has a higher education as an engineer. For many years he worked in his specialty. Now he is employed but also farming; agriculture is in first place for him.

On his farm he has cows, chickens and bee hives. He says that bee-keeping is a special pleasure for him and he does it with care and great interest. That is why his farm’s honey is very tasty and pure and he has no lack of customers for it. Martin also sells milk, meat and eggs from his farm. His plot of land is not large, but he cultivates potatoes on it. He has also planted a nice orchard there. He gathers apples, pears and very sweet grapes from his orchard. He likes his farm very much and greatly wants to enlarge it; he especially wants to develop his bee-keeping.

Martin is married with three children. All of them are married and they live with their families.

Martin asks for this loan as he wants to buy several beehives, potato seedlings and diesel fuel.

loans.use: to buy several beehives, potato seedlings and diesel fuel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy cocoa for resale

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lina is 43 years old and has five children who are in school.

Lina has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lina has been in this business for six years. In the future, Lina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Zhuzugul

texts.ru: Жузугул 43 года, замужем. У Жузугул среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи вместе с мужем занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 16 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом (KGS). Супруг на тракторе и грузовой машине оказывает транспортные услуги местному населению. Благодаря упорному труду Жузугул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 10 овец, также на 2,0 Га арендованной и 1,6 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль. Жузугул решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на завершение строительства дома, а именно покупку гипсокартона, дверей. Доходы от бизнеса будет вкладывать в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Zhuzugul is 43 years old, married. Zhuzugul has a secondary education, and, to provide additional income for her family, she and her husband are involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business 16 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 15,000 som (KGS). Her husband provides transportation services with a tractor and a truck to local residents. Thanks to Zhuzugul's hard work, today her business contains a cow, 10 sheep, and 2.0 hectares of leased and 1.6 of own land, where she grows beans. Zhuzugul decided to request a loan in the amount of 75,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy drywall and doors in order to finish building her house. She will invest the earnings from the business into further increasing her livestock headcount.

loans.use: to buy drywall and doors in order to finish building her house

loans.name: Aramayis

texts.en:
In the village of Davit Bek of Syunik region lives Aramayis with his wife and his son’s family. Aramayis mentions that he is engaged in farming and agriculture. When he was 15 years old and with his father, he started as a beginner, and now he is a skilled and clever farmer.

Aramayis has cows, calves, bulls, and chickens. His plot of land also is not small and gives harvest both for sale and for his family use. The assortment of his farm products is great and nice; he sells meat, milk, macun (national dairy product), eggs, and also a great range of vegetables and fruits such as potatoes, carrots, beans, beetroot, cucumbers, tomatoes, and greens. 

His farm’s fruits are very sweet and for them he has regular customers; he sells them apples, pears, figs, mulberries, peaches, and nuts. All these Aramayis mentions with great pride since all his life he managed to provide a good living condition for his family  through farming only and he hopes his son will do the same.

This loan he asks as he must start spring sowing activities and he will buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel, and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings, diesel fuel, and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Khoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Khoern, 62, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Cambodia. She is married and has four children. For the last forty years, Khoern has been working as a rice farmer while her husband is a garment worker. To have additional income, she also sells coffee in her village. The current business earns her about 68,000 KHR per day.

Khoern is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. Khoern wants to buy more coffee and materials for making coffee. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and materials for making coffee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Замиры среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 17 лет назад с покупки скота на 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Замиры, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, на 2,0 Га арендованной и 0,38 Га собственной земли она выращивает фасоль для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Замира обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на оплату аренды земли и покупку удобрений для выращивания экологически чистой продукции. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Zamira is 35 years old, married and, together with her husband, raising 4 children. Zamira has a secondary education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry and farming, having started this business 17 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zamira's hard work, today her business contains 2 cows and 2.0 hectares of leased and 0.38 of own land, where she grows beans for sale. In order to continue developing her business, Zamira requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to pay for land lease and buy fertilizers for growing ecologically clean products. Zamira plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business.

loans.use: to pay for land lease and buy fertilizers for growing ecologically clean products

loans.name: Hilda Liliana

texts.es:
Esta joven de 26 años de edad de llama Hilda, ella es una habitante de la zona de Dabeiba, un lugar que necesita mucho apoyo y característico por ser una zona de operación de la corporación Interactuar que como entidad sin ánimo de lucro tiene como propósito activar empresa, junto con Kiva Interactuar quiere apoyar a la señora Hilda con asesoría y un préstamo el cual será destinado para la compra de pijamas y ropa interior.
Hilda se compromete a pagar puntualmente, saben que le están dando la oportunidad de progresar de ser una empresaria más sería, de luchar por un futuro de no solo vender por una necesidad económica, sino que adoptarlo como estilo de vida.
Apóyala un aporte generara un gran cambio en una empresaria que te estará eternamente agradecida.
texts.en:
This 26-year old woman is called Hilda. She lives in the Dabeiba area, a place that needs a lot of aid and where the Interactuar corporation works. It is a non-profit organization whose goal is to encourage business. Together with Kiva, Interactuar wishes to help Hilda with advice and a loan to buy pajamas and underwear.

Hilda promises to repay the money punctually. She knows that she is being given an opportunity to get ahead and become a more serious businesswoman. Then she can work hard towards a future not only out of economic necessity but for a better standard of living too.

Please support Hilda--it will result in a big change in her life and she will be eternally grateful.

loans.use: buy pajamas and underwear for her business

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 45 years old and married to Zipporah. Together, they are blessed with four children, aged 20, 17, 15 and 13 years.

He has had a farming business for seven years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. He has borrowed KES 15,000 from Vision Fund Kenya as his first loan. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, pesticides, animal feeds, animal licks and a milking bucket.

He hopes the anticipated profit will help him buy food for the family, pay school fees for his kids, and provide for the family's basic need. His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable flourishing mixed farming activity, educate his kids well, secure a better market for his farm products and enjoy a better life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, pesticides, animal feeds, animal licks and a milking bucket.

loans.name: Maribic

texts.en:
Maribic runs a food vending business in Dicayas, Dipolog, in the Philippines. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. The business has done well supporting the needs of her family. 

Maribic has local customers and also accepts orders for additional income. Recently, she borrowed PHP 14,900 to purchase more meat and spices for her business. 

She wants to expand her business and would be happy to be able to open a small eatery.

loans.use: to purchase more meat and spices for her business

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Ma. Consuelo

texts.en:
Ma. Consuelo signed up for her membership with PMPC and obtained the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Ma. Consuelo is able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales, these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she took a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to improve and expand her business to sufficiently provide for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce.

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is 51 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She has had a retail shop business for five years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

Rodah has taken a loan of KES 50,000 which she will be using to purchase retail goods, e.g., sugar, salt, soap, etc., and hopes this will help her educate her children with the income earned. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her shop and buy a plot in Kabarnet town.

loans.use: to purchase retail goods, e.g., sugar, salt, soap, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is from Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Unable to sustain the needs of the family with only her husband’s income, she has found ways to attain income through her eatery business. It began with displaying a small amount of viands to their neighbors until she opened a small space for the eatery. 

To generate more income, Marcelina joined Paglaum Cooperative, which helped her in the capitalization of her sari-sari (small grocery) store in February of 2012. She became a MIGS member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

Now, she applies for 14,900 PHP to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for her eatery business. She hopes that her business will continue, so that she can give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store and to pay for additional raw ingredients for her eatery business

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia is 58 years old. She is known in their neighborhood for her sari-sari store. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. 

She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. 

It matters that she has been given a priority, as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to enable him supply more milk to his clients and gain capital to start a retail shop.
